Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	"Thus begin the words of Albucasis."
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	"Oh, children, since I have completed for you this book, which is the last of the science of medicine, according to its perfection and conclusion, and through its explanations and statements, it seems to me that I complete it for you with this treatise on surgery."
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	"For the practice of surgery is much neglected in our region and time, such that it is almost lost to science, its traces are obscured; and there remain only a few small descriptions of it in the books of the Ancients, which are changed over time and lead astray those who follow them, because their intentions are unclear and the strength of this art is diminished."
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	"It seems to me that I should revive this (science) with an ordered treatise, in accordance with the method of exposition and explanation and abbreviation; and that it should come accompanied by illustrations of cautery instruments and other tools used in surgery, for addition to the explanations and preparation of them, which is necessary."
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	"But the reason why there is no good practitioner of surgery in our time is because the art of medicine is extensive, and its practitioner must first be well-versed in the science of anatomy, which teaches the arrangement of the members and their shapes, their connections and separations; and have knowledge of bones, nerves, muscles, their number and proportion; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the locations of their outlets."
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	"And therefore Hippocrates said that 'in name it is great, but in deed small,' especially in surgery."
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	"But as we have already said at the beginning of this book, whoever is not knowledgeable about what we have said regarding anatomy will surely fall into error, which causes many deaths among people, as I have seen happen too often, since some are formed in this science but depart from it without knowledge or experience."
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	"For I saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor accidentally cut an escrophilus tumor in the neck of a woman, and cut some arteries in her neck causing her to bleed profusely and die suddenly."
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	"And I saw another doctor who tried to remove a stone from the bladder of a man in whom it had formed, and while doing so he tore a piece of the bladder, causing that man to die on the third day."
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	"And I myself had already predicted that this would happen, and knew beforehand that he would die because of the size of the stone and the condition of the patient."
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	"And I saw another doctor who received payment from one of our dukes to practice surgery, and attempted to reset the thighbone of a black man who had suffered a fracture there. The doctor prepared himself with ignorance, reset the fracture on top of the joint without leaving room for breathing, using pillows and bolsters with great force."
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	"And he bound him up according to his desires, and applied poultices, and left him thus for several days commanding that he not be unbound. And so it was done until the thigh and knee became inflamed, and this resulted in destruction."
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	"And I was called to him, and prepared to remove the bandages, and thus tranquility was restored and he was freed from his pain."
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	"But nevertheless the corruption had already become established in the limb, so that I could not restrain it, and corruption continued to spread through the limb until the patient perished."
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	"And I saw another doctor who punctured a cancerous abscess and within a few days it became ulcerated and greatly worsened upon its lord."
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	"This is because the caustic humor of cancer is melancholic, and therefore it should not be treated with iron alone, but rather that part of the body which suffers from it should be cauterized."
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	"And therefore, my children, it is necessary for you to distinguish between two kinds of operations with the hand: one is an operation that brings about health, and another that involves danger in the greatest positions."
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	"And I have already mentioned this in every part of this book where operation is associated with error and danger; therefore it is necessary for you to guard against this and leave it alone, so that foolish people do not find a way to speak and dishonor you."
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	"And therefore take up your weapons with solicitude and protection from God, and approach illnesses with skillfulness and steadfastness."
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	"And follow the best way by the grace of God to obtain health and worthy success, and leave behind terrible illnesses that are difficult to cure, and wield your weapons against what causes you fear, so that your trust in your faith and in your name does not abandon you: for more remains to your glory, both here on earth and hereafter, and your sanctity."
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	"Because I have already discussed in some of my writings:"
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"No medicus medicine malae, ne malignos medicos nominem."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	"And I have already divided this book into three parts."
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	"Beginning of the division of the book, and first of the first part."
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	"The first chapter arranged concerning the head, regarding the forms of instruments and the irons for cauterization, and what is necessary in operation."
La divisio de la segonda partida.	"The division of the second part."
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The second chapter, concerning incision and perforation, cupping glasses, poultices, extraction of arrows and similar objects, all arranged according to the forms of instruments."
Divisio de la tersa partida.	"Division of the third part."
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The third chapter, concerning reduction and dislocation, and the cure of torsion and similar things; arranged according to the headings, regarding the forms of instruments."
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	"Of cauterization with fire and with medicine, and remembrance of operation."
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	"And with this begins the treatise of the entire book."
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	"It is necessary for me to say what are the qualities of those who perform cauterization and those who receive it, and in what condition cauterization should be prohibited."
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	"Therefore I say that the discourse on the quality of the cauterizer and cauterized is long and prolix, subtle by science, and secret; many wise men have spoken about it, and they disagree among themselves, but for me to speak about all their discourses would be too lengthy."
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	"And therefore I say that cauterization is beneficial for all conditions universally, whether they have matter or not, except for two conditions, which are those without matter."
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	"In the condition that is dry and without matter, there is disagreement; for some said that cauterization is beneficial in this case, while others said the opposite, that cauterization is not suitable in an illness that is caused by quality and dryness, because fire has the qualities of heat and dryness, and it would not be appropriate for an illness that is dry and without matter to be healed with something that is hot and dry."
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	"And he says that which contradicts this, that cauterization is beneficial in all dry and hot diseases that occur in the bodies of men, for when you compare the body of man and its humidity to the composition of fire, you find the body of man cold."
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	"And I say by the speech of that one, that I have already experienced this many times."
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	"But it is not necessary that there come upon this that which has already been said and practiced in the chapter of cauterization by the last exercise, and to know the diversity of the composition of men and the disposition of diseases in their members, and the causes of these, and the accidents of them, and the space of time for those."
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	"But in other compositions there is no fear on you, and especially in hot and humid diseases, for all the physicians are agreed about those, and they are not disagreed in the judgment with cauterization in those."
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	"And know, son, that the secret of cure by cauterization with fire and its goodness is about cauterization with burning medicine, for fire is simple, whose action does not extend except to the member which is cauterized, and it does not reach another member joined with it without little harm."
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	"But the action of burning medicine extends to that which is near it in members, and often it brings disease into the member which is difficult to heal, and often it extinguishes."
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	"But fire, because of its sublimity and goodness of its substance, does nothing but superfluously. And it is already known to us by experiment and long service in studying the art about the truth of causes; and for that reason I am excused from lengthening my speech. But if it were not that it was not read in my book in this place to you secretly hidden with fire, and the quality of its operation in bodies and of its expulsion by which it expels diseases, with philosophical demonstration, which would serve to clarify your thoughts."
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	"And know, son, that they disagree about the time in which it is convenient to perform cauterization, and they consider the best time to be in spring."
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	"And I say that cauterization is convenient at all times, because the harm caused by the time of accident is submerged in the benefit of what is attracted by cauterization, and especially if the cauterization is for pains or necessary remedies for severe and chronic diseases, which cannot tolerate delay because it is feared that those may come to harm, which is greater than little harm entering through time."
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	"And also do not think, son, that only the common people and foolish physicians estimate this, for those diseases which are cured by cauterization are not always suitable at all times, and they consider that consequence."
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	"And the cause is not as they think for this reason, because cauterization is only in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries up the moistures which are the cause of pains."
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	"But nevertheless, cauterization is superfluous on top of medicine because of the violence of its power and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord."
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	"And it is possible that its disease returns at some hour of time, according to the complexion of the sick and the location of its disease, and the power of fire and what has been prepared in the body from the aggregation of superfluities in it, and what has been acquired by it in its acquisition through foods and similar causes; but the disease in which cauterization has been administered is a subtle disease in a member with few superfluities and moistures, thus as cauterization of the tooth for pain and similar to that one, it is possible that this pain does not return, but it happens rarely."
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	"And moreover common speech is that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, and it is true speech, not because they understand in it what they think, for they believe that there is no cure that profits with medicine nor with any other cause before cauterization."
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	"And the cause is contrary to this; and the intention that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine is only when administering the methods of cure in certain diseases, and those medicines do not help, and therefore cauterization is administered at the end of the cause, and it profits there."
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	"And from now on I say that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the intention which common people and most foolish physicians understand."
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	"And they said in ancient times that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance."
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	"And they said that the place of cauterization does not matter, which is not absolutely true, because I have already proven and demonstrated that this does not happen except in some bodies without others, and cauterization with it is good and better than with iron as they said; but however when you perform cauterization with fire with gold, it is not declared to you, because it is ignited according to the quantity that you want due to the roughness of gold, and because it prepares to receive friction; and if you adjust it on ignition, the gold melts by the fire, and some sheets fall into the fire so that the artisan does not catch them by his occupation."
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	"And for this reason cauterization is performed with iron more lightly and more appropriately to the rectitude of operation."
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	"And I have already arranged this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and have arranged those of the head within the weights, so that later requesting it you will find what you want from it."
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	"Of cauterization for headache due to coldness and moisture."
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers humidity and coldness upon the affected organ whose two causes are: its sodden nature and abundance of flux called catarrh, flowing from the head down to the eyes and ears, and causing sleepiness, toothache, sore throat, and universally all diseases that arise from coldness, such as paralysis, apoplexy, and similar afflictions.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The procedure for this cauterization is as follows: first, you should command the patient to be purged with a laxative medicine that clears the head, for three or four nights, depending on the severity of their illness, age, and usual habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then you should command him to shave his head with a razor and perform that seat between your thighs on a padded bench, and let him place his feet upon his own chest.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then you should place the palm of your hand close to the opening of his nose between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	Yet nevertheless, when your hand has reached the middle of the wound, mark that spot with a thread, and then light the olive-oil cautery whose form is as follows:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Then place that upon the spot marked with thread, in such a manner that it descends slowly, so that your hand is gradually constrained, and you turn it around.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then gently lift your hand up and look at the spot; if you see any of the bone now uncovered, about as much as the grain of an ergot, then lift your hand up again. If it does not return to its previous position with the iron, use another one until such time as you can see that which I have mentioned to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Then take a little salt and dissolve it over the spot and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place it on the edge of the wound, folded in half, and leave it there until the fire's crust is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then dress the wound with tetrafarmacon ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	"And it was said that when the plague remains open, it's better to raise the arm for greater healing."
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	"And some of them said that the backbone should be cauterized inside the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the spongy tissue of the bone is burnt."
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	"And then it should be scraped with something sharp to expose the burnt bone, and then it should be dressed [i.e., treated]."
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	"And others said that when the cautery reaches the end [of the bone], it should be pressed strongly onto the bone until it cracks, and this is the method of small alveoli:"
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	"And they believe that from that place, the fumes of the head expire."
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	"And let the wound be kept open for a long time, and then it should be treated until it is consolidated [healed]."
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	"But I have not seen these two kinds of cautery performed on anyone, except in some cases out of fear; and therefore, it seems to me that it is better with health when it occurs. For the head is weakened by a solution of continuity from this cause, as we have witnessed in other members, and especially when the head of the sick person is feverish by nature."
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	"And the first kind of cautery seems to me to be safer and better. And that one, with that work, is good for health."
Capitol segon.	"Chapter according to [Matthew] xxviii, verse vi."
Del cauteri del cap.	"On cauterizing the head."
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	If chronic and prolonged pain occurs in the entire head of a patient, who uses various remedies such as ointments, poultices, and bandages, but finds no relief even after cautery treatment has been applied, then consider whether the patient's constitution is strong by nature. If the pain is not severe or troublesome, apply another cautery to alleviate it slightly.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	He burned him on the horn of his head with a hot iron cautery until the vein was severed.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the vein and expose the quantity we have mentioned until it touches bone. Then cauterize it with a hot iron at the back of the head where it is called 'the vessel' — which is where a cupping glass is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	Also alleviate your hand in this manner and do not expose the bone because this cautery causes less pain than all other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say that this cautery should be applied in its place, for the cautery with which one burns the horns of the head and the back of the neck is more subtle than that used to burn the middle part of the head. This is how it is done.
Capitol ters.	Chapter Headings:
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Burning for old migraine
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is a sudden pain in the head, or it spreads into the ear, if medicines that relieve headaches are not effective and other treatments have been tried without success, then cauterization should be performed using either an acid cautery or a hot iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	To perform cauterization with an acidic cautery, take a pennyworth of salt and dissolve it in vinegar.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then make an incision with a sharp scalpel at the location of the pain on the temple, so that it is hidden under the hair.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Next, press on the wound with a clean cloth for several hours to prevent bleeding. Then remove the cloth after three hours and wipe away any remaining salt. Leave the wound uncovered for two or three days until it heals completely.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"Then also cure that wound within until it heals."
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	"And if you wish, do this: prepare some burning medicines which I have written in the second treatise on burning medicines."
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	"The manner of cauterization with iron is as follows: ignite the cautery, of which this is the form:"
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	"And it is called 'closed nails', for its head is like the shape of a nail with some curvature, and in the middle of it there is a slight prominence."
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	"And then place [the cautery] on the location of the pain, and hold your hand steady so that the fire is not extinguished, and move the iron gently but quickly."
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	"And if the quantity of fire that is extinguished by the breath is equal to its size, raise your hand so that the artery is not extinguished, so that there may not come a flow of blood."
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then dip it in saltwater and place it on the location, and leave it there for three days. Then apply a poultice with edges, and also treat it with an ointment until it is healed."
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	"And if you wish to cauterize the extremity of the wound according to the cautery method, be careful not to cut into an artery in this migraine properly not ancient."
Capitol quart.	"Chapter Four."
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	"Of cauterization of an ancient migraine."
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	"When you are treating a migraine with what we have said about the previous treatment and the divisions of illnesses, and it does not improve, and sometimes because the illness is such that it does not succumb to the first cauterization with medicine or fire cautery, then you must heat the cautery iron until it is red-hot. Then place your hand on the location of the pain with a line of length equal to half its width, or more if necessary; and pause for a while and press that upon the artery so that it enters into the bone."
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	"But it is necessary for you to guard against the continuation of the jawbone, which is moved by mastication, and that the nerve is not burned nor the nerves that move it, and that there be no spasm."
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	"And if it is about the care and caution of blood flow from the artery that is opened, because there is fear in opening it, especially for those who do not know what they are doing and are not studious nor experienced; leave the operation to him at the beginning."
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	"And I will come with a reminder of the method of dealing with accidental blood flow from an artery according to its manner in its place in this book."
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	"And if you see this illness not abating after this cautery and you see the patient's condition tolerable, then cauterize it in the middle of the head as we have described, and treat the ulcer until it is healed."
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	"And if you wish to administer the cautery we have mentioned in the chapter on the division of an artery with cautery having two points, it is better and more efficient cauterization."
Capitol .v.	"Chapter Five."
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	"Of cauterization of ear pains."
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	"When there is pain in the ear due to friction and it is treated with laxatives and other methods mentioned in the division, but the pain persists, then heat the cautery, which is called 'puncta,' of which this is the shape:"
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	"And approximate the cautery to the ignition, and move it around the entire ear as if it were rolling, or in the circuit of each one if the pain is in one."
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	"Go along with the cautery to the root of the ear little by little until you feel the location with your tent."
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	"And if the cautery is applied at ten points around the entire ear, then press it there and treat those locations until they are healed."
Capitol .vi.	"Chapter Six."
De cauterizacio de turtura.	"Of cauterization of torticollis."
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	"Torticollis that is treated with cautery is only of the kinds that come from a vein, according to what we have said in the divisions of illnesses."
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	"Avoid cauterization of the kind that comes from dryness or spasm of the nerve."
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	"When you treat that type of tortoise with herbs and caperberries and garlic, and your treatment doesn't help, then you must cauterize the patient with three cauteries: one at the root of the ear, another a little below their temple, and the third at the junction of both lips."
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	"And place your cautery on the opposite side of where the wound appears, for healing occurs only where it seems healthy."
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	"And the method of cauterization is to cauterize with the cautery in the right corner at the tip of the ear, then above it a little on the horn of the head, and on the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of your finger's thickness, and place your hand on the cautery until its heat has burned through half of the thickness of the skin."
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	"And this is the shape of the cautery, which belongs to the barber-surgeon, whose shape appears before you on this table."
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	"But even more subtly is what you can see here; and sometimes it's better to cut away excess flesh rather than cauterize."
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	"And similarly treat the location with that which is presented before you until it heals."
Capitol .vii.	"Chapter VII."
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	"Regarding the cauterization of ancient apoplexy."
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	"When apoplexy is ancient and you treat it with what we have said but your treatment does not help and the patient has no fever, then cauterize them in four places: on all of their head's horns; and with a cautery at the middle of the head, as we have said; and cauterize behind the ear."
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	"And the manner of cauterization is made according to what has been said above."
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	"And it should also be cauterized on the mouth of the stomach, and it is more recent; and similarly treated with what you are doing."
Capitol .viii.	"Chapter VIII."
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	"Regarding cauterization for the removal of a stain."
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	"It is necessary to give the patient at the beginning large jars and pills made from powdered myrrh."
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Approach and shave the head of the patient completely, and place on the crown the plaster described in the treatise of plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	Place that one several times, for this is the method of cauterizing
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do thus according to the method already mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if it does not heal well like that, then do three cauterizations on the final part of their head, which should be descending from the highest part of the head to the lowest part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Between each cautery place the thickness of a finger, and promptly cover the cautery with what has been produced
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you add and the illness is tolerating it, then do the cautery in the middle; and if you want more addition, then cauterize on both horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Cover that until it heals; and let the cauteries be olive-sized according to the shape given beforehand
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization for paralysis and softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	When you are proceeding with moistening the head with herbs and water as we have said, and when you have shaved the head of the patient, then cauterize in this way: cauterize first on the middle of the head, and then cauterize on all the horns of the head, and cauterize on the final part of it, and make three cauteries on the spinal bones of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the illness of softening of the body that has persisted and the illnesses are tolerating and the illness is strong, then cauterize in this way: cauterize with four cauteries on the spinal bones of the back, and afterward cauterize on whatever point has been fought from the liver, and raise your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And promptly cover that until it heals; and let this be olive-sized cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cauterization for epilepsy
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	An epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore it is necessary to moisturize the brain of him at the beginning with herbs and with the other cure which we have said in the division when the patient is great and is tolerating except for the exception of medications.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate medications, then administer gargarisms and mastigators for moistening the brain before, for several days, with moderation of food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And promptly shave the head of the patient, and promptly cauterize in this way: with one cautery on the middle of the head according to the manner previously described, and with another cautery on the occupit of it, and on each horn of the head cauterize.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and is tolerating, then promptly cauterize in this way with cauteries as we have said, having paralysis and softening of the body on the spinal bones of the neck and the spinal bones of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let it be olive-sized cautery according to what has been stated previously.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then pause with subtle cauteries according to this manner.
Capitol .xi.	"Chapter XI."
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	"On cauterizing melancholy."
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	"If the causes of melancholy are corrupt humidity and thick phlegm, then cauterize that area with the cauteries mentioned in the case of paralysis."
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	"And if the cause of melancholy is declining excess leading to it, and the body of the patient is humid, then they should drink what clears the brain according to what has been mentioned earlier in this section."
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	"Then shave the head of the patient, and properly make a poultice from crow's foot over its circumference, and also apply that poultice in the middle of the head."
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	"And let the patient sweat profusely, and be held down on all sides."
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	"Then apply a liniment poultice; afterwards, it is worth rubbing with sheep's fat."
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	"And warm that over the fire with gentle heat for as long as it endures."
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	"Then put that on the middle of the head in a circle and let the patient rest until they feel warmed."
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	"And do this with the patient once every week until the boil is healed; or if you wish, cauterize it making small punctures according to how large it is, but holding your hand thus arranged: this is a type of cautery that moistens the brain evenly."
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	"And then apply that poultice wrapped in linen cloth or wool grease."
Capitol .xii.	"Chapter XII."
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	"On cauterizing descending water in the eye."
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	"When you have recognized the beginning of water in the eye through the signs that I have mentioned earlier in this section, then begin and give the patient to drink what clears the head, and keep him from all moisture."
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	"And let him/her sit in a bath of hot water for several days."
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	"And then command the patient to shave his/her head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head; and also cauterize it with two cauteries over both temples if there is an onset of water rising in both eyes, or on one side if it is just beginning in one eye."
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	"Incise with a cautery all the veins and arteries that lie on the nape of the neck, and let the incisions be of this length in the latitude of the temples."
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	"And guard against fluxes of blood when cauterizing. And if you see blood flowing, stop it with some medication that is available to you."
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	"And I will come with knowledge for extracting arteries and for excising them and for cautioning against fluxes of blood."
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	"Sometimes it is cauterized on both sides of the neck between the two bones with two deeply productive cauteries."
Capitol .xiii.	"Chapter XIII."
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	"On cauterizing old tears."
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	"When tears from the eyes are abundant and it is verified that this is superfluous fluid blood, then cauterize it with the cautery that we have described in the chapter on the beginning of water rising in the eyes, and also with a cautery in the middle of the head and with two cauteries on either side of the temples, and with two cauteries on either side of the neck."
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	"And if you need to add more, then cauterize it also on both sides of the cheekbone at the end of the eyebrow with a small cautery."
Capitol .xiiii.	"Chapter XIV."
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	"On cauterizing foul breath from the nose."
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	"When you treat it with what we have said in this section and your treatment does not help, then prepare for him to drink the decoction of cochlearia plants for three nights; and also shave his head, and cauterize it with a medium-sized cautery made from olive oil."
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	"And also cauterize it with a clove cautery with two cauteries above the eyebrows on either side of the hair."
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	"And be careful not to incise the artery."
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	"And this is how you make the clove cautery:"
Capitol .xv.	"Chapter XV."
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	"For cauterization of softening eyelids."
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid becomes softened due to illness or humidity, cauterize that eyelid with this lunar cautery; and this is how it is done:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	If you, cauterize that on both eyebrows with a small cautery in every part, and they are elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	"And do not press too hard on the cautery with your hand, but rather according to how much the third portion of the eyelid is adhered."
Capitol .xvi.	"Chapter XVI."
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	"When the hairs on the edge of the eyelid become converted to parts within and stick out, cauterize the eyelid with a hot iron."
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	"When the hairs of the eyelid become converted into parts within so as to stick out the eyelid, cauterize them in either of two ways: either with a hot iron or with medicine that burns."
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	"If cauterizing with fire, command the patient beforehand that they let their eyelashes grow out as those who are to be plucked, until they are lengthened and hardened; and if any of them are stuck together at their roots, then afterwards you should bind the eyelids with a bandage so that they may not be harmed until the hairs have grown out."
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	"Therefore when they are grown out and hardened, then place the head of the patient on a table, raise up the eyelid of the eye to be cauterized with a probe, having made the probe like the shape of a leaf of a mulberry tree, and its beginning close to the hairs."
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	"And likewise place cotton dipped in alum or in mucus of snail on the eye."
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	"And now ignite the cautery of which this is the form."
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	"And now cauterize the figure you have marked, little by little, in several viewings, until the surface of the sinew appears like a leaf of myrtle, entirely apparent."
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	"The sign of the health of your work is that you see the eyelid of the wound contract and its hairs rise up around the puncture."
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	"And then lift your hand away and leave it alone for three days. And afterwards pause on the wound's edge until the scar has healed."
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"Then heal it with unguent until it is healed."
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	"But if the hairs return for some reason and the eyelid becomes softened again, then perform the cautery once more just as you did initially."
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	"But if the hairs do not remain on the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural position and covered over so that the hairs do not again touch the wound."
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	"But when performing cautery with medicine that burns, command the patient to raise their eyelashes until they are extended and covered over. And afterwards a bandage of cloth in the shape of a myrtle leaf should be made."
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	"And then take some known soap and live wax melted together. And quickly mix those ingredients well and make haste so that it does not cool down. And afterwards spread that over the cloth which was made in the shape of a myrtle leaf and place that on one eyelid or both. And leave the wound's edge wrapped in egg white, and the patient's head should be elevated."
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	"And leave your finger on the medicine and press it gently without moving it until the patient feels the bite of the medicine, for its bite is like that of fire."
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	"And when you perceive that the burning sensation has ceased, then remove the medicine and wipe it away with your little finger. And when the burning sensation ceases, then remove the medicine and wash the wound with water; and then examine whether the eyelid is already raised as if it were washed by the contraction with fire or incision, for this is often the case. And if not, apply more of the medicine to the place where the medicine has not yet taken effect until it becomes covered over and your operation is completed."
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	"And then place on the wound's edge with a border so that it seals the seam of the adhesion. And then dress it with antiseptic or another suitable dressing until it is healed."
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	"And if you perform this operation, it is necessary that with vigilant diligence you ensure that no debris of the medicine falls into the wound. And if the eyelid becomes inflamed after several days and some cause of the hairs touches the wound, then reapply your medicine to that place on the eyelid which is inflamed. And do so just as you did at the beginning, until it heals."
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	"And this is the shape of a myrtle leaf."
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	"And know that the wounds of men are varied according to their size and smallness, and therefore your cautery should be adapted accordingly."
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	"And this secret of correct practice shall not be concealed from anyone who studies in this art."
Capitol .xvii.	"Chapter XVII."
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	"Of the cautery of a fistula that is in the lachrymal gland of the eye."
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula as we have described in the sections on illnesses, and your treatment does not confirm, then you must cauterize it in this manner: command the patient to place their head on their own knees, and hold their head between their thighs by some servant in such a way that it is neither moved nor agitated with its head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place cotton soaked in alum or wool on the opening of the boil or on gauze over the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cauterizing iron, which is shaped like this:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which has been heated, so that it is hot at its tip where the cauterization is performed.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it can be penetrating into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to come out like this:
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	"But that which is concave is better for your task."
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	"And promptly press the fistula if it's open, and remove from it the dirty and wet one."
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	"If it has not been opened, then open it and remove the pus from it."
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	"And pause the cautery over it which has been ignited; take your hand with a little caution, and bring the cautery of the wound to the opening of the nose so that neither you nor the patient is disturbed. Then place the cautery in the wound and burn it there."
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	"If at the beginning of your cautery it goes into the bone, that is good. But if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice as needed; and leave it like this for three days. Then pause over the spot with a border and surround it with drying ointment until it heals."
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	"But if eleven days have passed and it has not healed, then apply a caustic medicine over it until the bone is exposed and scraped according to what is appropriate in its chapter."
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	"And there is another method of cauterizing a fistula which some first said: Enter into the location of the fistula and fill it with that subtle camphor of which it has the form; and melt in that amount of melted lead equal to one inch; then take your hand with careful retention, so that the melted lead does not reach the wound of the patient; and cover the spot on the skin where you inserted it with albumen of egg or water, because lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it through marvelous healing."
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	"And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterization and treatment, that is good. But if not, then it is necessary to administer a tractive agent for the nose and reduce the fistula to the course of the nose according to what will come in its proper place."
Capitol .xviii.	"Chapter XVIII."
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	"On the cauterization of the opening of the ears."
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	"Many times it happens that fissures appear in the lips, and more often in the lips of children."
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	"Therefore, when you treat those fissures with what we have said in the sections and your treatment does not improve, then apply a small cautery iron according to this form that is shown:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	"And let its concavity be according to the subtlety of a needle."
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	"Apply that iron carefully into those fissures until the cautery reaches the depth of the fissures."
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat it with cerote until it is healed."
Capitol .xix.	"Chapter XIX."
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	"On the cauterization of fistula in the mouth."
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	"When an abscess appears in the uvula or palate or roots of teeth and it becomes inflamed, then bursts open, and becomes infected, and pus comes out and a fistula is formed, if you treat it and your treatment does not improve, then you should kindle cautery according to the amount received in the fistula, and melt that heated iron into the tract of the fistula, and hold your hand so that the heated iron reaches the depth of it, and repeat this once or twice; and then treat it with what we have said about treatment until it is healed."
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	"And then if the inflammation is cut off and it is healed, that is good. But if not, then it is necessary to discover the location and remove the rotted bone according to what will come in its chapter."
Capitol .xx.	"Chapter XX."
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	"For cauterization of the teeth and softening of the veins."
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	"When veins are softened by humidity and teeth are painful, if you cure them with medicines without success, then place the patient's head on your thigh, and bring the cautery in this shape near, so that you place the cup over the tooth and quickly insert the cautery into it. Remove your hand a little bit so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth."
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	"And then remove your hand, and repeat the cautery several times according to what you want."
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	"Then the patient should rinse their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, then spit it out, because the painful tooth is hardened and the softened gum is strengthened and the humidity is dried."
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XX
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	**On Toothache Cauterization**
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by coldness or worm within, or medicine does not help the cure, then cauterize it with one of two methods: either cautery with cow's dung or cautery with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	To cauterize with cow's dung: Take some cow's dung and boil it in a pot of iron. Then take some cotton, wrap it around the tip of the toothpick, dip that into the boiled cow's dung, and quickly apply it to the painful tooth before it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this several times until the power of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip some wool or cotton into the aforementioned cow's dung, place it on the painful tooth, and then quickly apply a red-hot iron onto it until the iron reaches the crown of the tooth's concavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But cauterizing with fire is that you wait for the coal or iron to become red-hot and glowing, and then carefully apply it onto the tooth without touching the inside of the mouth of the sick person.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then shape the coal or iron as you wish and apply it to the tooth, keeping your hand away until it cools down. Repeat this several times until the pain is gone, either on that same day or the following day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that after this cautery, the sick person keeps their mouth closed tightly on both sides and holds it like that for an hour, and then spits it out. This is the form of cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize in whatever way you wish, according to what you are capable of doing.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is how the cautery should be performed:
Capitol .xxii.	"Chapter 22."
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	"Regarding the cauterization of extroflexed organs."
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extroflexion is due to phlegm and humors that are not obedient to digestion despite medications, and you want to induce digestion slightly, then take a hot cautery of this shape (illustration follows), having two extremities opened so that the smoke may escape through one extremity while pausing the other ignited extremity over the swelling once or several times until it reaches the center of the swelling.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the swelling is small, then pause the cautery according to its quantity, and leave it for three days, pausing over the wound's edge until what the fire has burned is removed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	Then dress that wound with ointments, bandages, and cloths until it heals.
