Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	"When the sanguissuga is medicated with what we have said in the division of cure with medicines and does not succeed, consider the hours when the throat of the patient is towards the sun, because you will then be able to grasp its tongue with the instrument which we have recommended to you."
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	"Therefore, if you grasp the sanguissuga, extract it either with a small hook or with subtle gestures appropriately."
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	"And if it is not possible for you to extract it with that, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the throat of the patient, and appropriately place in the concavity of the cannula an iron wire heated on fire, doing this several times (until the sanguissuga is dead and removed from the throat), and abstain from giving the patient water all that day."
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	"Then appropriately take a vessel full of warm water and apply the mouth of it to that (the patient's mouth), and wash the mouth with that; and do not allow any cause or water to remain in it, but remove all the water after an hour again with your hand, for the sanguissuga immediately begins to feel the water."
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	"But if it is not forgotten what we have recommended, then fumigate the patient with cinnamon or asafetida through the instrument which we have recommended for the fumigation of the uvula."
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	"Do this, and then in a quarter of an hour you may give him something to drink."
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	"Ignite some coals in a bowl covered with cloth pierced at its center. Place the tip of your instrument through this hole and begin inhalation. Position the patient's mouth over the tube's end, sealing it to ensure steam enters their body until you feel the blood vessels dilate."
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	"If not, you should repeat the inhalation several times, refrain from letting the patient drink or eat salted foods and fruits, avoid drinking water, and ensure they follow this regimen diligently."
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	"This is the shape of the instrument used to remove blood clots from veins. It resembles forceps but has some curvature:"
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	"...and its tip resembles the beak of an ibis, serrated like a rasp to prevent it from slipping when grasping vessels."
Capitol .xl.	"Chapter XL"
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	"This chapter deals with the treatment of boils and their incision."
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	"Abscesses are various types, having many forms, according to their memory recalled in this book."
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	"And they differ in perforation and section of their form by two methods: one is for the species of abscesses within themselves; and what we learn about humidity."
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	"And the second method is near the places where accidents happen to the body, because an abscess that occurs in the head differs from one that occurs in the buttocks; and an abscess in the fleshy place differs from one that occurs at the joint; and each of them has its own treatment through surgery."
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	"And more about abscesses, some of which should not be perforated but rather await their natural ripening or completion."
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	"And there are other abscesses that must be opened when they are hard and not ripe according to their completion, such as those that are near the joints. For an abscess when it is near a joint, its essence extends into what is in its circuit, and often its ligaments or nerves of that joint become corrupted, which causes contraction of that member; or it is near a main member, and if you delay its opening until it is ripe, it can harm the main member; or it is near the buttocks, therefore open one that is not fully matured. And do not perforate it in crude condition with incomplete digestion, but rather that which is near the buttocks, so that it does not corrupt the anus and extend into the inner parts of the buttocks, and cause a fistula to be formed, or else let it heal without being opened."
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	"And so you should know the time for opening an abscess, and that is when it has ripened."
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	"And you should know that an abscess is ripe when there is cessation of pain and fever, and around the decrease in redness and swelling, and the sharp point of the abscess, and other signs."
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	"And because you should know that the opening should be made where there is purulent matter, away from the abscess itself, and coming from the summit of its swelling."
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	"And always make the opening along the length of the flesh or body, if the abscesses are in the regions of the thigh or calf, and in locations of the sinews, nerves, arteries; and finally, in all locations where it is suitable; for those that are reflected, use reflection in opening them."
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	"But when the abscess is in a fleshy location, it is better to leave its opening until digestion has fully confirmed its completion, as we have said; for if you open it before that time, the wound of the abscess will lengthen and become very dirty, and often its lips are hardened and the depth of it increases."
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	"But some abscesses must be opened across the width of the flesh or body due to necessity, or according to what that member requires."
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	"And you should make a small opening for large abscesses and wide or multiple incisions according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses."
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	"And there are other abscesses in which it is necessary to make an incision with a curved blade and cut it when it has been made, as soon as it has reached its completion, such as those that happen in cases of dropsy and buboes."
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	"And there are those that are incised with three angles of sectioning; and there are those in which it is cut like the figure of a miter leaf, such as the abscesses of the anus."
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	"And there are some in which round sectioning and crescent-shaped sectioning are used, similar to those."
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	"But for those abscesses that do not present themselves as deeply seated abscesses, you should open them with a superficial or flat opening only."
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	"And when the abscess is large and has collected much pus, you should open it but do not try to remove all the pus at once; take out a portion of it, then pack the abscess again the next day, gradually removing larger portions each time until it is completely emptied."
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	"And especially if the patient is a young child, woman in labor, infant, or elderly person in a state of decay; for many times the vital spirit is resolved along with the exit of the pus, and often the patient dies while being operated on."
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	"So be very careful with this chapter, and especially when opening these abscesses, you should clean the wounds and consider whether the wound of the abscess is small or a flat section; then administer the proper dressings or old rags. And if the abscess is large and the incisions are wide, then you should pack each wound separately until they heal together."
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And if a portion of the blade or curvature is cut off in the abscess, you should fill it with old lint or thread made from linen cloth, just as when dressing wounds without moisture. Then tighten it on the third day and proceed to treat it with what is appropriate for wounds until it heals."
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	"But if blood flows during your operation, then administer water boiled with vinegar in which a linen cloth has been soaked, and place it on the location of the bleeding many times."
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	"But if the bleeding persists, then you should administer remedies and treatment, using the powders that I have recommended in many places throughout this book and its divisions."
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	"But if it is wintertime and the location of the abscess has many nerves, then you should sprinkle powders made from hot wine and oil on that location."
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	"And if it is summertime and the locations are fleshy, then you should apply powders moistened with water and oil or wine and oil, all of which has been heated until the third day, as we have said. Then drain the abscess, clean it, and administer whatever is appropriate for its treatment until it heals."
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	"And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of treating abscesses in general; but according to the method of distinction, I have already mentioned how each type of abscess should be treated individually."
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XLII.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Chapter XLII: Incision of Abscesses that Occur on the Neck
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the neck, small abscesses occur, and they are of a type that contains tunics that are made from them; and there are many species of them.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And among them are pimples, and some contain moisture like lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And among them are those that contain moisture resembling dust, similar to them; and some are stony and hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	In the incision of all of them, and in their extraction, there is nothing to fear, for you should know that their extraction does not cause great injury.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	The operation for incising them is that you express them with an instrument called the trephine, whose form is shown below, until you know that it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what it contains is moisture, then cut it open with a longitudinal incision using a superficial incision according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin the incision along line BG until line FG. Then, once the moisture has been evacuated, strip away that which contains this moisture, leaving nothing behind, for it often returns if some cause remains.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	Then immerse the wound in Egyptian ointment, if available, or else in water and salt. Fill it with this and leave it for another day, for with this you will corrode all that remains of its film.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	"Then repeat this operation on that area with Egyptian ointment secondly and thirdly if necessary, ensuring there is no remaining cause of that inflammation; then treat the wound until it is healed."
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	"If an abscess contains fat knots, then you should cut into it following this shape:"
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	"The section should have the shape of a cross, and cut incisions between its two lips and tear it apart entirely, exerting your strength to extract the tunic that contains it."
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	"But if your attempt fails, then do what I told you first."
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	"And similarly perform the operation and treatment on an incised abscess according to what I have told you; incision over an incised abscess is easier because it contains little blood and humidity."
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	"And sometimes there are cases of these abscesses that occur on the head in some people who have little humidity; this is why you should not cut into an abscess on the head of an elderly woman and tear it apart like a deaf, rough, white stone which cannot be broken down, otherwise she would be harmed by it."
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	"But in other accidental abscesses on the head that are not mentioned here, such as those that appear on children's heads or behind the ears, their incision should be a superficial one."
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	"And leave the perforation of those whose bottom is lower so that the body may be relieved from low-lying inflammation."
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	"And then treat those with what is suitable for their treatment."
Capitol .xlii.	"Chapter XLII"
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Scrofula section: Those that occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these tumors appear on the neck, armpits and groin; sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck are many and are often engendered between them, and all scrofula of these is within its own tunic, as in the nodes and tumors of the head, as we have discussed.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the types of these scrofula are many; for some are lapidary [hard and stony], others contain moisture, and some are malignant that do not yield to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that which is seen to have good disposition at the Touching, whose color appearing is somewhat like the color of skin, and is swollen in every part, and not annexed with the nerve of the neck, nor with the veins, nor with the artery; and is not tender; you should incise it with a superficial incision from above downwards on the line G.B., and cut out all that is swollen, and extend the lips of the skin with forceps, or with many forceps if necessary, as we have said in tumors of the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more caution that neither vein nor nerve be incised.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the spatula not be too sharp, so that you do not hurt yourself with the incision, or worsen the illness, and incise only what is necessary to incise; for if you should incise a vein or artery and hinder your operation, then apply immediately to the wound powdered vitriol trisulphate or other powders which stop bleeding, and press the wound, and let it remain until the swelling of the tumor has ceased and the wound has begun to be mollified and healed.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When blood is absorbed.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore return to your operation before it is completed.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And therefore ask him about his teeth if there is any cause of the other little sores; then cut those and cleanse them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is on the right side of the scrophulus, cover that area so you do not cut into that scrophulus itself.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Then cover that with a cloth doubled over tightly and let it fall by itself without hurting him.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	"Then fill the cloth with hot old urine that you have already soaked in Egyptian ointment, and then wash it."
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	"And if you cut into that entire boil, then immediately adjust the two lips of the cloth and bind it tightly so that there is no excess."
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	"But if there is still excess after cutting into the boil because of its size, you should then widen the incision and draw it out, apply stitches and do what has been said."
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And for those boils that contain moisture, pierce it with a superficial perforation where the point of maturity appears, and pause the perforation so that no pus escapes from underneath."
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	"And after piercing, apply ointment and compresses like those mentioned earlier, so that it burns what has come out of the boil."
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	"And when you see that the wound is already clean, then apply ointment made from powdered guaiacum wood until it is healed."
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XLIII.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of section of the boil of an accidental aposteme within the scrotum.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancient ones called this section in the epilogue, and we have not seen anyone in our land who had it done.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of their speech.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men there is danger of injury to the epididymis, which should be avoided, because if it is cut, there will be harm since all the veins and major blood vessels are located here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	However, in those who have scars on the mouth or cheek or two ears, when the illness is not on the canal, it is necessary to avoid the section of the epididymis to escape the damage that is caused by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to do this, we should incise the epididymis at three circles from the circles of the epididymis, or four with a small section across its width in those that are between two circles in quantity. The incision should be made in the skin, not in the cartilage, and this place is convenient for the section because it is devoid of flesh and blood vessels.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the physician is afraid [of causing injury], then he should extend the cheek ligament with one hand and carefully cut the ligament towards the canal, but avoid the blood vessels if there is any cause for that.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then incise the epididymis according to what has been recommended above; this is indicated by the swelling that appears on the canal, which is due to its rupture and the absence of voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	Leave the wound uncovered for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, when the hour has passed in which perforation is feared, approximate the two lips of the wound's ligament, and then sew only the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then apply medications that promote wound healing and tissue regeneration.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the sum of what we have recommended is that there are some apostemes that have closed off the throat of the patient, and the illness has come on suddenly and the air passage is obstructed. Some people go to incise the epiglottis so that the patient may breathe through the wound for a little while and thus be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	"The patient should be commanded to let the wound open until the evil of the illness is consumed; and this will take three days. Afterward, command it closed, and care for it until healed."
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	"I saw that a servant had taken a knife and stabbed herself in the collarbone and thereby caused injury to part of the lung. I was called upon for treatment, and when I arrived, she groaned like one dead, and I uncovered the wound and drew out blood which was flowing from it."
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	"So I confessed that she had not injured any vein nor artery, and the wind came from the wound, and I treated her until she was healed."
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	"And it did not happen to the servant that she lost her voice; however, some days later she returned for further treatment of her condition."
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	"Now you say that in the section of the epilogue there is no fear."
Capitol .xliv.	"This is Chapter XLIV."
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	"Chapter on aposteme which occurs in the collarbone outside, and is called hernia of the collarbone."
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	"This aposteme, named hernia of the collarbone, is a large aposteme according to the color of the skin, and is more common in women."
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	"And it occurs in two ways: either naturally or accidentally."
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	"In nature, it is not born to cure."
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	"And accident occurs in two ways: one is similar to fatty tumors, and the other way is like an aposteme that is formed by the rupture of an artery, and this is feared."
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	"And only those who are skilled in medicine should use cautery, not those who presume to do so without being asked."
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And if you find that it is similar to fatty tumors and not attached to any veins, then incise it like nodes and remove it with water and a scalpel from the skin and bursa; but if not, then examine its entire nature and apply appropriate treatment until it heals."
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLIV
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	"On the sectioning of kinds of nodes."
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	"I have already mentioned all the kinds of nodes and their divisions in this chapter."
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	"And it is necessary that I explain again the difference between a node and an abscess, so as to avoid confusion."
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	"Therefore I say that in an abscess there is heat and fever and intense pain until the effusion of superfetation is calmed; but it becomes complete putrefaction which then stops the fever, the pain, and the heat."
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	"But a node does not have heat nor fever nor pain, and it contains cheylymph or the liquid that is in its proper sac."
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	The skin appears dark and the onset is sudden like lightning, it occurs thus suddenly, greater or lesser, there are two species: some are fat and contain moisture, and the colors of the moisture are diverse as I have described in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you arrive at the treatment of a nodule, examine it and ask what instrument is called "intromes", according to which its form will appear in the chapter that follows.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	This is the method of inquiry for apostemes and all kinds of nodules: take this instrument and insert it into the moist place that you find in the aposteme, and rotate your said instrument slowly until you know that it has penetrated the bone.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And finally, move your hand according to the size of the aposteme, and then withdraw the instrument and observe what is issuing from its trace.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the flowing moisture has been forgotten, regardless of its color, then you should incise it with a superficial section as I have said for other apostemes.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moistness issuing from the trace of the instrument, then you should know that it is fat.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry it with a section having the shape of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	"Thus as you have instructed, suspend that with tongs, cut the chain from all sides with ease, and guard or preserve the skin or bag if possible, then extract that stone."
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	"However, if it has broken during the operation, it is not possible to extract that stone, therefore many times we leave it there, and afterwards you can crush it into pieces so that nothing remains."
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	"For if nothing remains of it, few or many, the knot will return according to its nature."
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And if some small part remains of it, then complete the wound with some powders of sharp and strong corrosives, clean the wound, and place over that which sits in cautery, and cure that with another cure until it is healed."
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	"And if the knot is large, then cut both lips of it and cure it with what encircles it."
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	"But if there is a pulsating vein on the opposite side, or non-pulsating, then tie it and empty that place of zigzag which is vitriol, leaving it so for two days or three until the wound dries up and the ebullition of blood ceases; and afterwards return to cutting what remains of the knot."
Capitol .xlvi.	"Chapter XLVI."

Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	There are made of lemon peel, round with some length, and they are thin.

You should use these types of cupping glasses that are large, medium and small in number, so that by those removed the flow of blood can happen quickly when necessary, but otherwise they are not medicine.

Do not use these for removing blood from any part of the body, and only use them on fleshy areas such as the thighs, buttocks, arms, breasts, abdomen, and groin, similar to other moist fleshy areas.

Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter XLVI
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the care of the breasts of men, which resemble those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Sometimes the breasts of some men become enlarged and puffy during sleep, and they are also large and resemble those of women with prominent nipples.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if anyone has what was said above, it is necessary to make an incision in the shape of a crescent moon like this, from line B to line G, and then remove all the thickness, and then fill the wound with medicinal powder, and then close the two lips of the wound with stitches, and cure it until it is healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast is declining towards the sides and becoming softened by its size, like those of women that are hanging down, then it should be cut in two on both sides, with two incisions like a crescent moon shape, each containing the other at their end so that the larger line contains the smaller one, like this from line B to line G. And then remove the chain which is between the two lips of the wound, and reduce the swelling, and apply what we have said about stitching and powders as necessary in the care until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if you do not make the incision that is necessary because of the restlessness of the illness and the flow of blood, then it is necessary to fill the wound with cotton soaked in corrosive ointment and leave it until what has been corrupted has rotted away, and then cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter XLVIII
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of the perforation of abscesses that come from the glands under the armpits.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	"These are boils that come from beneath the skin, of a type similar to scrofula, hard, containing pus that can be extracted."
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	"And of those that contain moisture; and those that contain moisture should be incised with a crescent-shaped cut according to this figure: from line G to line B. And when all that is inside the boil has been evacuated, then fill it with cotton wool and leave it for another day."
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	"And as long as the cotton remains, it should be dressed with an appropriate ointment until it heals."
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	"And if the boil is of the kind called 'nodes', or scrofula, then incise it as we have said in the section about scrofula."
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	"And if the boil has spread to such an extent that it becomes gangrenous, then apply a cautery as we have said before."
Capitol .xlix.	"Chapter .xlix."
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	"Of the incision of boils that occur by chance or by vein."
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	"When an artery is broken and the blood coagulation is above it, then often a boil occurs. And the signs by which it can be known whether inflammation and boil are due to an artery or vein: for when a boil is due to an artery, it is long and adheres to the front of the chest; and if you press on the boil with your fingers, you hear stridor."
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	"And that which is due to a vein returns towards the centre of the body."
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	"And the incision of this boil is an error, especially in those that are on the sides of the hips, and in the armpits, neck, and many other parts of the body; and if it is large, then its cauterization with iron should be avoided, and if it is on the extremities or head, it should also be avoided."
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	"However, regarding that which occurs due to inflammation of the mouth of an artery, incise in the direction of the cord at its length; and then make a small opening with a knife near the artery, and remove the tunics until it is exposed."
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	"And then take that needle and make it penetrate into the other side; and tie the artery with double thread in two places, — which causes you to have this evidence in the extraction of both arteries which are in the temples."
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	"And then punch the place that is between two ligaments with a spatula until all the blood there has been extracted and the boil dissolved."
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	"And then apply a dressing in which pitch is generated so that the ligaments fall down; and also treat it with appropriate ointments until it heals."
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	"And if it is a boil due to the section of a vein, then you should hold with your hand what you can of the boil with the cord; and then insert the needle on the side of the place that you have held with your hand, and make it penetrate; and tie it with double thread so that you extract it from the other side, and then ligate the boil with two strings according to what I have told you in the liament of grape 4 of two parts with two extremities of the thread."
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	"However, if you fear that the thread may be extracted, then insert the thread with that needle on both sides of all the boil near the first incision of the needle, and tie the threads in four places."
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	"Then dry the boil in its middle until it is completely dried out; and then incise the cord's superfluity, and leave what remains tied."
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And then pour over it the powder that you have submerged in wine and oil; and then apply the dressing made with calves and ointments until it is healed."
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	"Chapter on the boil that occurs due to torsion of nerves."
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	"Just as a boil can occur in an artery and vein, similarly, a boil can also occur in nerves when they are struck or due to excessive effort, and for similar reasons."
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	"And it usually happens in the places of the tendons or the heel, or in any place where the joints are strained."
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	"And it is a severe boil, and it resembles the color of another body, and it is in its greatest expansion without any opening when it is strongly stretched; then there is pain like stupor in it."
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	"And it is not aggregated in the front of the body; rather it is on the side of the cord, and it is swollen throughout its entire extent without going before or behind."
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	"Therefore, those that are in the joints should not be wrapped with iron, for it would cause great contraction."
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	"But those that are on the head or forehead can be incised with a spatula."
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	If the abscess is small, then treat it with a lancet and cut it open lengthwise.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if it is large, then suspend it with a hook, cut it open, and drain it; then approximate the edges; and close it with sutures, and dress it until it is healed.

De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the treatment of prominence of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Prominence of the navel is caused by many causes: either by fissures of the skin which is on the belly, and they come from it the tissue or bowel according to what happens in other ruptures; or by blood which flows from a vein or artery according to what has been said before, or by obstructed wind in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is due to a fissure of the skin and escape of tissue, then the color of the abscess will be similar to the color of the body; and it is painless, and appears in various locations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is due to an extrusion of bowel, then its location will be similar to what we have described before, but with greater diversity; and when you press on it with your fingers it disappears, and then returns; and there is a loud sound with it, and much swelling occurs at the entrance of the bath and violent turmoil.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is due to humidity, then it will be painless and will not disappear when you press on it with your hand, nor will it become constricted or distended.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to blood, then the abscess appears blackish declining.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	"If it's flesh, then it's a severe, large, hard boil that is formed in abundance."
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	"If it's due to windiness, then its touch is painful."
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	"And its operation is that if the prominence of the navel is due to arterial or venous blood, or windiness; then you should refrain from treating it, because in this case there is fear and dread, as I have taught you in the chapter where I discussed boils caused by arteries and veins."
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	"And if the prominence of the navel is due to an abscess or tissue, then you should order the patient to hold their breath while lying down on their back with their arms extended. Then, feeling around the entire circumference of the navel with your thumb, order them to face upwards between your thighs but resting on their shoulders. Then circumcise the area around the navel using a broad spatula, as you had previously felt with your thumb. Next, extend the upper part of the boil using a large hook. Finally, ligature the area with strong flax or thread in a proper manner."
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	"And then cut the center of the extended boil from its base and insert your finger into that opening to search for the abscess. And if you find it adhering to the membrane, then carefully extract it and push it towards the inner parts of the abdomen."
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	"And if you have found tissue, then grasp it with a hook, and incise its excess."
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	"But if it is contrary to your artery or vein, then circumcise that spot and return to your operation. Then take two needles, tie strong threads on each one, and insert the needles into the circumference you have made around the boil in a cross-like manner, penetrating them deeply. Finally, stretch the boil in four directions over the needles."
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And if you wish, remove the needles and leave that space open so that the stretched skin may fall back into place by itself. Or incise that area when it has become sufficiently softened and then falls back into place, and finally cure that area with whatever is appropriate for wounds until it heals."
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	"And if the prominence of the navel is merely an accumulation of flesh due to moisture or humidity, then it is necessary for you to cut into the boil as we have said and drain out the blood or moisture that you find there. Then cure the area with whatever is appropriate and promote healing."

De curacio de cranc.	"On the treatment of cancer."
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	"We have mentioned in the division of species of cancer and its manner of approach to cure it with medicines, and that surgery is avoided for fear of ulcers; and we have said that cancer is generated in the greater and lesser omentum of the abdomen."
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	"And ancient authors have said that sometimes cancer can be in places where its eradication is possible, such as cancer located in the breast or the skin and its surroundings, which should all be removed."
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	"But when it is advanced and grave, nothing should be done near it because it cannot be healed from that place."
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	"And the operation on it is when located as we have said, to first alleviate and leave behind black bile for some time, and then drain that if there is an obvious tumor."
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	"And then prepare the patient for surgery in the location where it is located, and also prohibit during the operation some things that are harmful to him; and also remove everything from all parts with good careful excision so that there remains no cause of relapse of cancer."
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	"And let the blood flow, and do not remove it lightly, and squeeze the places, and absorb the thick blood all with your hand or with an instrument which is within your power of the instruments."
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"But if it is difficult for you to absorb thick blood from the incision of a vein or artery, then cauterize that until the flow of blood stops, and then treat him with other remedies until he is healed."

De curacio de ydropici.	"On the Treatment of Hydrocephalus."
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	"We have already explained, in the division, the types of hydrocephalus and the symptoms of each type, as well as their treatment with medications."
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	The one that is treated with iron is only the species of arthritis alone, and it is not approached with iron to the species of tympanites or the species of dropsy, because this is deadly.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated this species of tympanitic dropsy with medicines and your treatment does not confer, then consider whether the patient has already attained debility from another illness, such as if it is in their lungs or intestines and similar ones. Then beware that you do not treat them with iron, for there is fear concerning this.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the illness of excessive virtue and in it there is no other illness but dropsy alone, not child nor old, then the manner of operating on it is that you raise the patient between your arms, and the servant presses their stomach with his hand, expelling the water from below their navel towards the right side of the abdomen, and then take a sharp-pointed spatula according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	Let it be double-pointed long and pointed at both extremities like a spatula, but nevertheless let there be some shortness little by little in the middle of it, so that in the operation you do not go inside the belly with it, and wound him.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider whether the generation of dropsy is from the bowels, for then it is necessary that you with the section make an incision along with the navel by about three fingers' breadths on the sides, on the right side above the pubis.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of dropsy is from an illness of the liver, then your section should be on the left side of the navel by about three fingers' breadths.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation of dropsy is from the spleen, then your section should be on the left side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not make your incision above the side towards which you wish the illness to go, so that the superfluities do not flow to that place freely.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then pierce with the instrument all the way through the canal, and enter that section with it, elevating your hand with the spatula between the canal and the siphon, and you will expel it; and if the amount is like one fingernail or more.

E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then extract it and insert an instrument whose form is thus:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is similar to a silver cannula; it is made of silver or iron or latten lion, at which on the lowest part there is a small hole, and on the sides there are three holes: two on one side and one on the other side; and its extremity is cut like this, thus like a feather:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	"At the outer end of him, there is placed an armilla, because when the instrument reaches the water, then that immediately descends upon the instrument, therefore it evacuates as much water at once, for if you evacuate more than what is necessary at the moment, it may cause the patient's death by resolution of his animal spirit, or bring on a convulsion close to death."
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	"Evacuate that according to the quantity of its virtue and according to what you understand about the dispositions of the patient's virtue, pulse, and complexion."
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	"And when you remove the instrument, then retain the water which is retained by the cord that retains the tube that is over the siphon of which you are to pierce it in that manner."
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	"And if you repeat the procedure on another day if the patient can tolerate it, then extract a small quantity of water, and do this for several days continuously, being careful that there remains little or no water."
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	"But if you extract too much water from the patient, then treat him with earth burial, and much sweating in baths, and await him long in the sun; and treat him with drying medicines until he is healed."

De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	Of the treatment of children who are born with the urinary openings unperforated.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Some children sometimes are born from their mother's womb with the head not fully pierced (or born feet first or in an incorrect position).

De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	"Illness of the foreskin, occurring on the head of the penis, characterized by whiteness, corruption, blackness, and adhesion of the foreskin to the glans."

De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	"On the cleansing of children and the treatment of what may occur during their circumcision."
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	"Circumcision is not a solution for continuity like other plagues. But since it is our operation and our will, and especially among children, it is necessary that we assign to it the best method and easiest path for preserving health."
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla. They also use lime for binding and the nail for incising."
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	"I have already tried all these methods and found that the best cleansing is done with forceps, using lime for binding, and incising with a nail. For often times it escapes cutting too high, as the foreskin has two tunics, one of which remains beneath. It is therefore necessary to perform another incision and cause certain pain."

"But in the cleansing that is done with forceps and binding with lime, its goodness has been experimentally proven to me, because the forceps are of proportional incision, so that the sharpness above is equal to the sharpness below. Therefore, when you press your hand proportionally with two sharp points, it cuts according to a comparison in one time; and there is compression of the lime with a figure containing the foreskin of the whole part without any error at all."

De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the Treatment of Retained Urine in the Bladder
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder occurs due to obstruction caused by stone or sand concretions, or by poverty, hardness of flesh, and similar conditions as those mentioned earlier regarding the methods of treatment in this division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs. E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	Then place weights upon that person's back and stretch their belly from the part just above their buttocks downwards; the patient shall strain as much as they are able.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore, when the neck of the bladder is constricted and expels the stone to the back parts, then the urine is discharged.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if the stone is not dissolved with what has been said above, then it is necessary to administer an extraction using the instrument called a "syringe," which has this form: it should be made of silver and carefully worked like a quill from the feather of a bird, thin as a ray about a palm and a half long; at its end there should be a thin tube.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the manner of extracting urine with this is as follows: take a doubled-up feather and tie it securely at its end with wool or cotton; insert the ends of the feather into the back part of the syringe, and if there are any superfluous causes of wool on it, cut them away with scissors, then insert it forcefully into the tube. Then insert the syringe vigorously with forceps, making sure that the edges are properly aligned and the opening is well lubricated with oil.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And make the patient lie on their side, bend them over at the hip, and insert the syringe into the bladder and the urethra with olive oil and warm water.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And insert the syringe gently until it reaches the root of the urethra; bend the urethra upwards towards the navel; then push the syringe inside that; continue pushing until it reaches the bladder, and when it enters the bladder, you will feel that the patient has reached their goal. But if this order is not followed, it is because of a twisted passage in the body.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	"Then gradually extend the bile using wool."
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	"Next, apply a catheter for urine collection and use a syringe; continue doing so until the bladder is emptied and the patient's condition improves."

De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of the quality of catheterization of the bladder with instruments made of glass or similar materials that are suitable for this purpose.

sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	that at the extremity of it is rounded, so it is closed.

E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	"Silver or lead should be used, its head resembling a small feather, inserted carefully inside."

Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.
