E si las doas mas del fet so foro-getadas al comensament, lahoras cove que tu redusiscas aquelas am fecilitat petit a petit.	And if both hips of the fetus are forgotten at the beginning, then you must reduce them little by little with ease.
Mays si no obezeys al intrament, lahoras pausa la femna sobre una cezelha e leva les pes de lu sus, e aprop concuceys la cezelha sobre la terra; e la femna sia tenguda que no caia deves la concussio.	But if it does not obey the instrument, then place the woman on a chair and lift her legs up, and strike the chair against the ground; and the woman must be held so that she does not fall due to the shock.
E si las mas no son dedintz tornadas e morr le fet, lahoras inscideys aquelas e extratz le romament del fet o lia le cors a la ma de lu am drap e extratz aquel am equalitat, quar aquel sira foro-getat.	And if the hips are not turned correctly and the fetus dies, then cut them open and remove the remnants of the fetus or else tie its body with cloth and remove it gently, because it will soon be forgotten.
De eyssiment del embrio sobre les sieus pes.	About the emergence of the embryo on its feet.
Quan le fet yeys sobre les sieus pes, lahoras cove que tu impelliscas aquels en sus, e aprop convertas le fet petit, e aprop que engualhes aquel, e aprop que prenguas un pe de lu e extendas aquels petit a petit.	"When the sheet is on his feet, then you must push those up and soon turn the sheet small, and soon tie that, and soon take one foot of him and stretch that little by little."
Mays cum son eyssit entro a las coyssas, lahoras tu comanda a lu que se exprema, e fay aquela extornudar am condizi, quar sira foro-getat si Deus lo vol.	"After he has entered between the sheets, then you must command him to expel his breath, and make him sneeze if possible, for sometimes he may forget it if God wills."
E si no es foro-getat am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras tu retorna le fet petit a petit entro que pauses aquel segon figura natural, quar aquel sira lahoras foro-getat am leugier eyssiment.	"And if he does not forget what we have recommended, then you should slowly return the sheet between his legs until you cover him according to nature's figure, because sometimes he will now forget it with a light sigh."
E si es prohibit am tot aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras pren de musellage de altea e de goma dissolvuda, e percuteys tot en le mortier per bona percussio, e aprop linieys am aquo le conh de la femna, el pus bas del ventre de lu.	"And if it is forbidden to do all that we have recommended, then take some gum arabic and dissolved gum, grind them well in the mortar with good percussion, and soon line with that the mouth of the woman, lower down on his belly."
E aprop fay aquela cezer en aygua tebeza, entro que consegua les ypocondias.	"And soon make him drink hot water, until he reaches the hypochondria [i.e., the area below the ribs]."
E cum vezes que las partidas dejos de lu so lenificadas, lahoras fay a lu subfumiguacio de mirta e sub-pausa aquela a lu.	"And when the parts of his body are anointed, then make him inhale the vapor of myrtle and soon cover him with that."
E quan te la sub-fumiguacio per una hora, lahoras tu la fay sezer sobre una cezelha, e aprop fay aquela stornudar e extrenh la boca de lu, e levas de aquela, e prem la partida pus bassa del ventre de lu am leugiera compressio, quar le fet sira tantost foro-getat.	"And when the sublimation has lasted an hour, then place it on a sieve, and soon make him sneeze and stretch his mouth open, and take that away, and press the lowest part of his belly with light pressure, because he will soon forget it."
Eyssiment del fet sobre les sieus denols e las suas mas.	"The sigh comes out upon his teeth and his mustache."
Quan le fet eyssira segon aquesta forma, lahoras tu engenies en entrometen las suas mas petit a petit; e aprop la femna stia evessada sobre le sieu col, e les pes de lu pengo en jos, e aquelas sia jasent sobre le lieyt, e complegua las suas mas.	"When the sigh comes out according to this form, then gradually insert his mustache; and soon let the woman sit on his neck, with her weight hanging downwards, and those lying on the bed, completing his mustache."
E aprop prem sobre le ventre de lu petit a petit, e aprop extratz aquo que es dejos les pes de lu de las aurelhas entro que sia preparada en la partida pus dejos.	"And soon press gradually on his belly, and soon take out what is between his buttocks from the ears until it is prepared in the lowest part."
E si le fet no es fora-getat, lahoras pren les pes de lu e mau aquels am movement vehement, e aprop prem aquo que es sobre les ypocondres petit a petit entro que le fet puege a las partidas desus.	"And if he does not forget it, then take his buttocks and shake them with violent motion, and soon press what is on the hypochondria gradually until he pushes it up to the parts above."
E aprop entrometa las suas mas e engualhe le fet petit a petit, e comanda a la femna que se exprema entro que le fet sia foro-getat.	"And soon insert his mustache and swallow little by little what comes out, and order the woman to squeeze herself until he forgets it."
Eyssiment del fet latutidinalment pendent una de las suas mas.	"The sigh comes out laterally from one of his mustaches."
Sia engeniat en reduccio de la ma de lu, mays si no podes aquela reduzir, lahoras eleva la femna e fe aquela anar.	"Let him be inserted into the reduction of his hand, but if you cannot reduce it, then raise the woman up and let her go."
E si anar no pot, lahoras fay la jazer sobre le lieyt, e concuteys las coyssas de lu am concussio vehement, e aprop aministra liamentz les quals yeu e recomtatz de mucillages.	"And if she cannot go, then let her lie on the bed, and strike his sides with violent percussion, and soon administer to him remedies which are sweet and moistened with mucilages."
E si es vengut le enfantament, lahoras fay aquela sezer sobre cezelha, e aprop studia sobre la reduccio de la ma, e enguala le fet segon figura natural, e fay stornudar la femna e comanda a lu que comprema a si entro que sia foro-getat.	"And if childbirth has come, then let her sit on a sieve, and soon study the reduction of the hand, and swallow what comes out according to its natural form, and make the woman sneeze, and order him to press himself until it is forgotten."
Eyssiment del fet sobre·l col expandudas las suas mas e la fassia de lu es al dos de la sua mayre.	"The sigh comes out over his neck with his mustache expanded and his face turned towards his mother's side."
Cove que la matrona tengua la ma del fet e aprop revolva aquel petit a petit, e eque aquel am facilitat.	"It is necessary that the midwife hold the hand of the child and soon turn it little by little, and bring it out with ease."
E cum es e quant so es engualhat, e lahoras pausa sobre le conh de lu aquo que havem recomtat de oli e de mucellages.	"And when it is out and how much has been swallowed, then pause on the child's head what we have recommended of oil and mucilages."
E aprop comandas a lu que·s maugua petit a petit, e quan auras feyt aquo, lahoras fay aquela cezer sobre una cezelha e comanda li que sia inclinada sobre le latz dreyt, e aprop comanda a lu que sia compremuda; e fay aquela stornudar am condizi.	"And soon order him to move little by little, and when you have done that, then let her sit on a sieve, and command her to be inclined towards the right side, and soon order him to be pressed; and make her sneeze with condition."
Exitus foetus praeparati super latus.	"Exit of the prepared fetus onto the side."
Quan deyssen a horrifici de la mayre segon aquesta manieyra, considera, e lahoras tu inscideys la segondina am la tua ungla entro que sia evacuada de la humiditat.	"When they horrify from the mother according to this manner, consider, and soon insert your second nail into it until it is evacuated of humidity."
E si le fet es suspendut sobre la cara e·l col de lu, lahoras tu inscideys aquela del embelic, per so que no sia retengut e mora.	"And if the child is suspended on his face and neck, then insert your second nail into its belly-button, so that it is not retained and dies."
E aprop empelleys le fet a las partidas dedintz entro que pauses aquel segon que cove, e manda a la femna que comprema a si alcunas veguadas, e el sira fora-getat am eyssiment leugier, si Dieus o vol.	"And soon push the child into its parts inside until you pause it where necessary, and order the woman to press herself several times, and he will forget it with light sighing, if God wants."
Exitus geminorum aut foetuum multorum.	"Exit of twins or multiple fetuses."
Sapias que gemels motas veguadas so natz, e alcunas vetz naysso tres o quatre , mays aquo es estranh e tart s’endeve; mays v so causas foro natura, e no vivo.	"Know that very many times twins are born, and sometimes three or four, but this is strange and difficult to endure. But such things happen naturally, not by chance."
E conte aquelas, ja sia que sian montiplicatz, una segondina, e son seperatz per ciphac, distingen aquels enter le liguament en l’ombilic de cascun de aquels E alcunas veguadas so foro-getatz ayssi cum es un fet per eyssiment natural leugier, e so eysitz alcunas veguadas per eyssiment no-lausabla ayssi cum havem recomtat.	"And count those [fetuses], whether they are multiplied or not, one second nail for each one, and separate them by the navel cord. Distinguish them by the ligaments in the umbilical cord of each one. And sometimes they are forgotten like this as if there were only one fetus with a light natural sighing, but sometimes they are expelled with an unbearable sigh like we have recommended."
E si son dificils alcus de lor deves le enfantament e perveno ad aquo que havem dit de las figuras no-naturals, lahoras tu cura aquels ayssi cum havem recontat.	"And if some of them are difficult to deliver and arrive at what we have said about the unnatural figures, then care for them as we have recommended."
E si’ la matrona subtil e fassa aquo que fa am facilitat e subtilitat, e am tarditat, e sia ingeniat segon tota figura segon que es a lu preparat de l’engen amenant a salut.	"And if the midwife is subtle and does what she does with ease and subtlety, but also with tardiness, and inserts it according to all its figures as it was prepared for her by bringing about salvation."
Rememoratio eius quod formatur in matrice ex embrionibus et Abortiuntur.	"Remembrance of that which is formed in the womb from embryos and aborted."
Alcunas veguadas son formatz en la mayre un, e dos, e tres, e quatre, e v, e vi, e vii, e mays x, e ja es deves mi verificat que una femna abortem ne getet vi, e una autra x totz formatz, la qual causa fo fayta per mensuracio dels glorios savis.	"Sometimes one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, and even ten are formed in the mother's womb, and it has been verified that one woman aborted seven, and another threw out all ten, which was caused by the measurement of the glorious sages."
E tot aysso cove que sia en la sciencia de la matrona quar fort leu ad aquela parve semblant de aquo, e donc opause se ad aquo am so que cove.	"And therefore it is necessary that the midwife know how to discern this small semblance, and thus pause when it is necessary."
Capitol .lxxvi.	"Chapter Seventy-Six."
De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	"Of the extraction of the dead fetus."
Quan tu curas le fet mort am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la medicacio e no es defora eyssit, e tu yest forsat usar de opperacio am ma, lahoras cove que consideras si la femna es de sana vertut e no es am alcu dels accidentz per les quals sobre ela es temuda perdicio.	"When you care for the dead fetus as we have said in the division of medicine and it does not come out easily, and you are forced to use an operation with your hand, then consider whether the woman is of sound virtue and is not affected by any of the accidents that cause harm to her."
Lahoras cove que la femna sia envessada sobre le lieyt sobre le sieu dos, e sia le cap de lu enclinat enjos e las coyssas de lu sian elevadas.	"Then let the woman be placed on her back with her knees raised and her head leaned downwards, and her hips lifted."
E·l ministre tengua aquela de doas partz o sia liada en le lieyt per so que·l cos de lu no se extenda deves la extraccio del fet.	"And the minister should hold her from both parts or have her tied on the bed so that her body does not extend beyond the extraction of the fetus."
E aprop tu humecta la boca de la mayre de lu am olis humitz e am mucellage de altea e de fenugrec e de semensa de li.	"And soon you moisten the mouth of the mother with warm oil and mucilage of marshmallow, fennel, and linseed."
E aprop unte la matrona la sua ma am aquels olis e mucellages, e aprop entrometa la sua ma am fecilitat en la mayre, e aprop cerque am la ma loc en le qual fique les uncis en le fet.	"And soon the midwife anoints her hand with these oils and mucilages, and soon inserts her hand gently into the womb, and soon seeks with her hand where the nails are in the fetus."
E locs convenient en aquo: adonc tu considera si le fet es preparat que deysenda sobre le sieu cap, e lahoras tu fique les uncis en les huels de lu, o en le col, o en la boca, o en le palat, o dejos la barba, o en la furcula de lu, o en les locs propdas de las costas, o dejos les ypocondres.	"And locate it conveniently there: then consider if the fetus is prepared to be removed from its head, and soon you place your nails in its eye sockets or neck or mouth or palate or beard or collarbone or near the ribs or hypochondria."
Mays si le deysendiment es sobre les pes de lu, lahoras en le pentenilh, o en le mieg de las costas.	"But if it is to be removed from its feet, then in the groin or the middle of the back."
E cove que tengua le unci am la ma dreyta, e pausa la curvitat de lu en aquel loc le qual es entre les ditz de la ma senestra, e entrometa la ma am facilitat e fique le unci en alcu de aquels locs les quals havem ditz, entro que pervengua a la causa boyda.	"And hold the nail with your right hand and place its curve in that location between the fingers of the left hand and insert your hand gently and place the nail in one of those locations we have mentioned until you reach the cause of the obstruction."
E aprop pause e fique en la apposicio de lu un autre unci, o le tertz si es necessitat, per so que sia atraccio engual, e no sia extencio segon la sua rectetut tant solament.	"And soon place and keep another nail, or the third if necessary, so that there is equal traction and not excessive extension according to its rightness alone."
Ans sia maugut a tota partida, per so que l’eyssiment de lu sia alleujat ayssi cum es fayt en dent deves la eradicacio de lu.	Answer: Then it is necessary that all parts be opened, so that the discharge of the fluid may be eased as it is done in tooth extraction.
E cove en lu aquo que es entre lor que la extencio sia mollificada; e si alcuna partida de lu es retenguda, lahoras cove que la matrona unte alcus sieus ditz am oli e entrometa aquels espertament e revolva am aquels aquo que es retengut.	Answer: And it is necessary that the water which is between them be softened; and if any part of it is retained, then the midwife must anoint some of her fingers with oil and carefully insert them and turn them in order to remove what has been retained.
Donc si la partida del fet es fora-getada, lahoras les uncis sian permudatz entra loc le qual sia pus aut; e fay aysso entro que tot le fet sia fora-getat.	Answer: Therefore if the birth of the child is delayed, then the hands should be washed with clean water and dried well; and do this until all the child has come out.
Mays si la ma es eyssida denant l’autra, e no es possible reduzir aquela per la coartacio de lu, lahoras cove que drap sia envolopat sobre aquela; e aprop extratz aquela entro que tota sia fora-getada, e inscideys aquela o en la junctura de la ma o en le coyde.	Answer: But if the hand is extended beyond the other one and it cannot be reduced by pulling it back through the narrowness of the opening, then cloth should be wrapped around that one; and carefully cut off that one until all of it has come out, and cut it at the junction of the hand or at the elbow.
E ayssi cove que fassas en l’autra ma e en les dos pes.	Answer: And do the same for the other hand and both feet.
Mays si le cap del fet es gran, o accideys a lu coartacio en le eyssiment, o es en le cap de lu aygua ajustada, lahoras cove que entrometa entre les ditz espatum spinos e fenda le cap e extragua la aygua, o que discroba aquel am un instrument le qual es nompnat “alundat”, la forma del qual vindra am las formas dels autres instruments en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Answer: But if the head of the child is large or the opening is narrow at the time of birth, or the head is in the watery cavity, then it is necessary to insert between those parts the spatula bone with its sharp edge and cut the head open and remove the water, or use an instrument called "alundat" whose shape will be shown along with other instruments in the chapter which follows this one.
E semblantment fassa si·l fet es de gran cap per natura: e lahoras cove que inscida aquel am algematu, o que prengua aquel am alunda ayssi cum havem dit; e aprop extra les osses am les forceps.	Answer: And do the same if the child has a large head by nature; and then it is necessary to cut that with an alembic or use the alundat as we have said before, and especially remove the bones with forceps.
E si le cap es eyssit e es coartat deves la furcula, lahoras sia fendut entro que la humiditat la qual es en le pietz sia efunduda.	Answer: And if the head is extended but stuck below the forklike bone, then it should be cut until the moisture in the pit has drained out.
Mays si no es complicat, ni obezeys a eyssiment, lahoras tu inscideys le cap tantost segon que a tu sira possible.	Answer: But if there is nothing complicated or obstructing the exit, then you should cut the head until you can easily get it out.
E si le dejos del ventre es apostemat o es en lu ydropici, lahoras cove que tu perfores aquel entro que corro la humiditat que es en lu.	Answer: And if the left side of the belly is inflamed or in a dropsical state, then you must perforate it until the fluid inside it has run out.
Mays si le fet es sobre les sieus pes, lahoras la atraccio de lu es leugiera e la direccio de lu a la boca de la mayre es leugiera.	Answer: But if the child is lying on its feet, then its attraction [to come out] will be light and its direction towards the mother's mouth will be easy.
Mays si es coartat deves le ventre e·l pietz, lahoras cove que tu extraguas aquel am drap le qual auras envolopat sobre la tua ma, e que fendes le ventre e·l pietz entro que corra aquo que es en aquels.	Answer: But if it is stuck below the belly and the pit, then you must remove it with cloth which you will have wrapped around your hand, and cut the belly and the pit until that water has run out.
Mays si les autres membres so ostatz e torna le cap, lahoras la metrona entrometa la ma senestra; mays si la boca de la mayre es huberta, lahoras intrometa la ma en le preon de layre, e cerque am aquela le cap, e atira aquel am les ditz entro a la boca de la mayre, e aprop entrometa en lu un unci, o dos uncis, e atire lu am aquels.	Answer: But if the other members are stuck and the head turns back, then insert the left hand; but if the mother's mouth is blocked, then insert the hand into her throat, surround the head with it, pull that with those parts towards the mother's mouth, and especially insert a hook or two hooks and pull it with those.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada per apostema caut le qual accideys a l’u, lahoras cove que no sia trebelhat sobre lu; abantz cove lahoras aministrar efusio de causas humidas grassas.	Answer: And if the mother's mouth is obstructed by an ulcerous swelling that occurs at childbirth, then do not be troubled about it; rather you must administer evacuation of thick humid causes.
E aministre emplastres; e segua le pacient en ayguas que mollifican e humectan.	Answer: And apply poultices to her; and follow the patient with waters that soften and moisten.
E si le fet es sobre le sieu costat, lahoras si possible es, sia agulat: e sia aministrat aquo que havem dit en le fet viu.	Answer: And if the child is lying on its side, then if possible turn it around; and administer to it what we have said for a living child.
E si aquo no es possible, lahoras sia inscidit en pessas, e sia extrayt.	Answer: And if that is not possible, then cut through the tissues and remove it.
E cove que non layssas alcuna causa dedintz de la segondina.	Answer: And you must not leave any cause behind in the secondine [afterbirth].
E cum tu auras complida tota la tua opperacio, lahoras aministra aquo que havem dit de la curacio en les apostemas cautz les quals accideysso de la mayre.	Answer: And when you have completed all your operations, then administer what we have said about the cure of the ulcerous swellings that occur in the mother.
E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	Answer: And if there is a flow of blood, then apply lint soaked in astringent waters and administer the other cure.
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	"I have seen a woman whose belly was already dead, yet she became pregnant again afterwards."
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	"It happened that a long time after an ulceration appeared on his belly; it swelled up from what had been opened and began to emit pus."
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	"I was called to treat him and treated him for a long time, but the wound did not heal."
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os.	"Then I carefully examined the causes of this strong attraction and extracted from him a bone, but after some days passed, another bone was extracted from him; this greatly amazed me because there are no bones in the belly."
E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	"And then I realized that they were bones of the dead fetus."
Donc yeu enguisigui la plagua, e extrayssi de lu motz osses , la femna existent en las sieuas milhos disposicios, e ja visquec en tal manieyra per lonc temps, correc de lu un petit de brac.	"So I cleaned the wound and extracted from it many bones, for the woman was in her best condition, and she lived this way for a long time without any trouble."
E yeu no afermegui asso esser stranh, sino quar en aquo es sciensa e ajutori ad aquo que le metge artifec am la ma per curacio aministra.	"And I did not think it was strange, because in this there is science and help for the physician who uses his hands for healing."
De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	"On the forms of the instruments that are necessary to extract the fetus."
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	"The form of a vise with which the uterus is opened:"
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	"This is the form of the strengthener in which the threads are tied up, for tying the knots there should be two vises on both ends of the two threads."
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	"But this vise must be more subtle than a strengthener and made either of ivory or bone or boxwood wood."
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	"And each stick should be two fingers wide and the edge of each about one finger; the length of each is one and a half palms. And in the middle of the two sticks there are two adjustments of that same stick which are already fixed, of which the length is more than one and a half palms and the width of each is about two fingers or a little bit more."
E aquestz dos additamentz sian entromeses en la boca de la mayre per que sia uberta am aquels quan tu revolves las doas prescriptas virtigges.	"And these two adjustments are inserted into the mouth of the uterus so that it is opened with them when you turn the two aforementioned vises."
Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	"Another form similar to this, but more subtle and lighter:"
Sia fayta de fustz de eba o de boys segon la semblansa de forceps.	"It should be made of ivory or boxwood sticks according to the shape of forceps."
Mays empero en la extremitat de lu so dos additament ayssi cum vezes, e la longitut de aquels additament es quays un palm, e la latitut de quascu es dos ditz.	"But however at the end of it there are two adjustments like vises, and the length of each adjustment is about one palm, and the width of each is two fingers."
E cum tu vols am aquels ubrir la mayre, lahoras tu fay cezer la femna sobre le lieyt les pes pendentz, ubert aquo que es entre las coyssas de lu.	"And when you want to open the uterus with these, then make the woman lie down on her back with her feet hanging down, and open what is between her legs."
E aprop obre la tua ma am le instrument ayssi cum fas am forfexs engualment segon la quantitat que vols de la aprecio de la boca de la mayre entro que la metrona fassa so que vols.	"And properly open your hand with the instrument as you do with forceps, according to how much you want of the opening of the uterus entrance, until it reaches what you want."
La forma de vertitge la qual diysero les antics:	"The form of a vise that they said in ancient times:"
Forma de impellent am le qual es empellit le fet:	"The form of an impeller with which the fetus is pushed:"
Forma de amisidat2 am le qual es conterit le cap gran	"The form of an amoebid with which the large head is crushed"
E es asemblat a forceps al qual so dentz en la extremitat, ayssi cum vezes, e alcunas veguadas es fayt lonc ayssi cum forceps segon aquesta forma, ayssi cum vezes, al qual so dentz ayssi cum dentz de ressegua am le qual es inscidit e conterit.	"And it is similar to forceps at whose end are teeth like vises. And sometimes it is made long like forceps according to this form with teeth like the teeth of a saw with which it cuts and crushes."
Forma de amesidat pauc:	"The form of a small amoebid:"
Forma de unci havent una spina:	"The form of an awl having one spine:"
Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	"The form of an awl having two spines:"
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	"The form of forceps with which its teeth are like a comb and the head of the fetus is crushed"
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	"The form of spatula having two extremities with which the head is cut off:"
Forma de dos espatums latz:	"The form of two flat spatulas:"
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	"Therefore all these instruments are practiced, and when more species of them and more prepared ones are multiplied, then it is lighter in its operation and better for men because of their quantity."
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	"And do not use these instruments without good reason, because the necessity of them is not excusable."
De extraccio de la segondina.	"Of extracting the secondine."
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	When the second stage of childbirth is delayed, you should command the patient to hold her breath and then make her sneeze with some conditions, and stretch your hand over her mouth and nose. If the child exits through this method, that's good.
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	"If not, then take an egg and pierce its shell with a hot poker, place it on those herbs that have been burned together with the mouth of the mother, thus like calamint, rue, and fennel, camomile, Arabic sickle, lignum cassia, and Saint John's wort."
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	"All of these herbs or some of them should be submerged in water inside the egg, and then place it on the fire."
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	"And also place a reed tube made of cane into the mother's mouth, and hold it there so that the steam coming from the egg reaches the concave part of her womb."
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	"And then make her sneeze like we have said, and the second woman should quickly step aside."
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	"But if this remedy does not work and the woman is still not delivered, then command the midwife to immerse her left hand in olive oil or a mixture of marshmallow root, and then carefully insert it into the womb and search with it for the second woman. When she has found it, then slowly pull out that hand little by little. But if the woman is stuck in the pelvis, then carefully insert the midwife's second hand as previously recommended, and when she has found the second woman, extract her gently according to the correct direction so that the mother does not suffer from violent attraction."
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	"It is necessary that she be turned on her right and left sides with ease."
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	"And also the amount of traction should be adjusted, because it will obey and avoid adhering too much."
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	"And if the mother's mouth is obstructed, we have already recommended the cure with sneezing and medication with olive oil with herbs."
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	"But if the baby is not delivered even after all the causes we have recommended are used, then be careful not to tire yourself out with repeated attempts at traction. But it is necessary that whatever comes out of the mother's womb be placed in a container for the woman, and then cauterize it with fire and tetrafarmacon; because this will cause it to shrink and become dissolved and will be expelled."
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	"But when it is extracted, it causes a bad smell in the head and stomach, which causes illness. And then it is necessary to administer fumigations and appropriate remedies for that."
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	"But some of the Ancients already used fumigation with Nazareth and dried figs."
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	"Method of using an instrument to fumigate a woman for retention of menstruation and the second woman:"
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	"It should be made of ivory or brass."
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	"And its thin extremity should be placed in the womb and its wide extremity over the fire, and fumigation should be performed on the embers of the fire."
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	"And have that vessel ready to replace it when this fumigation is consumed and repeat another one."
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	"Remedy for the cure of the unperforated anus of a newborn child:"
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	"Some children are born and their anuses are not perforated, which are very thin and closed."
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	"Then it is necessary for the midwife to perforate that opening with her finger; and if not, then perforate it with a sharp probe, but be careful not to touch the rectum."
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	"And also put over that wool soaked in wine and oil; and also cure it with ointment inside which has been boiled."
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	"But if you fear that it is closed, then place a catheter in the anus for several days and remove it when the child wants to defecate."
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	"And sometimes occlusion of the anus occurs due to a hard mass or abscess. Then it is necessary that this hardness be incised and also cured with what we have said about treatment and lead."
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	"Treatment of fistulas that are formed there:"
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	"The fistulas that are formed in the lower part of the buttocks are usually large and thick, which are formed near the anus outside or in the space between one buttock."
E es una fistula o motas.	"And it is one fistula or many."
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	"And with this thickness being old and running with moist, thick white humors or thin pus, and sometimes there are penetrating passages in these fistulas."
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	"And these passages are known by what comes out of them through discharge and through windiness; and sometimes the disease is from discharge, and it often comes out of those worms."
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	"And sometimes there are penetrating passages from these fistulas into the bladder and into the meatus of the penis; and some of those passages are into the junction of the vulva and into the notch of the scrotum."
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	"And what is known as a penetrating fistula that enters the anus and is not penetrating is this: you put your finger inside the anus, and then insert a thin probe made of brass or iron into the fistula where there is no turning."
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	"But if there is a turn in that place, then insert into it a thin probe made of lead or horsehair until you feel the probe or hair on your finger."
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	"And if you do not feel it at all and there is no cause of discharge or worms or windiness coming from the anus, as we have said, then know that it is not penetrating, and then proceed to treatment."
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	"And when the fistula is penetrating into the bladder or into the meatus of the penis, then its meaning is the emission of urine from there and prohibition of it until that place has healed in medicine."
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	"But if it is penetrating into the junction of the vulva or into the bone and causes pain in the area, then its sign is that the probe enters there if there is no turning inside the bone, and there is pain in the area of the joint; and that pus always comes out from there; and that medicine and ointment are ineffective, nor does it heal."
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	"And in all those penetrating fistulas, there is no complete cure, and the cure of those is labor and futility of the foolish physicians on which we are firm."
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	"But in that one which is not penetrating and not ancient, cure with iron can be hoped for according to what I will recommend to you, and what I have already said and proved."
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	"And it is that the disease runs between your buttocks and above your two thighs, raising their folds inside them; the vulva being inclined towards its belly; and then insert a probe of lead or brass if there is turning in the fistula, until you know where the probe passes."
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	"And if that disease feels around the anus, then it is necessary for you to insert your finger inside the anus."
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if you feel the probe already entering penetratingly with your finger inserted inside the anus, other than what you feel between your finger and that opening or flesh, then know certainly that it is penetrating; and therefore do not work on it, because there is no cure for it, as we have said."
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	"But however some say that it is cured in some men."
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	"And about the treatment by which help is hoped for in this, it is that you ignite a cautery probe according to the width of the fistula, as it is precedented, and insert that burning probe into the fistula until it reaches around the anus; and then repeat it twice or thrice until you know that all those flesh tissues that are fitted together like chicken feather quills are already burnt."
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	"And then cure it with hot compresses wrapped in linen until all those burnt flesh tissues are softened; and then cure it with medicines that generate and consolidate flesh; and if it is healed, good; but if not, then it will never be healed by any other treatment."
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	"And if the probe enters but does not penetrate within your finger which is inside the anus, and between that finger and the probe which is covered with skin or flesh tissue, and the fistula seems to be closed at its surface; then cut the skin of the beginning of the fistula, and you will see it cut with the probe, and it should enter into the fistula until the cut reaches the place where the end of the probe arrives, and by the probe it is freed and healed."
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	"Then cleanse those fleshy fistulas which resemble a bird feather quill, leaving none unaddressed."
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	"If blood often flows between you and your operation when incising those flesh parts, then it is better to cauterize with fire or sharp medicine, for cautery with fire has two good habits: it adjusts the flesh and dries up the blood and excess humidity."
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	"And also cure those wounds wrapped in a border or treacherously hidden where the arm meets the body, and also sometimes cure hard gangrenous flesh that generates and solidifies plague."
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	"And such medicines are styptic and drying; when the wound is restored, it is healed and fears no recurrence."
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	"But if the fistula has already entered into the anus and is elongated from its surface, then insert your thumb into the anus and search with it."
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	"And then if you find the bowel and there is a veil of skin or flesh between it and you, it is appropriate to attempt penetration, but this is not an operation performed through an incision, but rather through trust and hope."
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	"And this is accomplished in one of three ways: either cauterize it as we have said; or cut it so that the concavity of the bowel can be achieved such that you are able to insert some dressings and promote healing; do not proceed with an incision so that you do not wound the lacertum containing the anus, which would accidentally cause injury to the intestines without consent. And also cure it with water as we have said because it will heal quickly; or elongates that veil and clean out that pus by cutting into the bowel properly from behind, as we have said, either with a tent or another sharp instrument, and then cure those fistulated flesh parts which are in the section through cauterization. And also strive to perform the entire operation with an incision, if the opening above is not consolidated, and the fistula remains open at the junction of the anus, it will be easier for healing."
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	"And thus the fistula is finished in this manner: when you insert the tent into the fistula and it is on the side of the anus around its surface with the cord and at the margin of the anus, then take a tent with a perforated extremity, which is like a needle for preparing hearts in this form:"
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	"And insert the tent into that file wrapped with fine threads or around those [threads]; and then insert the tent with the file into the fistula until it achieves its concavity."
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	"But if it is penetrating at the margin of the anus from behind, then you remove the thread from that track so that you can insert your finger into the anus; and remove the extremity of the thread and tie the two ends together with a knot, and leave it for one day or two. And when you notice that the thread is becoming embedded in the flesh, cut it there where those flesh parts are incised which are between the two ends of the thread."
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	"And also cure the wound until it is consolidated and healed."
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	"But if the opening of the fistula is not penetrating, then make it penetrate in whatever manner you are prepared, but take care that it does not penetrate too far into the front, so that you do not wound the anal sphincter muscle. And then cure it until it is healed."
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	"The shape of the spatula with spines used to probe the fistula is thus: its curvature is very sharp while the other end is not sharp, so that you do not wound what is not necessary, as sometimes happens."
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	"Regarding the suturing of hemorrhoids in which blood flows through the incision of those [hemorrhoids]."
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	"Hemorrhoids are of two kinds: for some are between the buttocks resembling coal, while others are fatty like the fat of bacon."
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	"And among those some are small and large; and blood flows from them constantly, they are many in number, and they are outside the anus, at its extremities."
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	"But those hemorrhoids that are outside the anus are due to little moisture, from which flows citrine water or a small amount of blood continuously, and they are classified according to the color of the body."
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	"And the treatment for that which is inside the anus is that you command the patient to sit and express until the anus prolapses and the hemorrhoids appear to you."
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	"Then you grasp with forceps or with your fingers those that have prolapsed and cut them at their roots."
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	"But if the forceps do not hold those [hemorrhoids] due to their humidity and softness, then grasp them with rough cloth or with cotton or with a wool wisp, and remove them with your fingers. And cut them at their roots and sprinkle some powdered myrrh on that incision so that they are cauterized instead of cauterization; or cauterize them according to what is described in the chapter on cauterization."
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	"And then cure those with another treatment until they are healed."
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	"And if the anus does not obey to evacuation, then use a clyster on the patient with a small mouthpiece that has been washed with water from the anus and which facilitates evacuation when the patient strains."
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	"But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then their cause is slight. And you grasp them with your nail or with forceps and cut them. And then cure them with what has been said until they are healed."
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	"And if you have made an incision, it is necessary that you administer a suture of those [hemorrhoids] as follows: take thread wrapped and insert it into the needle. And remove the hemorrhoids at their roots above, and make the needle penetrate into the root of the other part. And wrap both extremities of the thread in the party below the needle laterally. And tie the hemorrhoid with a tight knot, and then cut the thread and remove the needle."
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	"And do this to all of them, leaving one intact without tying it, so that the superfluous blood flows from that [hemorrhoid]."
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	"And then apply over the anus a cloth dipped in rose oil or wax, and have the patient remain lying on their back and command them to retain it."
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And then leave that one until it protrudes. And when it has prolapsed, cure it with an ointment or with another treatment until it is healed."
De curacio de fistulas.	"Regarding the treatment of fistulas."
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	"Frequently this occurs due to dryness of the womb or constriction of nature."
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	"And if these are very old and cannot be cured by that medicine, then you must remove those with the point of a spatula or your fingernail until they are moistened and scrape off the yellowish pus on top which prevents them from solidifying; and carefully cleanse them so that they may become solid."
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	"Then take away those with great violence until the first blood comes out and they are scraped; and carefully cleanse them so that they may be healed."
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	"It is key to the treatment of leprosy."
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	"Know that leprosy is a key disease and it is not if not redondos according to the color of the body like a head of a nail, and it happens throughout the body but more especially in the parts below the elbows and knees, where pain often occurs."
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	"And then it is necessary that this is incised where the key is located, and removed with forceps or tweezers, and eradicated from its root; and carefully cleanse it."
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	"If you want to, cauterize the second one that comes next in its chapter."
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	"But a verruca is a small rough fistulous elevation on the surface of the body and many are often seen in children."
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	"And its treatment is that you stretch it out and incise it, or scrape it with a file or razor within so that it falls off."
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	"And if you want to, cauterize it as we have said with fire or with an acute medicine."
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	"And now that both pimples and non-pimples are eradicated using the instrument that I will describe to you."
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	"But a formica is a small felted or fistulous elevation on the surface of the body, occurring frequently in the forehead, and when it is scratched it feels like the bite of an ant, and it becomes red around the body."
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	"And its treatment is that you take a quill of an owl or eagle feather, and it should be hard, and place it on the ant so that it contains it within the circle of the quill; and carefully turn your hand with the quill so that you incise what is around the ant, and press it onto the skin of the forehead, and eradicate the ant from its root."
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	"And if you want to, do this with a needle made of brass or iron according to this method:"
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	"Let the point of the needle be subtle, blunt (so that it is not perforated), wrapped with a thread so that when you press on it, its revolution becomes easy."
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	"And if you want to, cauterize the ant according to what is mentioned earlier in the chapter of cautery under the heading of cauterizing a carbuncle."
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	"Regarding the shapes of instruments that are used for giving cautery."
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	"Some cautery irons are made of silver or brass or molten lead or hammered ones, and some are made in small and large sizes according to those that they are used for, because the one used for treating young children should be small; and those whose handles are twisted or rounded, their cautery irons should be small."
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	"The shape of a large cautery iron with few points:"
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	"The head of the needle at its tip where the bag is tied should be wide in this manner, and it should have such distinction that when the bag is tied, it remains like this."
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	"And the lower extremity of it, which is inserted into the buttocks, should be blunt (so that it is not open) rather than pointed to subtlety; and on one side there should be two holes, and on the other side one hole, and the width of the holes should correspond to the thickness of the rays or hairs, one large and one small."
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	"And let the bag in which medicines made from bladder of a beast or wool of sheep are placed have a root that is one hand's breadth."
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	"And let it be pierced with many holes as it revolves, and if the space between the holes is equal to the thickness of the finger."
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	"And then insert into those holes a strong thread of raw flax which is made from ten threads, or wind it around them; and adjust the bag with that; and when you have placed the bag on it, let it be tight at the head of the cautery iron between two distinctions with firm constriction, and then cauterize each hole: But the quality of cauterizing in this manner is that you fill the bag with medicine, which should be warmed according to the quantity of the tolerance of the illness; and take care that it is not too cold nor too hot."
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	"And then let the patient lie on his back, elevate his hips up and place under him either a sheet or a blanket. And then anoint the extremity of the cautery iron with oil or egg white or fenugreek mucilage or something similar; and then insert it into the buttocks gently; and then the assistant takes the bag and squeezes it twice hard so that everything inside the cautery is evacuated from the bowel; and then remove the cautery iron, and let the patient lower his hips to the bed."
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	"And if the medicine forces him to excrementation, let him retain it as much as possible; and if he sleeps with that throughout one night, it is better for healing."
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	"But if you cauterize him in cases of diarrhea and loose bowels and excrementation comes out from there, then repeat the cautery until he is healed."
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	"And if in the buttocks there are hemorrhoids or painful fistulas, then let the cautery iron be very subtle and pointed, those with which children are cauterized."
De curacio de las plaguas.	"Regarding the treatment of plagues."
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	"I have already stated in the division of the treatment of plagues that which was appropriate for this book, and I now state the treatment of those with medicine according to their completeness."
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	"I say that plagues are differentiated according to what they are made from, and according to the place where the plague occurs."
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	"And the causes why many times plagues are made are such as: wounding by a stone, or incision with scissors or knife, or percussion with lance, or club, or arrow, or something similar to those of many causes."
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	"But the plagues that are in the places of the body are such as: plague which falls on the head, or neck, or foot, or belly, or thigh, and similar to those of the limbs."
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	"And I am recounting the treatment of some plagues because this reasoning and rule apply to other plagues as well."
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	"And I will begin with simple head plagues, for the memory of the compound ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter."
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	"So I say that when a simple head plague occurs and it is not a fracture, then consider: if it is from wounding by a stone or something similar, and the chain has already broken only on this side and the plague is large, and you fear that an abscess will form there, then immediately perform cephalic phlebotomy and do not delay; and extract blood from him according to the quantity of its virtue if no other cause prohibiting phlebotomy exists, especially if the blood that comes out from the plague is little."
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	"And let the phlebotomy be on the opposite side of the wounded part, and keep the patient from getting drunk and from wine and from heavy foods."
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	"But if you prohibit some cause because of its minuteness, then let the food be diminished and do not approach meat or wine."
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	"Place your hand on the wound; if it happens to be cauterized, apply olive oil usually heated or wine in which it has been steeped."
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	"If you are sure that the wound is cauterized, then place your hand on it; if it is fresh apply the patient's blood and the air has not changed what was put on the powder which I will recommend to you in a moment."
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	"And if the air has already changed it, then place your hand over the wound until it is healed."
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	"But if the wound is large or caused by an incision and its lips are not properly adjusted, then adjust those with stitches according to what I will recommend about the stitching of them."
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	"But if the wound is already exposed to the bone and does not involve retention of it but only a small suspension, then cut that and cure the wound with medicines and restore the flesh properly in place of sinew. Command the patient to be fed on foods which are coarse: heads of cabbage and turnips and things like them until they are convalescent."
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	"And if you find putrefaction in the sinew and it does not adhere to the bone, then cut away all that is rotten and cast it out, and cure it."
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	"But if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which blood flows and it is not severed by medicines, then inquire about the artery. And if you find that it is not cut, then cut it with a scalpel or ligate it. And if necessity requires that what has been said does not help, then cauterize until the bleeding is stopped."
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	"And if these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is light. Therefore you should powder those with this powder, so that it may consolidate them before the air changes them."
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	"And the manner of making the powder is this: Take oil of sesame one part, dragon's blood two parts, unburnt sulfur three parts. Let all be well ground and sifted, and let the wound be filled with it, and let it be pressed on by good pressure until it adheres to it, and let it be coagulated with the blood."
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	"And properly press that upon it with powders and leave it alone. Do not remove it while it is like this until it is completely adherent, for the medicine will not abandon it until it is healed."
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	"And sometimes one does only cauterization when oil of sesame and dragon's blood are not at hand."
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	"And this is the same operation performed on large wounds when it is necessary to press upon them and bind them tightly, especially fresh wounds with their blood still flowing, which the air has not yet altered."
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	"But if the air has altered them, especially in summer time, then it is not suitable to use this powder. But at such times treat those wounds with what has been said, thus: you should apply upon them some of these ointments digested, or you should apply upon them flour of barley mixed with water and honey until they are freed from putrefaction; and properly cure them with the other treatment until they are healed."
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	"But if a fracture of the bone occurs in the wound and it is small, then treat it with this."
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	"And I direct you to the treatment of fractures of the head in that which follows."
De las plaguas del col.	"Of wounds on the neck."
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	"But if a wound occurs on the neck, there is no difference in treatment between that and a simple wound of the head."
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	"But if the nerve of the neck is cut or an artery, then if it is a nerve, there is no other remedy but to avoid carelessly treating it with something that causes violent astringency, such as vitriol and similar things which burn nerves and cause contraction."
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	"And do not apply any hot cause upon the wound, for the substance of nerves is hot and their continuity is with the brain, which is the first part of all members."
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	"And if it is treated with mild medicines such as washing the wound with sweet water, sometimes infused in rose oil or not, and aloe when washed with sweet water and other soft minerals according to this manner, and humid ointments."
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	"But if the wound is large, then perform suturing or bind its lips together and properly treat it with powders until it is healed."
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	"But if the wound has depth or occurs in the lower part of the belly with putrefaction, then perforate it in the least depressed place."
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	"But if an artery has been cut in the wound and bleeding occurs, then separate it or bind it off, ligature it, or cauterize it if necessary."
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	"But if the spinal cord has been injured or completely severed and the veins of the neck are preserved, then approximate the lips of the wound over the spinal canal with sutures without touching it; afterward extend it evenly and reduce it to its natural shape. Then properly stretch it with decent bandages and leave it alone for a few days. And properly treat it with ointments that have astringency and excitation until it is healed."
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	"But if the wound has reached the bone and penetrated it deeply, then curette it, and afterward remove all fragments of bone that you can. And what you cannot remove, leave it alone until the wound putrefies and separates itself, and its inflammation is alleviated."
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	"And if the wound is fresh, then powder it with that powder which I have recommended to you."
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	"But if there is a deep fistula in the wound, then treat it with that of which the memory will come later in its proper chapter."
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	"Of wounds on the neck or similar ones that are deep between the shoulders and are made with a cleaver or knife or lance or similar things."
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	"If it is a wound from a lance or knife and its depth is uncertain, then consider whether there is wind in the wound when the sick person exhales. If so, know that the wound is mortal."
