E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	"And if it is not deep and the wound is fresh with its own blood, then apply to it in the first hour that powder which I have recommended to you. And do not compress it so that the blood is not retained in its depth and returned to the heart, which would aggravate the illness, but rather apply an attractive ointment twice a day."
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	"And if the ointment is not available, then apply a cotton wick moistened with honey around the wound so that it may suck up its moisture. And make sure that the sick person sleeps on the side of the wound so that what is fitted in it runs."
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	"But if three days or more have passed since the wound and there has been no spasm or trembling of the heart nor constriction of the lungs and other good dispositions of the sick person occur, then know that the wound is saved. And then treat it with dressings and the other treatment until it is healed."
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	"But if its healing is delayed and much time has passed, then know that a fistula has formed. Therefore treat it according to the chapter concerning fistulas."
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	"And if the wound is from a cleaver or knife and is simple on the surface of the foot or back, then treat it with what has been preceded about suture if it is large, or with powder if it is small."
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	"But if there has already been injury to the bone and pieces of it have already grown into the wound, then turn the wound over and try to remove those pieces if they are detached."
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	If they are not separated, then leave them inside until the plague can improve, for their extraction is alleviated.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other accidental plagues in other members, the remedy in treatment is the remedy that we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of the plagues of the belly.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indigestion which occurs in the belly is either great, small, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Regarding the great pain sometimes felt in the belly or nerves of the belly, it is necessary for them to be introduced and their suture to be made more vigorous and subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And small disruption is done more difficulty by another manner, and therefore the reduction of it is more difficult if you do not promptly introduce them to their proper place, for they are open and enlarged so that the introduction of them is made difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is moderate, for in that one it is not difficult to reduce the belly, as it is in the two species mentioned above.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that there are four ways of suturing the belly, but two of them are common and suitable for sutures of other plagues of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two others are proper to other plagues, but especially proper in suturing the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I will recount to you each one with exposition and explanation.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore I say that when the plague is small and some cause of the belly is exited by it, and it is difficult to reduce it, then this is in one of two ways: either by the smallness of the disruption as we have said, or when the belly has become inflated by the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when it is thus, then you should scalp that in such a way that you submerge a sponge or wet cloth in water alone or squeeze in hot water cumin, parsley, and broth with that the inflation may be resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes you will find it useful to use wine in which there is astringency, and it is better than water alone in the resolution of inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you see that the inflammation is resolved, then you should moisten the belly with water in which is cooked mallow and mallows, for by this it is alleviated from within with little cause.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the intrusion of the belly has been removed by this remedy, then you should cut through the disruption a little with an instrument with which you can excise the hemorrhoids.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first remedy is better when it is suitable that it not be cut and there is no need to cut unnecessarily or rashly.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	About the instrument, see its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	The one part of it is cut sharp and the other not-sharp, and the extremity is subtle, but not as subtle as a spatula, rather let it be somewhat obtuse.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the plague is enlarged and goes out from the belly, then it is necessary that its reduction be according to its natural form in its own proper place, if this is possible about this, for this is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the disruption is wide and is in the lower part of the belly, then you should make the sick person lie on their back and raise their buttocks as high as their head; and if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you should raise the head of the bed and place the feet higher than the shoulders.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the belly, then always keep your intention and consideration on this so that the part in which the plague is may be higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus you should administer this in large plagues and medium-sized ones.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small plagues, keep this that is prepared by you and especially make sure that the person administering it is among your closest friends, who should hold the disruption entirely with their hand and adjust the lips of it, and especially uncover from here to there so that no stitching occurs unnecessarily.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common manner of suturing: you take a needle or count of needles according to the quantity of the breadth of the plague; and then lay aside from the extremity of the disruption the finger of the ring finger, and stretch the needle once, but do not put thread in both extremities of the cord with two extremities of the ciphac that is left behind the cords of the fingers inside, until you make it penetrate this part; and you have now added two extremities of the cord and two extremities of the ciphac, and so you have made four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then stretch with doubled thread around the needle, and sometimes from two parts together, and then join both lips and the plague by a decent joining; and then leave the thickness of the finger and put another needle in that, and then join this with thread thus like feast with the first needle; and do not cease doing this if it is necessary with needles until you have completed all the contraction of the plague.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And let the needles be medium in thickness and subtlety, for thin needles easily cut the flesh; and thick ones are difficult to put into the cord, therefore they should be medium in thickness and subtlety.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is not necessary that the needle be put in both extremities of the cord very much, lest the flesh be easily cut and the plague open before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And do not prolong the suturing so that the plague is not prohibited from consolidation.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then cut the extremities of the needles so that they do not disturb the sick person during their sleep; and you will sprinkle powder on the suturing from every part, which holds the extremities of the needles; and leave them until you know that the plague is already consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And these kinds of suturing with needles in what manner are more convenient for small plagues, for there is enough in the suturing of them with one needle or two or around those.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	But the second kind of suturing is common: it is that you administer with suturing the four extremities, of the cord and two extremities of the ciphac, in one go, with a needle on which there is thread wrapped around it subtly and thickly.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then when the needle has penetrated these four extremities, reduce the needle from that same part where you began, so that the thread draws back and goes from the lower part of the plague to the higher one, so that the suturing is according to the sewing of cloth with which the cloths are stretched.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And pause between each suturing the quantity of the thickness of the little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this kind of suturing is known by men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with such suturing I healed the plague that had been cut in a man's belly, which had been struck with a dagger, and the disruption of the plague was more than a palm wide, and it had issued from the bowels around two palms of the bowel of the middle place, and the disruption was in the middle of the member; and then I reduced that after the bowel had been forced by the plague for twenty-four hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the plague was consolidated in the space of fifteen days or around, and he was cured and is healthy; and thus he lived for many years, and is converted in his dispositions.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other doctors had judged that he would not be healed; and by miracle it was done, for I did not cure him with ointment, because there was a place where ointment was not found nor any medicine, but only paused over the plague twice a day and washed it diligently with water of honey until it was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	"I say there are two kinds of stitches that are proper according to the narrative of the Word."
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	"And you begin with the closure of the cord, and insert the needle from outside to inside."
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	"And then with the needle penetrate into the cord and in that manner insert the thread lengthwise along the entire body, leaving the end of the thread out which you have inserted the needle; and make the needle penetrate from inside to outside on the other end of the mesh."
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	"And then when you have made that penetrate, now make it penetrate again in the same manner on the other end of the mesh from outside to inside; and leave the end of the thread which is on this side, and make the needle penetrate into the other end from inside to outside."
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	"And make it penetrate with that penetration in which you make it penetrate into the thread on the end of the mesh which is on the inside where all that penetrated."
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	"And again begin from this side and take that with the end which is of the thread on the other side, and remove the needle from the cord which penetrated, and again reduce that into that cord and tie the end of the thread which is on the other side with this end of the mesh; and remove that from the cord which is on its part."
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	"And do this once and again, and do it once more afterwards inside where you will close everything that is outside according to that example."
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	"And the sum of this manner of suturing is that you close with a skin suture in such a way that you sew the thread once from the end of the cord and leave it again inside so that it is completed."
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	"But the second type of suture which is particularly recommended by Gulia, and this concerns the inside and its recommendation, is that you sew it according to semilunar fashion in such a way that some surgeons sew it like that, thus joining together each part with its corresponding part conveniently by nature; and they apply the end of one side and the end of the mesh on the other end of that; and this is done as I recommend."
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	"You should keep the needle at the end of the mesh close to the outside part, and make it penetrate into the inside part in that sun, and leave two ends of the thread; and again turn the needle around and make it penetrate from outside to inside on the two ends of the thread."
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	"And again turn those loops around and make each loop penetrate from the inside part into the outside part on two ends of the mesh which are on the opposite side."
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	"And this manner of suturing is better than the common light suture, and it is a suture of which there was previous mention."
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	"This is the discourse of Gulia"
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	"And some say that abdominal suture is corrected with two needles, so you should insert into these loops a file and begin with needle insertion from that which you should do and make it penetrate inside to the other side according to the suture of those who sew the heart through the opening."
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	"And know that when there is rupture in the middle of the abdomen, then the suture of it is more difficult than in other parts of the abdomen."
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	"But judgment about the treatment of pleurisy is also judgment about other kinds of pleurisy."
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	"The cause of this is that when you succeed in treating recent pleurisy with its own blood before the air alters it, and reduce the chest and sew it up and dress it properly, then there will be no relapse on that occasion."
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	"And if the air has already altered the pleurisy, then some people in your presence will make hard dressings and apply the files, and they should be consolidated with thread and mesh; and then treat it like the treatment of other kinds of pleurisy until it is healed."
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	"But if you are not present with these medicines, then wait for it for a while because it begins to cough up blood soon, and changes its color twice a day like I have shown you, until it is healed; because in many cases when pleurisy is simple, you do not need other treatment."
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	"But if you fear that pleurisy may communicate to the main limbs, then it is necessary that you submerge lion's wool in oil of good quality or rose oil and apply it around the parts which are between the shoulders and leave them on for several days."
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	"And if there is pain or putrefaction in its chest because this happens many times, then treat it with black stiptic wine and more so if the putrefaction has reached the chest and an opening has been made penetrating into the cavity of it."
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	"And know that pleurisy which is in the thick chest is easier to heal than that which is in the subtle chests."
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	"And it is difficult to heal because the chest which is called 'gegunu' does not receive any healing of pleurisy that falls into it from anywhere; and this is due to the great multitude of veins that are in it and its large size, and its subtle body, and its proximity to the nature of nerves."
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	"But if what proceeds from pleurisy is tissue and you succeed in treating it recently, then reduce it according to your discretion with which you reduce the chests equally."
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	"But if it has passed to that extent and has become green or black, then you should strengthen it with a file on the spot that is darkened by it so that blood flow may come, because there are veins and arteries in the tissue."
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	"And then incise that which is other than that thread and leave two ends of the file hanging from the part outside of the pleurisy so that you may be relieved of its attraction; because you should remove the covering of the tissue and the emission of blood from pleurisy."
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	"Memorandum about pleurisy when it occurs in the chest."
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	"When there is rupture in the chest and it is small, then it is possible that it may be restored in some people because I saw a man who had been affected with pleurisy in his belly with percussion of lance and the pleurisy was on the right side of the stomach, and the pleurisy was old and had made fistula, and he was freed from it and became well."
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	"Therefore I followed the treatment of him although he was not certain about its healing, but I succeeded in subtly treating it until it was healed and the part was consolidated."
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	"And I also saw that the part was consolidated, but he suffered from illness which happened to him in his belly; and no one knew about this bad accident and he remained in his usual dispositions eating and drinking, and then entered into a bath and exercised himself in his sayings."
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	"And some experienced people have said that when pleurisy occurs in the chest and it is small, then it should be tied in this manner: and this is that you take figs with large heads; and then adjust the two lips of the pleurisy and place one of those figs which has its mouth open on the two lips of the pleurisy; therefore when it takes hold of them and strangles its mouth, cut off its head because it adheres and is not dissolved."
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	"And then place another fig near the first one, and do not cease this until you have used figs according to the quantity of all the pleurisy."
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	"And then reduce that and close up the pleurisy; and those heads will remain attached in the chest until the chest is healed, and there will be no harm to anyone."
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	"It is now possible to tie the intestine with a subtle thread made from the cleaned intestine of an animal, then take the end of this thread and tie it around the end of the intestine, wrapping it and carefully inserting the tied end back into its place."
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	"This method of suturing with ants is merely a matter of trust and hope."
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	"But if the wound is large or extensive, especially in one of the delicate intestines, for it only causes further subtlety and not true healing of the whole."
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	"Of the treatment of furuncles and fistulas."
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	"Do you know that any ulcer or abscess which opens and becomes chronic without being consolidated and drained always, wherever it may be in the body, is called a fistula, and we call this type of boil an 'azukem'?"
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	"And in truth, a fistula is a hard, thick, white node without pain and with a concavity like the concavity of a chicken's egg; for this reason it is called a 'rizat' ulcer, that is to say, an egg."
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	"And in some people it is moist, which oozes out; but if the moisture is quickly drained off, it heals in a few days."
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	"Sometimes this moisture is abundant, thick, and subtle."
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	"And I have already mentioned earlier in the section on wounds that any ulcer which does not heal or is not in bare flesh occurs due to one of nine causes: either from a lack of blood in the body, or from the malice of the ulcer itself; or because there is hard flesh between it and its lips preventing the growth of new flesh; or because it is too large; or because the ulcer itself is putrid and the material that enters it is of poor quality; or because the treatment used is inappropriate; or when corruption occurs in the region, causing pestilence; or due to the nature of the region itself, such as Endovel, where difficult digestion of illnesses occurs and delayed healing of boils takes place by nature; or because there is a bone or many bones in it."
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	"I have already shown all those causes, their signs and their treatments with medicines in the division [on ulcers]."
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	"And so I should tell you about the treatment of fistulas which is done by operation using ointments."
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	"And know that fistulas occur in all the members of the body; for there are those which pertain to large veins and arteries, or to nerves, or to the bladder, or to the intestine, or to some of the ribs, or to certain vertebrae of the back, or to certain joints composed by such composition as that of the hand and foot; and those are which give proximity to the principal member and similar ones."
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	"And so those fistulas which are according to this manner are of the diseases that are difficult to cure, and they do not receive care, and occupation with them is work and ignorance."
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	"And if there is some fistula the depth of which does not reach these places that I have mentioned, and you hope and trust in its cure, and you want to reach cognition of it, then take a tent of iron or bronze, and if the fistula goes straight, search for it with this."
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	"But if the fistula is tortuous, then investigate it with a tent of subtle lead, for lead due to the weight of its body is alleviated and curved towards tortuosity."
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	"And if the fistula has no horrible openings, it is not possible for you to indicate anything about it with a tent."
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	"Therefore, search for the opening through its openings, because the humidity with which you cleanse it will go towards the other openings and the flow from them."
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	"And furthermore, inquire carefully in what manner it is possible for you to know if here there are bones or nerves, and whether the fistulous cavity is distant or close, or whether it is a fistula with many openings that is above all of this with your full strength, with your examination, with which you examine the disease, and the discovery of pain through your compression with the hand on the place, and similar signs and accidental causes of apostemes."
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	"And when you have considered all of those causes with true knowledge, then go to the cure according to confidence: and that is whether you consider it now whether the fistula is apparent nearby in a healthy place, distant from joints, nerves, arteries, veins, or any of the places which I have mentioned to you."
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	"Now you dry out the fistula according to what was said beforehand about its narration, and remove that which is in that filtration and of corrupt flesh, and that which is born from the opening of the flesh, or of bile and similar things, and cure that wound when it has been healed."
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	"But if the fistula is of great depth and it is rectilinear, then you must insert it into the front as much as possible according to your ability, and then cleanse it from all its corrupt flesh; and also administer hot cloths wrapped in sharp medicines, and introduce them into the cavity of the fistula which you have taken hold of with iron."
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	"And do this several times within until the sharp medicine has burned away all that is rough in the cavity of the fistula due to corruption."
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	"Then restore it with ointments which generate healthy flesh until it has healed."
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	If it's not healed by this, then cauterize it as we have advised.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	If the cause of the fistula is bone and you must certify this, then inquire as we have advised and dry it according to our instructions, if you do not prohibit any cause of vein or nerve or main member as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed and there is some corruption and blackness in it, then scrape away that flesh until all corruption is removed. Then care for it with this medicine so that it may heal inside.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it does not heal and spits blood like this, then know that you have not yet reached the complete eradication of the corruption; therefore open up again carefully and search out the reason for it and cleanse it with your last strongest medicine, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And if it is healed, that is good. But if not, then know that the corruption is in the distant depth of the body which has not been reached, and therefore there is nothing to do but leave it alone.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the bone is corrupted and small, or if you can pull it out, then pull it out with gentle forceps which are suitable for that.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	But if many bones are exposed, then carefully remove all of them and do not leave any cause without your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if there is any difficulty with the causes of moisture, and there is no fear or error in their incision, then incise those membranes or flesh which are here, and relieve the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to remove the bones at that time, then pause over the wound and make a dressing for it so that it may close up. Leave this in place until it is around those bones of flesh and membranes, and guard the dressing so that it does not become consolidated, and that the section which you have incised during your operation remains open.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Therefore, if you fear [that the wound will become closed], apply a poultice soaked in olive oil or Egyptian anguent or one of the green ointments, for when those membranes have dried up and the bones are separated by ablation, then attraction is alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone such as the hipbone or thighbone or similar to those, and only the surface of it is corrupted, then scrape away that corruption with a rasp only until it has been completely removed. Then restore the dressing immediately.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if much of the bone is corrupted and the corruption has reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that wound immediately. Incise it completely down to where the corruption has reached, and cure it so that it becomes consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend this to you: what should happen to a man in his thigh so that you would pause and seek help during your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	A young man aged about 30 years suddenly felt pain in his thigh. There was swelling internally on the inner side of the thighbone up to where the abscess had reached the thighbone. It was an abscess with a large head and no external cause could be found.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And so much time passed with that [abscess] due to the error of doctors until it finally burst. Much matter flowed out, and its cure was then suspended until the hip was fistulized. Many orifices were made in the hard bone through which there was constant discharge of pus and moisture from the body.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	Then for many months various doctors attempted to treat him over a period of two years, but they knew nothing about the art until I was called upon.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And when I saw his hip and the matter that flowed from those orifices in great abundance, his whole body was already weakened and his complexion was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	Then I inserted a tent into one of those orifices until it reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then you searched and examined all the orifices and found that they all originated from every part of the hip.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	Then I took courage and incised over one of those orifices until I discovered a portion of the bone. I scraped away that corrupted part, which was earthy and corrupted and blackened. And a portion of the hip had already become corrupted where it had penetrated into the muscle.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	Then you closed up what was revealed and prepared for surgery on the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I thought that it was not the bone but only the corruption that should be cut out and closed up, as I had already determined.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	Then you suspended dressing with a consolidating medication for many days, yet it did not consolidate.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then you reopened and discovered again over the bone according to the first discovery, and you found continuous corruption with the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I closed up what seemed to me to be beyond that corruption. Then you proceeded with the cure and dressing, yet it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	Then you discovered it again and did not cease cutting the bone little by little particularly until you cut around about a palm's width of it. You extracted it with its marrow, and then you restored it with medications, and it became consolidated lightly and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	No further operation or section is necessary in this case except for the disposition of the weakness of his flesh and for the scarcity of his endurance and fear of death. For he was always depressed due to the superfluity of evacuation and bad syncope.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	Therefore, he was healed completely, and there is nothing lacking in the place of bone or hard flesh. His disposition in his body was good and he returned to his former strength; he changed his habits and did not do anything contrary to his health nor suffer harm from any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bone is prominent in place of flesh that is thin, then it is necessary for you to section it in this manner: Take linen and strengthen it at the end of that prominent bone, and command someone to stretch it out. Then pause that first linen with a thicker one made of wool. And then lay it over the flesh that is near the bone, and extend its end so that you can pull the flesh away from those parts. And uncover the flesh over the place where you want to cut so that the saw does not scrape the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place wood or a table below the bone appropriately, for when you do this, it prevents the saw from scraping the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	It is necessary that the sawing be done little by little over the corrupted place, because if the corruption is in the concavity of the bone and does not appear on its surface, it will be necessary to saw again afterwards.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	But if the bone is corrupted and not prominent, with one part continuous with another, and the corruption is in the middle or in a part of it, then uncover the flesh from all parts. And place wood below, and cut off that first part where the corruption is so that the sawing may continue into the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	Let the sawing be according to the location of the corruption, a little at a time, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	But if the corruption is at the joint, cut off that corrupted joint and saw off the bone where it is continuous with the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	But if the corruption is in the continuity of two joints, then there is no reason to saw off except for harm.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the palm of the hand or foot, it is very difficult. But you must inquire about the corruption and how it appears to you, and scrape away that corrupted part according to each disposition that is possible for you. And with each incision, be sure to correct what you have done so that you do not harm any vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	"You should know what kind of chisels and saws are suitable for cutting these bones, considering the location of the bones, their preparation, thickness, subtlety, size, smallness, hardness, and rarity; therefore, you must prepare appropriate instruments for each type of operation."
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	"Knowing that this operation requires the use of a specific tool, when you have great learning and long experience in the techniques of this art, and knowledge of various illnesses, then you will already know what is appropriate for each tool regarding all illnesses."
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	"And you, having learned at the end of this chapter the number of instruments that you will use with ease to perform your prohibition which you will practice on others."
Forma de serra:	Here is the English translation for "Forma de serra":

Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	The head of this drill should be shaped like a star-pointed key, and its points should be shaped like the tips of a star.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is advisable that at the same time they are rubbed with the heads of joints when they are corrupted, or if the mouth is too wide.

E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	It is made of Indian steel, and similarly covers all the causes that we have mentioned for razors, incisors, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of bone-cutting tips and bone saws
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	Extremities may become paralyzed either intrinsically or extrinsically. If you have treated that paralysis with medications and the cure does not help, sometimes the paralysis will spread to a limb for no apparent cause. In such cases, it is necessary to incise that limb at the location where the corruption is present, so that the illness can escape through that opening and thus avoid death or harm which would result in greater damage to the limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	The sign that this has happened is that the limb turns black where it was burned by fire, or that it becomes very dark where the paralysis has entered into that limb and spread throughout the entire body. Therefore, incision of that area is indicated in such cases.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	Similarly, if the cause of the paralysis is due to poisoning from causes like that of the sea scorpion or viper or spider and similar ones.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the paralysis or poisoning is at the tip of the finger, then you should incise the finger and not allow the corruption to spread into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	Similarly, if it reaches the hand, then you should incise that area at the wrist, so that the corruption does not spread into the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if it goes up from there, then incise the arm at the elbow joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	"And if corruption and dampness spread beyond the cold, then death of the patient ensues; but to administer another cause for this in cure is a matter of quantity of power."
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	"And similarly if corruption invades the said lung, then you shall insert a finger into one of its nostrils."
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	"And if you take hold of the lung, then you shall remove it entirely."
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	"But if it cannot enter the nostril, then you shall insert your finger into the space at the junction of the nostril."
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	"And if corruption has already spread over the nostril, then there is nothing else to do except dismiss it and let the patient die."
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	"The method of inserting or cutting the member is that you should stretch one thread at the part where you wish to insert it, and stretch another thread over the place. Then extend one thread above and below, and stretch another thread in its middle; then separate the flesh which is between the two threads with a sharp knife until the whole flesh is exposed, and then it shall be inserted or cut."
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	"It should also be stopped with linen at all parts so that it does not touch the place where it was; and that healing may come to the patient with an appropriate scar and a cauterized wound."
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	"But if bleeding occurs while performing the operation, then you shall cauterize the place carefully, or apply some powders to stop the bleeding. And then return to your treatment until it is completed."
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And then bind the member with a bandage at its proper place, and care for it until it is healed."
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	"And I tell you what happened to a man in his foot. He had this accident which we are talking about, which is the fourth kind that happens in the foot due to burning that was like the combustion of fire."
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	"And that corruption happened first in his toe, so that it spread throughout the entire foot."
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	"And then that man prepared to remove the member because he could no longer bear the pain and burning. He inserted his foot at its joint and it was healed with fire."
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	"For a long time, this same corruption happened in the finger of the hand indicated."
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	"And then it came to me and caused that excess fluid to be reflected back onto the hand where I had placed my medicines for its cleansing, so that the excess fluid was not discharged and began to spread to another finger until it reached the hand."
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	"And he asked me to cut his hand off, but I did not want to do that hoping for the reflection of that excess fluid. And more than that, I feared that if I were to cut off his hand it would be mortal, because the power of the disease was strong."
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	"And after he left me, he returned to his own land and later I heard that that man had cut off his entire hand, but then it was healed."
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	"And I have not yet finished this story except to serve as an aid for those who suffer from this disease, and so that it may be significant for which it is significant and according to which it should be treated."
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	"On the treatment of sinusitis and the quality of cleansing enema with medicines."
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	"When an aposteme occurs on some fleshy members and the space of the aposteme is prolonged until it collects pus, and then it bursts and perforates, and the pus comes out, leaving the place empty like a vessel, and the cord that is above it appears thin like a wisp of silk, and there is no further corruption nor does it impress on bone or nerve or ligament, it is called 'sinus' but not 'fistula.'"
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	"But if the space is prolonged until corruption impresses on some member, then it is called a fistula and not sinus."
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	"And the treatment is to cut off that cord entirely as it is rolled up, especially if it is thin and appears like silk cloth, ensuring that it does not adhere to the place due to its corruption."
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	"But if you hope that the cord will adhere and that corruption has not yet progressed further, and there is swelling at its mouth, then you should treat it with an enema."
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	"And if you examine the sinus, then if it is large and the arm that emerges has a foul odor, then you should cleanse it with an Egyptian medicine made of oil, vinegar, and cinnamon bark ground up equally and adjusted in a vessel, which should be cooked over fire until the medicine reaches the consistency of honey."
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	"And then you should take some of it and dissolve it with water and honey, and use that to cleanse the sinus, tightening its opening, and leave the medicine in it for about two hours."
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	"And then remove it with a sponge; do this for so many days until the sinus is cleansed and the infection is removed."
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	"And sometimes it is cleansed with water of ashes when this medicine is not available to you. Then take the ashes of grapes and put them on the water, then mix it together and cleanse it with that until you are satisfied that the sinus is now healed."
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	"And if the disease does not tolerate this Egyptian medicine nor water of ashes, then you should cleanse it with water and honey mixed together in equal parts and also mix some wine with honey, because the property of honey is to cleanse and wash, and wine makes the sinus adhere, especially when the wine has excess tannin and dryness."
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	"And when you do this several times and are satisfied that the sinus has been removed, then cleanse it with something that causes flesh to grow in it."
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	"And if you take some diaphoretic ointment and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent wine, or cleanse it with other medicines and ointments that have the properties that I have already written about in the treatise on ointments."
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	"And if the opening of the sinus is narrow and cannot receive the nozzle of the enema, then you should dilate it little by little with a small iron rod, pausing in between to soak it in Egyptian ointment or basilicon ointment until it is dilated."
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	"And similarly if the opening is wide, then you should bring together its lips with a suture and leave some of it open for the insertion of the enema without any addition."
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	"And if the opening of that from which the arm emerges is located above its parts, then dry it with pus below where it is in order to cause the arm to flow downwards, because when the arm is blocked by the pressure of the sinus, flesh may be generated within it."
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	"And if it is not possible to dry the sinus within the environment of pus below as you wish, then prepare the member with such preparation that the arm flows out of it lightly according to what seems appropriate to you and without any cause for the arm being retained."
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	"And take consolidating medicines that should be placed on the sinus appropriately according to what you wish, then extend them over cloth of linen."
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	"And the linen should be of such quantity that it covers all of the sinus; and then, near to the right side of the opening of the sinus, make an incision with forceps a little larger than the opening of the sinus, then extend over another piece of linen some ointments according to the size of the incision, pausing them on this for a distant position from the opening of the sinus so that it may alleviate the exit of the arm and not cause any pressure, and only change the linen once or twice."
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	"He who is above the opening of the sinus, he removes at all times so that it does not escape from its place in the arm."
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	"And how do you know whether what comes out of the arm is too much or too little, or if it's digested, or not digested?"
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	"Also consider the location of that sinus, whether the patient feels pain there or not, and whether there is an abscess."
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	"And when your treatment is prolonged in such a manner, and you see that the matter thrown out of the sinus opening already adheres, or approaches adhesion, then on the third day, carefully remove it. And when you remove it, immediately change the cloth for another one and renew the dressing."
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	"But if a considerable amount of space remains in the sinus after its opening, do not despair about the adhesion of it, because healing will occur. For some people, there is delayed generation of flesh in wounds, and among these are those in whom the opposite occurs."
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	"And if after many days the arm remains undigested from the sinus, then you know that the sinus does not adhere. And if the adhesion of the sinus is delayed and is the cause of prolonged healing, then adjust in the drying of medications. And if medications are humid in their substance and virtue, they become dry like a fine ointment, when there is an adjusted superfluity of addition of rose water."
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	"And the final thing to be done when it is cured is that you take some fine ointment and dissolve it in rose oil, and place it on a linen cloth soaked in its own substance. And apply that cloth warmly on it, and use it thus."
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	"And if it seems that there is no ointment available at the time of action, then take honey and thicken it with heat, and use it. Or else, take myrrh and aloe wood and incense, grind all together finely powdered over the honey when it is on the fire, and apply this mixture on a cloth and place it on the sinus. And apply that honey which has been cooked until it thickens, and powder it on a cloth and place it."
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	"And sometimes it is administered with long and fine roots of celestial lily (which is celandine) and powdered barley and centaurea, and use these simples alone or adjust them together ground and sifted finely powdered over the honey which has been prepared. And use it."
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	"And if the sinus remains prolonged and is not healed by this treatment, then know that the corruption is in the bone of it. And make an examination in the bones or in other hard members or in the ligaments. Then treat it with fistular cure, as mentioned above."
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	"On the treatment of panaritium, ongnis attrita and incision of added finger and section."
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	"An ingrown toenail is an accumulation of flesh that occurs next to the nail of the big toe of the foot or hand, and it grows quickly in other toes as well.
