When its treatment is delayed, it becomes more serious; either it's a chronic ingrown toenail, cauterized and corrupted, emitting a foul odor, or the entire toe may become corrupted."
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	"And so, when you have finished what we've said in this section and your treatment does not conform, then it is necessary that you cut away with iron all the excess flesh that remains from the nail and properly cauterize the wound afterwards, for cautery is very helpful in this matter."
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, yet if there are excrescences on the nail that begin to press upon the flesh inside, causing it to throb and ache, then you should make a subtle incision at the angle of the nail that presses against the flesh, lift up that part and cut away the flesh easily, and apply over what remains of the flesh cooling medicines until all is removed; and properly dress that with ointment until it heals."
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	"But if the corruption has already reached the bone, then you should cut into the bone and remove it, for there is no time when the bone will heal if it is corrupted."
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And if the corrosion and corruption extend to the finger, then you should cut into it at one of its joints according to what is remembered about its condition, and properly dress that until it heals."
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	"But if the nail receives injury or pressure and there is intense pain in that place, then first perform bloodletting at the beginning of the illness, and properly scrape the nail with a sharp spatula with a transverse section from top to bottom, making sure that the section does not reach into the flesh beneath the nail, for you will cause great pain to occur and it will produce an excess growth of flesh in that location; and properly dress that place with something that relieves pain."
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	"But this nail, which is found in most men, is usually entirely fleshy and also has bone, or it may be very hard at the tip of the nail."
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	"And some are born at the root of the joint, or their origin is in some of the joints of these fingers."
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	"But that which is born in some joints of the finger does not hurt, and that which is born at the joints is usually painful."
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	"And those that are born fleshy have a broader section, and it should be cut off at its root with a broad spatula."
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	"But that which is born at the root of the joint is difficult to cure; therefore beware of cutting it off."
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"But if it is born in the middle of a finger joint, you should first cut into the flesh of it with a round incision down to the bone, and then saw through it with one of those suitable saws, and properly dress that until it heals."
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	"But consolidation which occurs among these between their veins or by the nature of the person born so, or by consolidation due to plague or burning from fire, or by appearance, then that consolidation should be cut into until it returns to its natural form."
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	"And also place between their dressings of softened linen soaked in rose oil to prevent them from becoming consolidated lightly, and separate those that are consolidated with a thin sheet of lead so that they may be consolidated according to what is necessary."
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	"And similarly, if consolidation occurs in some of these on the palm, then you should cut that consolidation according to what is prepared and convenient for the shape of the member."
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	"Of incisions for removing warts, there are three kinds."
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	"Varicose veins are twisted, thick veins full of melancholic superfluities that appear in the mouth of body members, and they occur more often in the legs, especially among travelers, workers, and porters."
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	"Then you should administer a purge for the body of black bile several times with strong expulsion, and also bleed the patient from the basilic vein."
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	"But the cure for them with iron is done in two ways: one way is that it should be incised and drawn out that black blood, and the other way is that the vein should be raised and all of it extracted."
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	"The section is done in this way: first, immerse the beginning of the vein with cold water so that the thick blood may be resolved, which is the sediment of the vein, and next, strongly tie the vein of the sick at its upper part near the thigh bone into a bandage, and next dry the vein at one place, or two, or three with a wide section, and then raise the black blood with the tweezers from below the part where it exits, upwards downwards until as much blood as desired and as many times as necessary has exited, which is the amount that can be tolerated by the patient."
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	"And also, he should tie it up, and command him to abstain from foods that generate black bile."
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	"And repeat the cure by phlebotomy when the veins are full and this is necessary for the patient."
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	"But the raising of it is done in this way: you who raises the vein of the sick, if he has much pain and fever, and next puts him in bed and immerses his vein with cold water until it reddens and the veins are dilated; or that he be exercised by strong exercise, if bathing is not available to you, until the limb is heated."
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	"And then dry the vein on the right side of it with a section in its length or at its end where it joins the bone, or at the top part of it near the heel."
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	"And then open the vein with forceps and strip the vein from all sides until it appears at sensation, and one should look for its appearance as often as desired declining towards blackness."
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	"And then remove the bandage and the vein becomes white and strong like a chord."
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	"And then you place there what has been elevated until it rises above the bandage and remains raised, and suspend that with one or two cloths."
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	"And then dry another section near that section for three days and then strip the bandage from above the vein until it appears."
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	"And then elevate that and cut into it again with another section near the heel, and then remove that and elevate it until it exits through the second section, and then remove that from above that."
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	"And do this until you have removed it from the section that is above or below all sections until everything has exited; and then cut into it again."
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	"And if you cannot remove and elevate it, then insert a thick needle with strong thread and tie it up and remove it; or put there what has risen above the bandage and twist your hand around it until it is completely wound."
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	"And make sure that it is not cut; for if it breaks, it will be difficult to raise that much and harm will come upon the patient through that."
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And when everything has been removed, then place over the site of the wound lanolin immersed in vinegar and rough oil and unrefined oil until it is healed."
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	"And if the vein is contracted without tortuosity where there can be wrapping around the divisions and not according to what has been said, then you should make incisions over all parts of that tortuosity and at its wrapping places, and then suspend it with forceps until everything rises."
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	"And make sure that your incision does not cut the vein and does not wound it, for it will be difficult to raise it if you do so; use your caution in this."
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	**Form of the incident with which the vein is cut:**
Forma de unci orp:	"Prepare a ram's horn:"
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	Not like needles it is not sharp nor has it an acute extremity so that it does not harm the vein; and it is of thick flexibility lion, for if it were subtle, it would cut the vein through its subtlety; having in it superfluous thickness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of leg vein extraction
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the calves of the legs, such as at Atig in Arab territory and in dry and hard terrains of little tenderness where there is neither grass nor water.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is also generated in other places on the body apart from the calves.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its gestation is of putrefaction which comes from leaving the spine like venom inside the body, serpents and worms, crabs and worms generating between the spine and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of the onset of its occurrence is that this vein becomes inflamed in the calf with a sudden inflammation; and nearby there is an ulceration; and from there begins the vein to come out from that ulceration which appears like the root of a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And then when the extremity appears, immediately you must wrap around it one weight of lead whose weight is that of one dragon, between two dragons, and hold it there and let the lead hang suspended from the calf.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as some cause causes it to come out from its places outside, wrap that in lead and hold it there.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it is not prolonged, then you should cut off a part of it and wrap up the remaining; but do not cut it so deep that it remains inside, for if you cut it too deeply it will contract and enter into the flesh and cause an aposteme and putrefaction in the place with a bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	For that reason it should be treated gently and extracted little by little until it is completely removed from the end of it and none remains inside the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And this vein has been found in some men to be as long as two palms and ten fingers, and I have even heard that one was twenty palms long.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is cut at the time of its treatment, then insert a straw into the track of it and pierce it with a long straw through the body until all that is in the matter has been evacuated, and administer putrefaction to the place for some days with medicines; and also treat it with the cure for apostemes.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has many branches, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or in the foot, and comes out from there with many openings, and each opening has its own branch.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore treat it as we have said in the division above, and with what is said above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of cutting for worms generated under the skin, called bovine ailment.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This ailment is called in some lands "bovine ailment" because many times it occurs in oxen, and there is born between the skin and the flesh a worm which goes throughout the body, pushing and pulling, and is felt from member to member until it tears apart the skin and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation occurs because of putrefaction of certain humors, just as happens with worms and serpents and earthworms and roundworms in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared because of its harmfulness, for when it goes in the body and rises up to the head, and reaches the brain, then it causes a great disturbance there and enters and destroys the brain, which happens many times.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore when you wish to cure it and extract it, then do not do so unless you see its movement and appearance by feeling it, and then you should press down on what is above it and on both sides of it with pressure and constriction, and then dry up around it and extract it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is embedded in the flesh and cannot be caught hold of, then you should apply a cautery with fire to the place where it resides until it is burnt up, for the greatest danger is corruption of it with which it corrupts the place as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	But if it reaches the head near the brain, then press strongly on the brow with firm constriction and also dry up around it and extract it; and let the patient use medicines to purge his body of bad corrupt humors, and avoid foods that cause putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of cutting for the ailment called nafir
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This ailment is called in our land "nafir," and it is a pain that comes in some members, and also changes from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And you will see this one as I will describe to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to see a woman patient in a village, and I uncovered her arm and saw a small inflammation in the vein of the elbow, and as it had been there for about an hour, I saw that inflammation move like a worm pushing itself along, but more slowly than if it were actually moving, just as if it were molten silver running from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then the pain went away from that place and became apparent in the muscle, and stayed there for about an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	"Next, correct the other body between where it reaches the other arm."
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	"I also told him to turn himself around so that I could see his whole body; and he was amazed at the transformation of his limbs and their speed."
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	"And I had seen such things before in my travels according to that manner, but I had never heard of anyone suffering pain from being transformed limb by limb."
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	"But I did not see this among the women as I saw it in men."
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	"And you do not think that is because the woman was old, with dry skin and visible veins, and in this appearance there seemed to be that windiness transformed."
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	"And it is necessary that this backward curvature does not appear in those who are graceful and have moist skin with veins concealed."
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	"And when you want to perform the operation, and the patient feels that pain, then it is not apparent on the surface as we have said. Then press down upon him and release him gently and carefully until that constrained windiness is released, and cauterize the spot."
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	"But if you do not see it among your patients, then treat him with exercise of the body and with what expels windiness, and apply to him pills made from fetid herbs and pills made from serpentaria and similar things."
De extraccio de sagetas.	"On the extraction of arrows."
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diverse according to species and the parts of the body where they strike, for their diversity is such that those with large points, small ones, concave tips, or blunt heads are solid; while those with three edges, tongues, or star-shaped tips have different properties.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And those that strike according to limbs and parts of the body are of two kinds: For limbs or principal members cause death, such as the head, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, intestines, bladder, and their like; therefore when they strike in one of these members and you observe signs of death which I will mention later, at that time it is necessary to avoid removing that arrow from those places where death ensues most easily, and when no such bad signs appear and the arrow is not hidden deep within the member, then remove it and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	"Servants are distinguished by when an arrow strikes them and passes through the bone, exiting from the cyphac which is on the brain. This occurs due to violent soda and scotomia, vertigo, redness in the eyes, inflammation and redness of the tongue, spasms and confusion of understanding, vomiting bile, speech is suddenly cut off, voice destroyed, and white humid plague-like matter exits from the place, similar to water."
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	"If these symptoms appear before you, then you should abstain from treatment and extraction of the arrow if it is not outside."
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	"When the arrow strikes near the left breast and seems to be stuck in hard flesh, not soft flesh, you will feel a sudden movement like a pulse or flow of black blood. There will also be coldness in the extremities, chills, sweating, fainting, and soon after death without delay."
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	"And when the arrow has pierced the lung, there is an emission of frothy blood from the wound. The vessels near the neck swell up, the patient's complexion changes, they expire loudly or sigh for breath frequently, and desire cool air."
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	"And if the arrow strikes the diaphragm, which is located in the lower chest area, there will be pain near the lower ribs. There will also be sudden, violent coughing with pain and sighs, but not all members or muscles will be affected."
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	"And if the arrow strikes the stomach, then there will be violent vomiting of undigested food."
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	"And if the arrow strikes the abdomen and becomes lodged within it, then there will be some hole or tear in the skin, flesh, or intestines (which may have ruptured). There is little hope for recovery through extraction of the arrow."
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	"And if the arrow strikes the bladder and urine is excreted externally, with some blood or other matter from the wound outside. There will be severe pain over the area of injury, indicating that death is imminent."
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	"However, the other members such as the face, neck, throat, shoulders, arms, spine, collarbone, hip, thigh and their counterparts are saved according to the greatest dispositions when the arrow does not hit any vein or artery, nor is it venomous."
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	"And I will tell you what I have seen of these arrows, so that you may know about their treatment."
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	"The cause is that in a man who was struck by an arrow in the lacrimal gland of his eye near the root of his nose, when I extracted it from the other side of his ear, he recovered without any injury to his eye."
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	"And I extracted another arrow from a Jew who was struck in the eyelid of his eye, leaving the eyelid puffed up afterwards. The arrow was already hidden and could not be seen except for a small part that adhered to its shaft. It was one of the sharp arrows of the Turks with a lion's head made of iron without feathers."
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	"And the Jew recovered, and there was no great harm done to his eye."
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	"And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man who was struck in the throat. It was an Arab arrow with feathers on it, and I cut through it between two guides and then carefully extracted it. The Christian man recovered."
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	"And I extracted another arrow from a man who was struck in his belly and thought that he would die from it. But thirty days had passed without any change in his condition due to the arrow's location. Therefore, I cut into the area around the arrow and pulled it out carefully, and the man recovered with no great harm done."
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	"And I saw another man in whom an arrow had become lodged in his back. The wound around it had healed over seven years later, and then the arrow suddenly emerged at the root of his thigh."
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	"And I saw a woman who was struck by an arrow in her belly. The wound healed over inside her without any change in her condition, and the woman suffered no injury to any of her natural functions."
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	"And I saw another man who was struck by an arrow in his face. The wound healed over and the arrow head broke off without causing much pain, and he appeared similar to these others."
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	"And I extracted the arrow from the face of one of the king's nobles that was lodged in his nasal septum and had deviated slightly towards the right side. The entire arrow was hidden."
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	"And I was called for his treatment three days after he was struck by the arrow."
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	"And then I opened the wound of the arrowhead very narrowly. Then I probed it with a subtle finger but did not feel anything; however, he felt pricking on the outside of his right ear. Therefore, I believed that this pricking was due to the tip of the arrow."
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	"And I widened the opening with an ointment having attractive and digestive properties, believing that this location would swell up so that the arrowhead's location might appear to me, so that it could be seen."
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	"And no significant harm occurred at that location where the arrowhead had reached. I continued applying the ointment for many days without any harm occurring, and the wound healed during this time. After several months had passed, one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and remembered it to me."
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	"And then I applied a burning caustic medicine over the wound for many days until it opened up. Then with my finger I probed that area and extracted the tip of the arrow subtly, which adhered to its shaft."
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	"And precisely by that burning medicine I opened the wound until I saw the tip of the arrow visibly. And I spent time on this matter for four months."
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	"And after the wound was enlarged and it was possible for me to insert forceps into it, I did so but could not grasp anything with them. Then I did not cease probing and manipulating that area in various ways until one day I began extracting it using methods of extraction described at the end of this chapter, specifically using forceps adapted for descending fractures. And after that wound was restored."
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	"And some physicians judged that the cartilage of the nose cannot be restored, but I restored it and the wound healed completely, and the patient recovered entirely with no harm remaining in him due to any cause."
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	"And I tell you about the methods of extracting some arrows because it would be too long to discuss those that I have not mentioned here, for the divisions of this art and its definitions are not understood by narration alone, nor can they comprehend them in this book."
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	"And the learned artisan compares little about much, and about what is present rather than what is absent. And he discovers new operations and new instruments whenever strange causes occur in this art."
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	"And therefore I say that arrows are not ejected from the limbs into which they have been inserted except by two methods: either by attraction of the area in which it is lodged, or by the opposite direction of its path."
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	"And that which is ejected through the entrance point, or is an arrow proceeding in a fleshy area, is pushed out and ejected."
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	"And if the arrow does not come out at the time it is cut, then you should leave it alone for a few days until the flesh around it softens and its attraction and exit are alleviated."
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	"Similarly, if the matter has entered into bone and does not yield to your efforts, then leave it alone for some days and treat it again with attraction and motion each day, and it will be discharged."
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	"If it does not yield to your efforts after several days, then you must perforate around the arrow in that bone entirely with a thin awl where the space made by the arrow is widened, and extract it out."
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	"If the arrow has entered the bone of the head and has already pierced one of the ventricles of the brain, and some of those accidents that I mentioned earlier appear in the illness, then abstain from extracting the arrow and leave it there until the patient's state is equalized for several days; because if the arrow pierces the brain, death will not be prolonged."
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	"If the arrow has only entered the flesh of the bone and does not pass into the brain, and the illness remains for several days without any of those accidents occurring, then you should endeavor to attract the arrow and to attract it out."
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	"But if it is deeply embedded and does not yield to your extraction efforts, then you should administer thin awls around the arrow as we have recommended, and cure the wound internally until it heals."
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	"But if the arrow has already disappeared in the place of the wound and is hidden from sight, then you should explore there and try, and if you feel it, then attract it out with some suitable instruments for attracting it."
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	"And if you cannot get it out because of the thickness of the flesh and the length of the bone, and here there is neither bone nor nerve nor vein, then make an incision in the flesh until it is widened enough that it will be possible to extract the arrow."
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	"And if the ears are those which are held, then cut away completely the flesh in which it is embedded with all the effort you can muster; and endeavor on this, if you cannot avoid cutting through the fracture of the ears and twisting them until you succeed."
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	"And when you perform the extraction of the arrow in any place where it is, then use a twist of your hand and forceps at all points until it succeeds; and be very subtle so that the arrow is not broken and that it is made easy for you to attract it and extract it."
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	"And if you cannot succeed in that at your first attempt, then leave it for a few days until the swellings around it have subsided, and then again treat it when it is eased."
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	"But if you encounter flow of blood, then administer what we have said about treatment in its chapter."
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	"And guard your skill in incising vein or nerve or artery, and endeavor in every possible way to avoid the arrow; and do this with facility and tranquility and slowness and steadiness as we have taught you and recommended."
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	"And thus do you contract the arrow in such a way that the wound is made according to the figure according to which the lodging of the arrow was in it, for this is more advantageous."
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	"But if this is not possible for you, then administer what is possible for you according to the figures."
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	"But arrows which are fired from the opposite direction, or those which have already caused some wounds in their exterior parts, or which appear to be near the surface of the wound due to the swelling above it and its prominence; then cut over that; and let the section be according to the quantity taken by the forceps; and then pull it out, for it is easy to extract."
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	"But if it is retained in the bone, then twist your hand according to its direction until the arrow presses on the bone, and widen it with it further, and then extract it."
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	"And otherwise, leave it for a few days, and then again treat it as we have said."
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	"And if the shaft of the arrow is in that, then push it out with it."
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	"But if the shaft is broken and you want to administer propulsion, then introduce this, if it is blunt, strike concavely so that it enters between the concavity of it in the head of the arrow and then push it out with it."
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	"But if the arrow is concave, then push it out with a strong instrument entering into it, for the arrow will be eased by that."
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	"And if the arrow is embedded in bone, then it is necessary for you to cut away all the flesh around it, if this is possible for you, and then treat it with what is appropriate."
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	"And if the arrow strikes bone, or enters the belly, bladder, or side, and is so close that you can touch it with your hand, and if it is possible for you to cut over it, then cut over it and guard yourself from incising vein or nerve, and extract it; and sew up the wound if necessary, and treat it until it is healed."
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	"Form of forceps with which arrows are extracted:"
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	The tips of their tongues are sharp as bird beaks, fashioned like saws when they grasp at the arrow to not let it escape.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And there are many different kinds of beaks, large, small and medium-sized, according to the size of the arrowhead and its width, the breadth of the wound and the tightness of the flesh.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Shape this concave extremity like a bird's feather to relieve the insertion of the arrowhead into the wound, and pressure from that wound.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Shape the pressing of the concave extremity
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	like this way, so that it may alleviate the insertion into the concave arrowhead and is pressed with it.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Venous phlebotomy
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins used for phlebotomy are: 30, of which 16 are in the head. There are two pulsating veins near the ears called "auriculars," two herbs on both temples, two veins in the lacrimal ducts of both eyes called "aspectantes," one vein prepared in the middle of the forehead, and another at the tip of the nose; two jugular veins at the neck; two veins above the upper lip; two veins inside the lower lip; two veins behind the tongue called "algeletic"; and two veins on either side of the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	The veins that are phlebotomized in the arms are five:
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	"And in the foot and leg there are three veins: one of these is that which leaves the curvature of the wild boar's tooth; the second is saphenous, and its location is near the leg of the domestic dog; and the sciatic vein, and its location is near the leg of the wild boar; and in the leg there are other veins similar to those."
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	"The benefit of treating veins near the ears is for old-fashioned headaches and migraines, and for healing wounds and ulcers on the head from ancient times."
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	"And the method of letting blood from these veins is as follows: it should be done on a clear day, and the patient's head should be shaved in the occiput area where both veins are located, using a wide cloth with good friction; then strongly bind the patient's head with a bandage that appears at both locations near the ears in two points pressed down on the head; then seek that vein with your finger, and if you feel its pulse with your finger, here signal to stop."
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	"Then take the lancet knife, which is that which is inserted, and carefully insert it into the vein in the elbow until the bleeding comes to the bone."
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	"And then raise your hand with the vein and elbow upwards, and incise the vein with an indirect incision."
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	"The length of the incision should be equal to two fingers placed side by side or nearby; let blood flow out as much as desired."
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	"And sprinkle powder on it and leave that until healed."
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	"And as already mentioned at the beginning of this book, an incision is made there and they are cauterized."
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	"More about the two great veins that are in the temples: the benefit of phlebotomy is for ancient migraine, persistent headache, and frequent eye inflammation, as well as acute excess blood flowing to the heart."
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	"And the quality of performing phlebotomy on them is, as I recommend to you: compress the illness with your hand until the two veins appear clearly through touch and sensation; then, feel their pulse with your fingertips, and at that moment strike [with the lancet]."
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	"And likewise, elevate the vein above it with your index finger, insert the phlebotomy lancet diagonally from below, elevate the vein upwards, and incise it thus as you have done on the other two veins; let blood flow out according to your need."
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	"And then release the compression of the illness, place your finger over the vein for an hour to stop the bleeding, and apply pressure on that spot with cotton and powder, pressing it down firmly. Leave it until healed."
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	"And this has already been preceded by the memory of them [the two great veins], their incision, and attraction at the beginning of this book."
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	"And therefore, the benefit of phlebotomy from the vein on the forehead is also the phlebotomy of the cephalic vein for ancient facial illnesses, migraine, and eye disorders with infected ulcers."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And the quality of performing phlebotomy on him is, as I recommend to you: that the illness compress his head with a cloth until the vein appears; and then take the instrument called 'fossor' [excavator], which has this form:"
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	"Press the prominent point on the top of the 'fossor' onto that vein and puncture it with a quick or slow motion, according to his condition. Let the blood flow out according to the amount you desire; then release the compression of the illness and press down firmly until healed."
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	"Sometimes it is performed with a broad phlebotomy lancet; however, it need not be acute-pointed like the other phlebotomies. Approach it from the side and incise it across the transverse vein, as bone is nearby and would break easily if the lancet were too thin."
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	"But the benefit of the two veins that are located on the eyelids is for treating scabies of the eyelids due to inflammation and sebaceous matter in the eyelids, as well as facial illnesses."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	"And the quality of performing phlebotomy is that the patient compress their head with a cloth, and then you incise those veins while standing at his head."
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	"And the phlebotomy should be made across and slightly along the length with a blunt-pointed lancet, as there is little flesh in that location. If the lancet is too thin, its tip may break easily."
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	"And then let the blood flow out as much as you need, and press down on those spots, keeping them compressed for one night. Then release them."
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	"But the phlebotomy of the nasal vein is beneficial for acute fever and violent colds, as well as facial illnesses, migraine, and inflammation that occurs in the face, especially when it is chronic."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	"And the quality of performing phlebotomy on him is that the patient compresses their head and you take hold of their nose with your left hand, then take a long, thin lancet and insert it into the middle of the tip of the nose in a straight line, as the vein does not appear here by touch. As soon as blood begins to flow..."
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	"...gradually withdraw your hand along with the lancet and let blood flow according to your need. Then compress that area for one night, as it is easily restored."
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	"But the benefit of phlebotomy on both cheeks is for constriction of the throat and the onset of leprosy, as well as many other illnesses such as eczema and malignant ulcers that are corroded, like herpes zoster."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	"And the quality of performing phlebotomy on those veins is that the patient compresses each side of their head with a cloth; then stand over the patient's head while they are seated on a chair."
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	"And then incise the long vein with a broad, blunt-pointed lancet gradually. Then extract blood according to a moderate quantity or as much as is needed at that time. And do the same on the other vein."
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	"And then release the cloth and compress both veins with a medium force to prevent the patient from fainting. Then let them rest overnight, as the wound will be healed by morning."
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	"And the benefit of phlebotomy on the veins in the angle of the jaw is for treating small abscesses and pustules in the mouth, gingivitis, malignant ulcers and cracks, as well as malignant ulcers that occur in the nose and around it."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	"And the quality of performing phlebotomy on those veins is that you have the patient sit facing you and compress their head with a cloth. Then roll back the lips and look for two veins, one on the right side of the lip and the other on the left side. The demonstration of each is by its darkness, as there are many small black veins around them. Then incise each vein obliquely."
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	"But if you are in doubt about which one is the correct vein to incise, then aim for the incision that shows more blood and pus."
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	"And perform phlebotomy on the two veins located above the lips as well."
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	"It is more common to incise both veins that are on the lower lip."
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	"But the benefit of phlebotomy on both veins that are below the tongue is for preventing suffocation due to inflammation of the throat, as well as inflammation of the uvula and other mouth illnesses."
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	"And the quality of performing phlebotomy on those veins is that you have the patient kneel between your thighs facing the sun, elevate their tongue with a mouth gag, and look below the tongue to see one vein on its left side and another vein on its right side. The color of each vein tends towards darkness."
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	"And then perform phlebotomy on each vein; but be careful not to withdraw your hand while doing so, as there are arteries below them."
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And the veins that are commonly phlebotomized in the elbow are those which are present in all humans. Phlebotomy on these veins is performed in two ways: either by puncturing with a mulberry-shaped or olive-shaped lancet of varying sharpness, or by cutting with a scalpel-like lancet called 'alnessil', and this is how it is done:"
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	"And this alnessil is designed for cutting, and its edges are sharp and thin according to the width of the veins and their degree of tension."
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	"Method of phlebotomy with a mulberry-shaped lancet:"
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	"It is used like this: its edge should be aimed at opening concave veins that appear full and contain thick, turbulent blood."
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	"And this is the method of phlebotomy with an olive-shaped lancet:"
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	"This phlebotomy uses a lancet of lesser width and very sharp point, suitable for drawing blood from fine veins containing subtle, citrine-colored blood."
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	"Of the remedies for phlebotomy of the basilica vein, which is one of three veins: for it draws out the blood from illnesses that are below the throat and the stomach, and thus relieves the chest and abdomen."
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	"And let the phlebotomist be careful when performing phlebotomy on this vein, for there is an artery nearby, and if he errs in puncturing the phlebotomy site, he may injure that artery and cause profuse bleeding. Therefore, it is necessary not to puncture it with a sharp point but rather to cut it with scissors."
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if the basilica vein cannot be seen manifestly, then you should leave it alone and move on to another vein or seek some branching one; but if you puncture where the end of the arm finishes, for that is visible; and cut that with scissors as we have said."
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	"But if you wish to perform phlebotomy on the median vein, then first at the bend of the arm where you know the pulse point, and hold it in place with your thumb; then lift up the arm and cut through the skin with concave scissors with a sharp point as we have said; and be careful not to strike the artery nearby."
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	"And when you press with strength on that limb and observe swelling in the place where you have pressed with your thumb, know then that it is a swelling of the artery, and therefore avoid it."
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	"And if blood flows during phlebotomy like a child's urine, and it is thin and red, know then that it is arterial blood. And therefore, you should cover your finger with that place for some time; then remove your finger gently, and if the bleeding stops, which often happens, then press on the arm and leave it alone."
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	"And guard the wound of the cut with a cloth, and keep it clean and avoid touching it for some days until it is healed."
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	"But if the blood does not stop flowing, and it seems that you do not have present the appropriate medicine for this, then cut into the artery itself if it is apparent to you. For its extremity will contract and the bleeding will cease. Or take a wisp of lint and press it onto the wound; then take some plaster and apply it; then take one handful of pulverized frankincense and tie it tightly over the place where the vein was cut with linen and cloth for another day."
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	"And therefore if the blood stops flowing, that is good. And if not, then treat it with whatever has been previously mentioned about stopping the flow of blood."
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	"And the cessation of bleeding can be difficult in many cases due to the small size of the vein and the possibility of obstruction by the limb of the arm."
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	"But phlebotomy on the basilic vein is beneficial for removing blood from the upper part of the head and the lower part of the body; because it is composed of branches of the basilica and branches of the cephalica, as we have said."
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	"And therefore, one should be careful during phlebotomy of that vein, because below it is a nerve; and if the nerve becomes attached to the puncture of the phlebotomy, then numbness will occur, and healing will be difficult, and perhaps not complete. And this nerve can often be felt; but in some people it may be hidden and subtle and not apparent. Therefore, you should pause your phlebotomy with which you are performing phlebotomy on that vein, and avoid the nerve with your strength."
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	"And if the vein is between two nerves, then cut across the length of the vein."
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	"The benefit of phlebotomy on the cephalic vein is that it attracts blood from the head and relieves illnesses of the eyes."
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	"And therefore, if you want to perform phlebotomy without damaging the artery or nerve, choose the olive vein or the myrtle vein for phlebotomy."
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	"But nevertheless, you should ensure that when performing phlebotomy, you do not puncture the head of the lizard alone, but rather seek out the lightest spot, and do not touch it unless you have first struck it with percussion several times before performing phlebotomy."
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	"But nonetheless, sometimes inflammation occurs in some people when phlebotomy is performed without percussion first; but this inflammation soon passes."
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	"But the quality of that phlebotomy and its accidents are many, concerning which you should consider their correction."
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	"The first thing you should know is that phlebotomy should only be administered for the preservation of health and with hope of benefit and caution against the occurrence of illnesses. And it should be performed on one of the veins that are in the elbow, namely the cephalic, basilic or median vein; and it should be performed at the beginning of spring, after fasting in spring and autumn, and around meals in winter, when signs of repletion appear."
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	"And phlebotomy should be performed either on the third day or at least three hours after a meal."
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	"But phlebotomy should be administered whenever it is beneficial and necessary, whether night or day, at any hour and at all times."
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	"And children should not be phlebotomized until they are at least fourteen years old, and pregnant women should not be phlebotomized except between the fourth and seventh month; and elderly people who have passed sixty years of age should not be phlebotomized."
