And you should take powdered mortar, which is the ground flour that comes out of the movement of the millstone on the walls of the mill."
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	"And mix it in this way: sieve it with albumen from an egg, and use that mixture without making it too thick or too thin."
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	"Another way to make a poultice for treating fractures and dislocations is: Take asafetida, laudanum, acacia, enula, and mustard, which is the resin of wild mustard, two drachms each; myrrh and aloe, one-half drachm each; alochil, twenty drachms; all are ground and sieved and mixed with bitter almond water or egg white if the condition is scalded. And use this poultice because it has a good composition and restores lightly broken bones, and is suitable for many people."
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	"Another way to make a poultice suitable for fractures and twists is: Take mustard and white lead, two drachms each; myrrh and aloe, one-half drachm each; acacia, six drachms; gum arabic, twenty drachms."
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	"All are ground in a mortar with a mallet and then sieved, mixed with water or egg white, and applied."
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	"A way to make a poultice for joints and separated bones in their places, and when there is accidental pain in those areas and for cracks and fractures: Take clean wool and immerse it in vinegar and hot oil and place it on the location."
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	"But this poultice is not useful for healing, bringing an abscess to a head, or expelling pain properly."
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	"Another way to make a poultice that restores broken bones is: Take fig leaves from the fig tree and leaves of wild poppy. Count them all together and make a poultice of them."
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	"An abbreviated method of administering a poultice for the restoration of bone fractures and when you want to resolve the remnant of an abscess: Take roots of white lead, chamomile flowers, violet flowers, oat flour, all in equal parts; grind them all together and mix with wine if the member is not scaled."
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	"If it is scratched, then cleanse it with warm water infused with coriander or simply warm water."
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method for applying a poultice that is stronger in resolution than the first one, when an abscess occurs during the restoration of the limb: take root of marshmallow and seed of it, and balm, melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, all finely chopped and mixed together; let them be crushed and cooked with water from the oak tree or sweet water or wine, everything according to the quality of the limb and its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Hippocrates does not specify in his book that it should be applied on the member for forty days during its restoration, but rather cerote made from wax and oil and nothing else; and he recommends that it be between thickness and subtlety.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But it is seen that Galen says they should be applied on the broken member during its restoration and the causes in which there is drying with little heat are such as myrrh, incense, and similar to those causes that we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Another way to make a poultice that alleviates injury and pain: take the following finely chopped ingredients and mixed together: wax, celandine, human skin shavings or bird feathers, marshmallow root, and salt; grind them well and sieve them; then cook it to make the poultice.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the quantity of time that it should remain bound according to what is appropriate and when it should be unwrapped depends on whether pain or swelling has occurred or not; if the bone is broken, it is not advisable to remove it from its place too quickly. Therefore, do not untie it for many days unless there is no pain or inflammation.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if great pain or swelling or inflammation occurs at the place, then you should immediately remove it and apply another poultice to that area.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take some linen cloth and sea sponge dampened in hot water, and with that wash the affected area inside until the swelling subsides and the pain is alleviated; then let the limb rest for an hour. Next, apply over it a compress soaked in sour wine and oil or rose oil to help draw out any accumulated pus and reduce inflammation of the limb, ensuring that there is no further pain.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then apply another gentle bandage and small poultice over the first one, tightening it gently until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if at some point the abscess, heat, pain, inflammation, and all other symptoms have been completely alleviated, and you still need to apply a poultice and bandage, then do so in the same manner as you did initially.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no other cause from those that we have mentioned occurs at the limb, then you should not remove the bandage until three or four days have passed; sometimes even up to twenty days depending on how the limb appears when it is unwrapped, as we have said, ensuring that the fracture adheres and comes together with the coagulation of the flesh above it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust the bandage more tightly than the first one, according to how the limb appears when it is unwrapped, and adapt it to the thickness of the swelling of the injured area.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if the area of the fracture becomes dry and emaciated more than necessary, then you should know that nourishment is prohibited from reaching it. Therefore, immerse that area in hot water every time you remove the bandage; do this for three days altogether. Then loosen the bandage a little, which will allow nourishment to reach the limb and promote healing.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what foolish restorers of a fractured limb do when it is not set correctly from the beginning, setting it crookedly according to their own error and causing great fear, this has been greatly condemned by ancient authors in their writings.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen anyone do such a thing, so it is more reasonable that they should not do it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter According to: On fracture when it occurs in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The varieties of fractures are many, and their forms are diverse, and their causes are distinct. For some fractures occur from blows that break the bone entirely into the cavity, leaving the bone like a splinter, which is why this type of fracture is called 'disjointed'; or the blow cuts through part of the bone without cutting through its depth, and this kind of fracture is called 'elevated'.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	The plague of these two fractures is great or small, and [it causes] fracture that is crushed or twisted; the cause of it is blunt impact with little force.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating and approaches the muscle which remains on the bone, or it is located on the surface of the bone, with the plague being large or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And there is a fracture that becomes concentrated within the bone itself, in the finest hairs of the bone, which is why this type of fracture is called 'capillary fracture'.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And there is fracture caused by a blow or impact that forces some portion of the bone into its interior, which happens in concave locations like those of an egg when it receives an impact and its shell breaks inward.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	Especially this occurs in curved bones such as the bones of the head.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	Broken bones of all kinds are weighed down similarly to stars separated from their orbits.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And you shall return everything in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	We recognize all kinds of fractures by detection on them and by inquiry with gentle touches and observation of decayed flesh that is over them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	A capillary fracture is recognized by its appearance on the bone, it is cleaned and rubbed with touch, for where there is a fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the treatment of fractures, one must first consider the accidents of the disease, and then if they occur due to those accidents that have manifest significance, such as vomiting from cholera, extension, loss of consciousness, fainting spells, acute fever, sweating of the eyes and redness of them, and similar appearances in major dispositions.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	But if accidents do not occur frequently, then you await health, but then you begin the treatment of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason for this is that if it has happened to you at the beginning as it was happening and this is during the winter days, then it is necessary that you study the bone structure before the fourteenth day according to all dispositions.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is during the summer days, then you must extract the bone before the seventh day, having ensured that what remains of the bone is corrupted by the paniculum, and that the accidents which have been mentioned occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the paniculum covering the brain and is with small pieces and attrition, then it is necessary that you insert the comminuted fragment and attrition according to what I will recommend to you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And that you shave the head of the patient and uncover the bone according to your custom and manner as much as possible according to the figure of the fracture, so that it is light on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it happens to you that you must perform the detection of the bone, fluxes of blood or a hot abscess, then you must pause for it with what is necessary, and this is that you wash the place with cloths infused in wine and rose oil, and make the fracture rest until the abscess is sedated, and be sure of fluxes of blood; and then immediately begin with the circumcision of the bone and the ablation of it.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this is according to one of two methods of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one method is that you insert the bone with a narrow incision such as this: and immediately administer another incision tool, somewhat wider than the first: and this is its form:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	"And then administer more of the incision powder than the second one."
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	"And it is necessary that you have various incision knives of different lengths, some of which are thicker than others; some of them are sharper than others and are very sharp at their tips, and they are made of iron or steel."
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	"And use them with ease in percussion on the incision to avoid hitting the head and harming it."
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	"And if the bone is strong and hard, then you must first perforate around it before administering the incision knives, which are called non-depth knives."
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	"And they are not called thus because those do not reach the end of the bone where it is appropriate to use them, so that the knife has a rounded tip or edge on that side which is left behind, similar to a small margin or circle, which prevents being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone."
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	"And it is convenient that you take many of these knives, each one suitable for the thickness of each bone, so that in all tests of the brain, the tip is sharp, and its length and width are according to the thickness of this test."
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	"And this is the way of three types of knives:
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	"You are to now cut with the incissors whatever is between each joint of the bone, and you shall gather that thin pus which you can raise by levitation, as we have said before, so that you eradicate the bone, either by hand or by some other cause using certain instruments which you shall have prepared for this purpose, such as tweezers and subtle forceps."
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	"And be sure that the scissors do not touch any part of the skin."
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	"And then when you have circumcised the bone and separated it from the skin if it is continuous with it, you shall extract it, but first scrape and clean that in its roughness which is in the bone with another instrument similar to scissors, but nevertheless ensure that it be thin and subtle."
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	"And if there is any fracture of the small bones and you try to remove them with ease using whatever instrument is necessary, then clean the wound with linens and bandages which we have mentioned."
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	"And another method of operation is light and distant from fear, which Galen describes as worthy of great praise; this is the manner of it: It is necessary for you at the beginning to begin uncovering the fracture of the bone in the place where the break is most evident and manifest, until when you have uncovered that fracture and paused with the end of this gentle and happy scissor which has this shape:"
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	"And the round end is lion-like and does not cut any skin, while the sharp end is like this in two sides lengthwise, thus; so that the round end fits against the skin with the sharp edge striking the bone."
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	"And then strike the scissors with a small hammer on one end until you cut all of the bone with ease as it revolves, and you are certain that the skin does not tear in any way whatsoever, and if the patient is the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, he was asleep."
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	"And then if any skin remains attached to the bone in certain places of the bone, cut that with the round end of the scissors and remove it easily, for it is removed without injury or fear."
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	"And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the skin, and what is cut off or removed from the bone is only its surface, and remains rough and sharp in places, then you must shave that roughness and remove those sharpnesses with subtle razors which you have prepared in different sizes so that it may be possible for you to use them in all places where they are most convenient and straight according to what you perceive the operation of the broken bone and its figure to be."
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	"And you must use in your shaving of the bone at the beginning the widest of those razors, and then immediately use the most subtle of them, and do not cease doing so continually until you have administered to it the thinnest and the most subtle of all."
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	"But in each of those other small capillary fractures and subtle fractures, you must administer care according to what you perceive about their correction."
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	"And it is because not all those who have studied this art agree on this."
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	"And we have shown in large fractures what has been written about this."
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	"And if the skin is torn when you remove the bone, then you must take cloth according to the quantity of the wound and dip it in rose oil and place it on the opening of the wound; and also take another doubled or tripled cloth, dip it in wine and rose oil and place it on the first one and do this as lightly as possible without pressing too hard on the skin; then apply a linen bandage over that and don't pull it too tight but only to the extent that the wound itself requires."
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	"And leave it with this treatment for one or two days until you are sure that the wound is dry and cauterized; then remove it and apply medicines which promote drying, such as linseed oil and powder of iris, and powder of aloe and tragacanth, and others like them."
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	"And if you make these medicines into powders that are finely ground and applied dry to the wound; generally speaking, apply any medicine that has the property of cleansing without biting."
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	"And be sure that the wound in your treatment is kept clean and not covered with grease or anything else; do not let it become infected; because when an infection sets in on the skin of the brain it corrupts it and causes illness, even death."
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	"And if an inflammation occurs on the face of the head, especially after the bone has been exposed and when its treatment is neglected, it appears black on its surface; then consider that if such accidents occur in the illness they are harmful without doubt."
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	"If blackness does not appear on the face but only from the medicine applied to it, and this is due to the virtue of that medicine, then you must take a portion of honey and three portions of rose oil, mix them with linen cloth and apply it to the face; then treat it with the appropriate remedies until it heals."
Capitol .iii.	"Chapter III"
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	"On restoring the nose when it is crushed."
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	"You should know that the nose is not broken except when two parts are crushed simultaneously and raised up, or one of those bones is displaced; because there are two bones in the nose, the left one being made of cartilage and not broken, but only bruised and twisted."
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	"But if one of the two parts is broken, then you must insert your little finger into the nose and reduce the fracture with the tip of your thumb inside and your other fingers outside until the nose returns to its natural shape."
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	"And have this done easily by you, taking care not to cause harm to the patient during the operation."
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	"And if the fracture is in the upper part of the nose and your finger cannot reach it, then you must use the tip of a probe with a small thickness."
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	"And if the fracture is in both parts, then you must perform this same operation on both."
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	"And be careful to restore it on the first day of the fracture if possible; otherwise, wait until the seventh or tenth day after the wound has healed."
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	"And also insert into the tip of the nose a wick made of cloth if the fracture is in one part or two cotton balls if it is in both parts; and they should be as thick as possible to fill the cavity of the nose."
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	"Some of the ancient restorers say that the cotton balls should be wrapped in wool and changed every day, but I have not seen this; however, it is necessary that the wick be wrapped in egg white mixed with powdered mallow; then leave it until the bone has healed and the cartilage has hardened."
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	"Sometimes, instead of cotton balls, it is appropriate to insert pieces of lion's claw into the nose, especially when there is abundant pus and inflammation in the fracture of the nose, provided that the patient can breathe freely."
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	"This method is not necessary for you; if you wish, do this, or if you wish, use cotton balls instead."
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	"And if inflammation occurs again after the wound has healed, plaster the nose with cerote or cotton infused in vinegar and rose oil, or with diachylon."
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	If there is no aposteme, cauterize it first with flour of sesame and powdered earth of iris mixed with egg white; then place a lion's skin on him, and do not allow him to raise his nose for any reason.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	If the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or are comminuted, then you should apply splints to them and extract those that need it using appropriate instruments; then close the wound and treat it with something that adheres and consolidates, and use plasters suitable for that purpose.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	If plague occurs inside the nose, then you should treat it with hot compresses and administer lead cannulae until it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter IV
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the restoration of the jawbone when it is fractured.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the lower jawbone is broken and the fracture is not accompanied by plague, first examine whether the fracture is on the outside only, and whether it is not broken in two and curved inward at its edges. If so, its treatment will be easier.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	Then, if the fracture is on the right side, insert your left index finger into the patient's mouth and similarly for the left side with the right index finger. With this finger, gently push the bone edges together from inside while pressing the outer part of the bone together with your other hand until it becomes evenly aligned.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the jawbone fracture is already separated into two pieces, then you should apply traction to both parts in a straight line until it is possible to achieve alignment.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is commotion and displacement of teeth, then strengthen those that you expect will break with gold or silver wire or thread. Then place a roller bandage on the broken jawbone, and place another roller bandage over it doubled. Then place a large, well-made splint on top, or use a piece of sole leather cut to the length of the jawbone. Then tie everything securely in place according to how you think is appropriate for that application, taking care not to cause further damage.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	Command the patient to rest and avoid physical exertion, and have them take liquids slowly through a straw
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you estimate that the bone has already begun to change shape in some way, then on the third day remove the splint and realign it. Then apply plaster made from powdered brick, egg albumen, or chickpea flour over the splint, taking care to first remove the cerotum. Then place a linen bandage soaked in oil over the plaster.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And when the plaster is well attached and adjusted onto the bone, and there is no further displacement of the bone position, leave it in place until the fracture has healed and strengthened. For many times this fracture becomes solid in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another boil occurs later on, then apply whatever has been mentioned many times in the treatment of it until it is healed and the boil has disappeared.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is accompanied by inflammation, then consider whether it is due to a separated bone fragment or infection. If there are infected areas, then use whatever you think appropriate to remove them using suitable instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	"If the opening of the wound is too narrow, then widen it using forceps according to your needs."
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	"And when you have finished those procedures and there is nothing left to remove, then if the opening of the wound is wide enough; otherwise, apply one of the plasters that are suitable for this purpose and cover it until it heals."
Capitol .v.	"Chapter Five"
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	"The repair of the collarbone when fractured."
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	"Often the clavicle is broken near its middle, and this fracture occurs in one of three ways."
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	"When it is broken or separated, or separated into two parts without accidents, its repair is easy; when it happens as described in these procedures, its repair is difficult; when the fracture has an opening."
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	"And the procedure for this is that when the fracture has no opening, you should have two assistants present: one to hold the broken clavicle in place and the other to extend the neck at that point."
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	"And then approximate the fracture with the aid of those said above until it takes on the correct shape, and is not in too much prominence or concavity."
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	"And if you need more extension, then place the palm of your hand on the sick person's chest with a cloth or wool between them, the size of which should be according to the amount needed; and extend and elevate the clavicle and press the cloth with your hand until the fracture is approximated correctly."
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	"And if you cannot draw the end of the clavicle outwards to its proper position, then have the sick person sit up on their neck and place your palm over the muscle of the right shoulder with sufficient force."
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	"And the assistant should press on the muscle of the shoulder blade until the bone of the clavicle is elevated to its proper position, and then you should reduce the fracture and approximate it with the aid of these said methods."
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	"But if there are spurs on the clavicle that are painful, then you should cut over them and remove those spurs with ease."
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And if it is retained in the bone, then you should make an incision into it with one of the knives that you have brought for this purpose, as you had placed the clavicle on the instrument that serves to hold it; and this instrument is made of wood or iron, and its shape is like this:"
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	"And it resembles a spoon, the concave part of which should be according to your need, depending on the size of the bone or its prominence."
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	"But its length should be according to what is possible for you during the operation; it should have two extremities of this type, one broad and the other narrow."
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	"And if the disruption of the wound that you incised when you removed the spur from the bone is large and you are certain that there will be an abscess, then approximate the two lips of the wound with stitches."
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	"And if the disruption is small or you fear an abscess, then fill the wound with dressings and powders according to the size of the wound."
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	"And if an abscess forms, then soak a cloth in vinegar, rose oil, and wine and place it on it."
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	"But the splint for the bone when it is without wound and section should be made with fine flour paste with egg white, and place it on a linen cloth, and if you need it, then press the palm of your hand over it. Then take a long bandage, about the width of a palm or more, and wrap it around the splint and the cloth, and then sprinkle powdered wax on it. Then take a thin board about three fingers wide and in length similarly, and wrap that in a cloth, and then wrap that cloth with the board over the site of the fracture. Then take a piece of soft linen and fold it in half, and then wrap it around the neck of the splint and the palm of your hand, and then reduce it over all parts, and when the reduction of the fracture is secure, this is what you should not conceal."
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	"And all of this should be done without causing pain to the fractured bone; and you should see the patient every day so that when the linen becomes softened or if you see the splint becoming loose, then you should correct this and tighten the bandage."
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	"And also make the patient sleep on their back and place a small cushion at the level of their shoulder blade during the night so that the assistant's arm is raised to the side and therefore the clavicle fracture is elevated due to the elevation of the muscle; or the patient's arm can be tied to their neck."
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	"And do not remove the bandage unless it happens that there is discharge in the area or an abscess forms within twelve days."
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	"And also renew the plaster if you see it becoming wet in that place, and adjust it to the reduction and restore it and leave it until it is restored and the clavicle fracture has healed."
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	"And it is strengthened and comfortable in about twenty-eight days, but sometimes in some men it can be completed in less time than that."
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Of the Reduction of Shoulder Fracture.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The scapula is fractured on its lateral side and only the margins are broken, not the body itself.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And therefore when it is fractured on its medial side - and it is fractured in the middle of it - and only known by touch, then according to the figure of the fracture you should prepare for it and reduce it according to its natural shape in every way that is possible for you.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And also place powdered flour with egg white and linen cloth on it, and then sprinkle doubled cloth powder on it. Then place a thin board splint according to the size of the whole scapula or a little more on top of it.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if the splint is concave in some parts of the scapula, then you should fill that concavity with linen cloth and place the splint according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And also strengthen it from above with a long bandage with appropriate constriction and firmness of the splint so that it is not removed from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	Check the bandage every day, and whenever it becomes softened, replace it on another occasion and tighten it and adjust the splint if it has been removed from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	Have the patient lie on their side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The scapula is restored in twenty days or in twenty-five days.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And therefore when this number is completed, then you should dissolve the bandage, and know for certain that it is of those bones whose union is not doubted nor their dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed to the site of the humerus and place the elbow outside, then incise it there, leave it open, and do as we have said in the clavicle fracture regarding the treatment of an abscess if one occurs here.
Capitol .vii.	De fractura del colz e de restauracio d’ella.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	"For the restoration of a broken foot."
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	"The foot sometimes breaks in the middle and is displaced; however, its ends are usually intact but crushed."
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	"And when the middle of the foot is broken in an accident, it declines to the sides and causes great pain, difficulty in walking, coughing, fever, and vomiting blood. The fracture is evident in the cavity of the broken bone and is not hidden from sensation."
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	"And for the restoration of it, the patient should be placed on their back and a pillow put between their legs. The muscles of the foot should be pressed upon and the bones adjusted with two hands, taking care in the operation and ensuring that everything is done according to the best possible manner and what is convenient, until the bone returns to its proper figure."
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	"And then apply plaster and cotton wool, and pause on a delicate wooden board or calico cloth, taking care to wrap it in cloth. And take care that it is placed upon the broken bone without moving it; and sometimes bind it around the back with bandages according to its roundness, and strengthen it with appropriate strapping. And also consider the binding at all times, and when it becomes softened, strengthen it."
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	"And if it is necessary to provoke the removal of that [cast], because of corruption or pressure, pain, or an abscess that occurs in the place, then you cut and untie it, remove the plaster, and rectify what has happened there with a healing manner for it. And also reduce the plaster again, sometimes even its face; and adjust the strapping until it is healed."
Capitol .viii.	Capítulo VIII
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	Chapter VIII: On the restoration of the ribs when they are fractured.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	"Know that fractures of the ribs occur only in large spaces that are on the back; and at the extremities of their ends, such breaks do not happen unless it is due to them being cartilaginous."
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	"The discovery of it is not hidden from sensation during its investigation with these tools."
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	"And the restoration should be done in such a way that you align the fracture with these tools according to the most possible manner, ensuring it is aligned properly depending on what is needed, and then apply plaster and strengthen the broken bone with steel if necessary."
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	"And if the fracture of the ribs is displaced at its ends inside, then great pain and puncture will occur for the sick person, like the puncture that occurs in those who have coughed up blood, and because the bone pierces the pleura. And this causes difficulty in breathing, coughing, vomiting of much blood; and this is difficult to cure."
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	"And even the Ancients used this technique with many tools."
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	"And among the things they said is this: whenever foods are given to the sick person that causes inflation and windiness, so that the belly becomes inflated and extended, then the fracture will be pushed towards its ends on the outside."
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	"But we would not recommend this because it could easily lead to an abscess forming if it is not done carefully. And even if it has already happened, then it will help with that."
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	"And some among them said that it is better to remove the wind and then suck strongly with force; this is similar reasoning, but however it is feared that the wind might drive the superfuities to the place through weakness."
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	"And some among them said: whenever the place is covered with wool that has already been immersed in warm oil, and powders are placed between the ribs inside until it is full, then the wrapping should be done as evenly as possible according to its roundness; and then the sick person should be treated with dietary cure and medication for pleurisy."
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	"And if the sick person suffers from severe constriction that cannot be endured, and the bone pierces the pleura with sharp pain, then we fear for the sick person. Therefore we should make an incision over the place, uncover the broken rib, and then place on top of it the instrument called the 'cipher' which was previously mentioned. Then we should carefully insert the bone and remove it."
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	"And then we should join together the two lips of the wound if it is large using sutures, and treat it with plasters inside until it heals."
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	"And if an abscess happens inside, then quickly and gently place powders in rose oil on the place, cover it, and treat the sick person with what is appropriate for an internal abscess."
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	"And let him be propped up on pillows while lying down until he is healed."
Capitol .ix.	"Chapter ix"
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	"A restoration of fracture of the spinal bones of the back and neck."
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	"Sometimes fractures occur in the bones of the neck, and they tend to adhere to each other, similarly to the spinal bones of the back."
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	"And if this happens to someone and you want to know if they will heal or not, then consider this: if sometimes the muscles are already softened, stunned, and dead, and cannot move those parts nor extend them nor straighten them, and when you compress those parts with your fingers or prick them with a needle, they do not feel pain in those parts, then know that it is not healing, and in these conditions it is mortal."
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	"And if those parts move and feel compression with your fingers or puncture, then know that the spinal cord is saved and the illness will recover with treatment."
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	"And if you see similar symptoms in the bones of the neck, then consider their weight."
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	"Now if you see that they are already softened, it has happened to those parts what happens in the muscles, and especially when lying on their back, there is shortness of breath and excretion without control, and sometimes they are suddenly reversed on their back and want to urinate but cannot, then know that it is mortal, and therefore do not bother with its treatment."
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	"But if none of these things happens, the condition is better and easier to treat."
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	"And the treatment for this is that you should apply a poultice made of hot cabbage leaves, smeared with honey and oil or crushed mulberries, and place it on the affected bone. Repeat this application several times a day until the swelling is reduced."
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	"And then apply one of the comforting and heating plasters, and tie it on tightly. Command the patient to rest and remain calm, and not to sleep on the side where they feel pain until they are healed."
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	"And if it happens that the bone is fractured or some other cause has already separated from it, then you should dry it with a bandage and expose the bone. Then join together the two lips of the wound with stitches if it is large, and treat it with a liniment of henbane until it heals."
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	"But if it is the end of the bone that has broken off, then you should insert your left thumb into the anus and grasp the broken bone with your other hand according to its position. Then apply a poultice and plaster, and bind it tightly."
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	"And if you feel that there are broken pieces within the wound, then remove them and clean out the wound. Then treat it with the previously mentioned treatment until it heals."
Capitol .x.	"Chapter .10"
De restauracio de la ancha.	"On the restoration of a tooth."
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	Bone fractures in wide joints are broken, and if they break, the fracture of them is only a communion at the ends of those and are inserted into the length and decline towards the inside; and it happens to the patient pain in that place and puncture, and the limb becomes stunned when it's fractured.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And its restoration is that you stretch your hand over that side which is above the fracture which is its shape.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is only at the end of it, then you should align that according to what appears appropriate for equating an entry that is assembled to its natural figure.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is in the long bone or one that already declines towards the inside, then you should make the patient lie on their belly so that you can prepare for the restoration of that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And then once you have aligned it, pause on that plaster, and also pause on that stick of wood or bone, and stretch with strictness over the one where there is no fear of puncture from fracture nor displacement of the splint.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And align the concavity with whatever you use to fill that entry so that it takes on the correct structure, and command the patient to sleep on their back or on their side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	But if an abscess forms, then you should cease the extension and restoration of it until the abscess is sedated, and pause on whatever sedates that according to what has been preceded. Then return to the restoration of it, and stretch it as is necessary.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if this happens in the bone, then you should extract them.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of a fracture of the ankle joint.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	"Aid is required between the neck and the top of the shoulder."
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	"And if it is broken, the restoration of it is done in one of two ways, of which one way is that you take a piece of plaster of moderate thickness and apply it thus:"
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	"And there should be attached at both ends two ligatures, and nearby suspended from the elevated location."
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	"Then place the patient on a chair; and nearby, gently place their broken arm on a flat surface so that it reaches its elbow in the middle of where the curvature of the bone is attached."
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	"And then suspend some weight above that, or the attendant should extend it towards the sides; and immediately the physician should apply the fracture with his hands together, so that the fracture returns as necessary."
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	"The other way is that the patient should be propped up on their neck and suspend the arm at the elbow with a ligature, and then command two attendants: one of them should hold what is above the fracture with his hands; and the other should hold below it; and each of them should extend to their respective side."
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	"And if you wish the extension to be stronger, then strain over the fracture with a ligature and over that again with another ligature, and each of the two attendants should extend to their respective sides."
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	"And if the fracture is close to the extremity of the muscle, then it is necessary that half of the ligature should be placed on the elbow and the other half below the fracture near the joint."
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	"And similarly, if the fracture is close to the joint, then it is necessary that the ligature should be placed over that location and over that joint."
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	"Then place it gently and without difficulty, and immediately when it is placed according to what is necessary and applied with a good application, then strain it so that it does not happen that an ulcer forms."
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	"But if an ulcer forms, then leave the bandage on for up to seven days, and place over it a clean lint soaked in warm water and rose oil until the ulcer has healed, and then strain it."
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	"And the way to strain it is: place plaster over the fracture, and then wrap a clean napkin over the plaster; and then adjust the arm on that support, and place his hand covered over his muscle."
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	"And then wrap the cloth and strain the arm on that support so that the arm is in a stable position, unless some cause prevents it due to the broken bone."
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	"And then use splints."
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	"And then place over the fracture that splint which is wider and stronger than the others; and place between each splint the width of a finger, and let the length of the splints be according to the break with an addition of three fingers on either side."
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	"And then strain over the splints with the bandage which was mentioned at the beginning of this chapter."
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	"And ensure that your bandage is as tight as possible around the location of the fracture."
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	"And when the fracture has been reduced, then make the bandage looser."
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	"And therefore if you see that the situation of the splints and the bandage is as we have said in the time when you restore the limb to its proper position, then do it."
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if you fear an ulcer forming, then leave the bandage and splints on for up to seven days as we have said."
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	"And also consider the ligature in all cases for three days so that there is no pressing or inflammation at the location; otherwise, the food may not reach the limb due to an excess of tightness; therefore correct everything as we have said."
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	"But if you are in doubt that nothing will happen because of it, then do not remove the ligature for less than three days or more."
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	"And let his sleeping place be on his back, and let his hands be placed on his stomach."
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	"And place over the cooking stove full of wool on which to rest the limb, and consider at all times of night or day that the figure of the broken limb is not displaced nor dissolved, otherwise if the ligature becomes moist then correct everything with your own judgment."
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	"And give the sick person their food according to the order which we have mentioned earlier, ensuring that the food is subtle at the beginning until straining begins, and then it is necessary that you thicken the food for him."
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	"The custom of the splint and bedding is that they should be strained for forty days, and then it is necessary that they are removed and a bath administered, and treated with ointments which correct it."
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	"And if the fracture is laid bare, then do not remove the ligature and splints for up to ten days or up to two months."
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	"On the restoration of fractures of the arm."
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	Brace is composed of two bones called radii; one is small and touches the said thumb, the other is large and is placed next to the small radius on its outer side.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	When only the larger radius breaks, or when both break together.
