E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of its dislocation is that you place the hand joint of the sick person on a table and the physician extends his hand towards him, placing his palm or his fingers on the prominence of the joint, and pushes it until it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, it is necessary to consider if the palm has already been dislocated onto the front of the hand, then the sick person should place the back of his hand on a table with his fingers extended and the reduction performed. But if the dislocation is posterior, then the position of his hand should be placed internally on the table, so that the physician's hand may cover the prominence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	"And thus if it returns soon, good. But if not, then immediately press with an embankment to drain the abscess and leave that; and do not repeat this, for if you do, neither will it suffer nor can you achieve reduction of the pus over time."
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	"But in any case cut through the Roman join according to its tortuosity; and do not reveal any cause to the patient, but that your hand is tired and cannot grip anything; however you know that the nerves are pressed or torn, and therefore heat it with a cautery near its exit and then give some reason for this."
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	"Therefore when the pain returns, then pause over the embankment that we have recommended, and let it be left and pressed for seven days; and afterwards it shall be released and let it alone, and his hand exercised."
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	"But if the movement of it is obstructed and there occurs in it any gravity, then use that with cold water and friction several times until it is alleviated."
Capitol .xxix.	"Chapter XXIX."
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	"Concerning the treatment of dislocation of these joints."
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	"Some times these are completely dislocated."
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	"And when some of these fingers are dislocated at the back of the palm or at the front of it, then seize the finger and push the dislocation back with your thumbs until it returns."
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	"And afterwards support the head of the finger, and suspend that above the part where it is dislocated, and let it alone for two days."
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	"And afterwards suspend that and extend it until it is completely healed within that day."
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	"And when it is not completely healed, then apply that according to the said narrative, and do not cease to release it during the day and exercise it with movement, and bind it at night; and do this for several days until it is firm."
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	"And do likewise if it is dislocated at the front of the hand, and bind that at that articulation and perform with it your first operation until it is healed."
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	"And do likewise in this manner when it is dislocated at other articulations."
Capitol .xxx.	"Chapter XXX."
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	"Concerning the treatment of dislocation of the vertebrae of the back."
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	"When there occurs at some of the vertebrae of the back or neck a complete dislocation, and several vertebrae are removed from their places, then in that case there is no cure, for death quickly overtakes the sick person."
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	"And a sign of this is that the evacuation of the sick person is involuntary and he cannot retain it; and many times some members of him are paralyzed or both arms of him or both legs of him, or one of those; or one vertebra is removed from its place, for many times several are removed and many times the dislocation occurs in four directions."
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	"Therefore that is already removed from its posterior articulations and is called 'gibbosity'."
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	"But the treatment of it is that then you should consider if the gibbosity occurs in childhood, for then there is no cure nor is there salvation from all."
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	"But concerning those which occur through compression or percussion or in similar manner to those, the Ancients have already described the methods of treatment at length, from which the greater part returns with profit; but I have already abbreviated that of which little excuses the multitude of it, due to my proximity to the intention of this exposition, with which I have briefly explained and formed various instruments for demonstrating this and expounding it."
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	"And I say that in gibbosity which occurs at the anterior part of the foot there is neither relief nor salvation for it; and similarly in that which is made on both sides."
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	"And only those are cured which occur properly at the back with what I have counted."
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	"And that the sick person should be placed on his face with his neck bent near to a wall, and be supported from below with soft cushions so that he is not harmed in his feet."
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	"And place a straight stick horizontally, put it on the ground at the end of the neck around the head of the sick person, and another stick under his feet at the other end of the foot."
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	"And let one assistant hold the stick, and it should not be fixed in a socket; and another assistant should hold the other according to that form."
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	"And wrap around the head of the sick person and tie it on tightly with linen and extend the end of the linen to the stick which is above his head, and bind that there; and then stretch the other linen over his hips down to his knees, and place that against his thighs; and then adjust all the linens and bind them onto the other stick which is above his feet."
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	"And then each assistant should extend the linen to the part of the stick and let not the two sticks and the linens of their places be removed from where they are placed, but nevertheless they should not be fixed in that way as we have said."
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	"And the physician should place his palms on the vertebra with strength until it returns, or he may place a table there and then adjust his feet on the table until it returns."
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	"But if it does not return by this method, then take a table whose width or length is about three braccia and hollow out in the wall which we have said is near to the sick person a place into which the end of the table can fit."
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	"And then place the middle of the table on the vertebra, and the physician should place his feet on the other end, and stretch well until the vertebra is compressed and returns to its place."
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	"And if you wish, open with a twist using the hand; and this is how you should do it: lie down on the ground in front of the head of the sick person between the two sticks whose length is one braccio, and place your feet between the two sticks similarly; and let the distance between each stick be one palm, and already made in each stick is a hole through which the cord passes, and let each be firmly fixed to the ground so that it is not moved."
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	"And place a round stick on which is the cord, and let it be turned in the two holes of the two sticks."
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	"And on one end of it is a hole in which the stick is formed, whose length is one palm with what is turned; and the two other sticks have something similar to that."
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	"And then stretch the linens which you have stretched on the foot of the sick person in the hole which is above his head, and the linens which you have stretched on his buttocks in the cord which is above his feet."
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	"And then above each cord let there be an assistant who turns the cord with his hand, and the physician should press the vertebra as we have said."
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	"And this is the form of the twist:"
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	"And then when the vertebra has returned and the place is closed, it is necessary that you should place a poultice with alum of chalk and lint; and then place on the poultice a piece of cloth from a table whose width is three fingers or thereabouts, and whose length is about as much as the place where the gibbosity occurs."
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	"And then bind it with linen as we have said, and feed the sick person on soft food until he is healed."
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	"And if there is any inflammation remaining in the place at the end of healing, it is necessary that medicines which soften and cleanse be administered with application of the table for a long time, as we have recommended; and a lead plate should already be applied to that place."
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	"And sometimes inflammation occurs in the back of the hipbones due to that dislocation; and it is that bone which is already inclined toward ruin, so that this medicine should not be applied to it, because much harm could come to you from it."
Capitol .xxxi.	"Chapter 31."
De curacio de anca dislocada.	"On treating a dislocation of the hip."
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	"You should know that the junction of the hip and the junction of the muscle only suffer dislocation alone, not those with small movement and concavity."
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	The hip joint is dislocated in four ways: either inward or outward, forward or backward.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	It is most commonly dislocated inwardly and less frequently anteriorly or posteriorly.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	The sign of inward hip dislocation is that when you press the healthy limb against the affected one, it feels longer and more prominent than the healthy one; the patient cannot flex their thigh and has to be guided by another person who takes hold of the dislocated limb to reduce it.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The sign of outward hip dislocation is that its symptoms are opposite those of inward dislocation.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The sign of anterior hip dislocation is that when the patient extends their limb fully, they cannot flex it without pain and cannot walk with the affected leg in front; urine retention and an abdominal mass are also present. The patient walks with a limp and supports themselves on their heel.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	The sign of posterior hip dislocation is that the patient cannot extend or flex their limb at the hip; the affected leg appears shorter than the other and the buttock feels flaccid. The main feature is pain in the groin region.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	However, reduction of the different types of hip dislocation should be considered if the dislocation is chronic and old, as it may have become fixed in a certain position. In such cases, traction should be applied according to the specific position of the limb, but not all cases require reduction. If reduction is attempted and fails, no further manipulation should be made at that time.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	In cases of recent hip dislocation, one must first reduce the joint and then extend the limb at the hip both anteriorly and posteriorly. This should be done gently on both sides as the reduction may be completed by simple traction without further manipulation being necessary.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	If reduction is not achieved by simple traction, then a strong and continuous traction should be applied to the limb from below or by elevating it on pillows. The other assistant should hold the patient's hand above their head while another pulls gently on the distal end of the limb. A third assistant may apply gentle counter-traction at the hip joint using a bandage wrapped around the thigh and held firmly in place.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	The limb should be extended or traction applied internally from the anterior hip to the greater trochanter or externally from the posterior hip to the lesser trochanter.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	All of these reductions should be done in one attempt while the patient is lying on their back with their buttocks just over the edge of the table, so that they are hanging down.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	This method of reduction is common to all four types of hip dislocation.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	If the hip dislocation is reduced using the method described above, then that is sufficient. However, if it is not reducible by closed methods, then specific treatment for each type of dislocation will be necessary.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	For the closed reduction of an anterior hip dislocation, the patient should be placed on their side with the affected limb up. A bandage is wrapped around the thigh and held firmly at the point between the greater trochanter and the head of the femur. Traction is then applied to the leg in a direction from the anterior aspect of the greater trochanter towards the anterior superior iliac spine.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	Another assistant should firmly grasp the patient's arms and push their body away from the affected hip while applying strong traction to the leg externally. This may help reduce the dislocation as it allows the femoral head to slip back into its socket.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	This method is the easiest and most common way to reduce an anterior hip dislocation.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	If the hip dislocation cannot be reduced by closed methods alone, then both of the patient's legs should be elevated simultaneously with gentle traction using two assistants. One assistant holds each leg just above the ankle and pulls gently while the other supports the buttocks from below to keep them elevated.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	Each leg should be elevated about 4 digits ( approximately 10 cm) and the affected limb extended an additional 2 digits (approximately 5 cm) more than the other.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	The patient should then be suspended by their arms from a traction apparatus or pulley system while lying on their back. The affected limb should be extended with gentle traction until the limb is approximately 24 inches (60 cm) off the ground.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	A strong assistant should then grasp the affected leg just above the knee and apply gentle traction while another assistant applies counter-traction to the body by pulling gently on the waist. As this is done, the hip dislocation should reduce spontaneously with a characteristic "clunk" as the femoral head returns to its socket.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	For the closed reduction of an posterior hip dislocation, the patient should be placed in the lateral position with the affected side up as previously described. The assistant should then grasp the leg just above the ankle and apply gentle traction while applying counter-traction to the body by pushing the opposite shoulder gently towards the table.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	Two vertical posts should be placed on either side of the patient's leg. The posts are connected by a horizontal bar that is positioned over the affected hip and used to apply traction. A padded U-shaped bar can be inserted into this frame to keep the posts from slipping out of place during traction. Wet towels should be wrapped around the post and bar to prevent skin irritation or burns due to friction.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	Each assistant should then apply gentle traction to their respective side while the surgeon uses one hand to guide the reduction of the dislocation according to the technique being used.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if the hip dislocation is not reducible by closed methods alone, gentle traction should be applied according to the principles of gelboze reduction as previously described.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	However, it is important that the patient lies quietly during the procedure and does not move around excessively.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	For hip dislocations that are anterior and inferior (obturator type), gentle traction should be applied to the leg with the patient lying on their back. The surgeon places one hand on the affected greater trochanter and uses the other hand to grasp the thigh just proximal to the patella. Traction is then applied by adducting and extending the leg at the hip while maintaining flexion of the knee.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	For posterior hip dislocations, the patient should not be placed in extension as this can cause further displacement of the femoral head. Instead, the patient should be positioned on their back with a pillow or firm support under the affected buttock to elevate the hip slightly. The leg is then positioned in slight abduction and external rotation with the knee flexed, similar to the position used for shoulder dislocations. Gentle traction may be applied if necessary, but this should not cause pain or discomfort to the patient.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	Additionally, compression should be applied using a bolster placed between the ilium and ischium on the affected side where the hip joint was located. This can help stabilize the reduced dislocation and prevent redisplacement.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	After successful reduction of the hip dislocation, the surgeon should extend both legs and observe for signs of instability. The patient is then turned on their unaffected side while a spica cast is applied to maintain the reduced position and prevent redisplacement. The patient should be kept at bedrest for 3-4 days until follow-up X-rays confirm maintenance of reduction.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	After 3-4 days, the spica cast and traction device are removed, and the leg lengths should be checked by comparing the lengths of both legs from the anterior superior iliac spine to the medial malleolus.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if no instability is appreciated on examination under anesthesia, the patient can be allowed to bear weight as tolerated.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	However, if any signs of instability are noted during examination under anesthesia, the patient should be re-casted in slight traction for 3-4 days before allowing weight-bearing again.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Approximately, it means: 'And then untie that one, and make them stay in bed for several days until they are recovered.'
Capitol .xxxii.	'Chapter XXXII'.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	'On the treatment of dislocation of the jaw.'
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The jaw is dislocated in three ways: it can be dislocated towards the outside, towards the inside, or more commonly towards the back. It is not usually dislocated towards the front.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	"The sign of dislocation in this case is when you tell the patient to press their knee against something, and then you know that it has been dislocated."
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	"To restore the dislocation of this knee, you should make the patient sit on their right side so that they can extend their leg if possible; then attach your left hand to the front of their thigh and place your foot between theirs. Quickly bring your right palm behind their kneecap, hold it firmly with both hands, and another servant should extend their foot inward until the kneecap returns to its proper position."
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	"The sign of reduction of this dislocation is when the knee joint adheres firmly with light effort."
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	"And afterwards plaster that and make the knee adhere firmly with the joint, and also bandage it tightly with a bandage for three or four days, and then unbind it."
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	"And do not allow the patient to walk around for several days until they are healed and comfortable."
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	"If reduction of it by you is excused, then administer strong extension with linen strips, which were mentioned in the previous narration of hip joint treatment."
Capitol .xxxiii.	"Chapter XXXIII."
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	"On the Treatment of Ankle Dislocation."
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	"The talus sometimes becomes displaced due to slight movement, and sometimes becomes dislocated completely, and this dislocation occurs either on the inner or outer side."
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	"And the sign of talus dislocation is that often the talus becomes swollen at the site where it has dislocated."
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	"But the treatment for displacement of the talus is gentle reduction, and this is done by extending it gently with the hands until it returns to its proper place."
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	"But in the treatment of complete talus dislocation, it is necessary that the patient lies on their back and that they have a strong and reliable assistant standing behind them at the middle point of the dislocation."
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	"And then place your right hand above the upper part of the foot and your left hand below the foot at the level of the ankle."
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	"And then traction is applied with the right hand on the foot and with the left hand for two times, after which the left hand extends [the foot], and with the right hand pushes the heel up without turning it."
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	"And this should be done twice as we have described."
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	"And then on the third attempt, push the heel up again until you reach the ankle joint."
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	"So if [the talus] returns in one or two attempts with this method, and if the foot is swollen, that is good; but if not, then repeat the procedure until it returns."
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	"But if reduction of the talus with this method is prohibited, then have the patient lie on their side on the ground, and use a sturdy stick placed firmly on the ground to wedge between the two sides of the dislocation, and then wrap them up in cloth for fear of frightening the patient."
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	"And then the assistant holds their part [of the dislocation], and another assistant extends the foot with their hands or with a bandage placed on the neck of the foot; and each assistant extends in turn, while pushing the stick firmly between the two sides of the patient to prevent the body from being pulled towards the side of the extension."
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	"And then the physician reduces the dislocation with his hands, and another assistant holds the healthy part on the outside to prevent the dislocation from returning."
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	"And thus when the dislocation returns and it is declared that the reduction has been achieved, then apply plasters and bind [the foot] strongly with bandages, and tie the foot with bandages at the heel."
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	"And be careful or guard against the nerves which are behind on the talus, so that the bandage is not too tight and does not hurt them severely."
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	"And then leave him for two or three days; and if the bandage has softened, remove it."
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	On the third or fourth day, untie him, and forbid the patient from vomiting for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is forced to go ahead of that space, it cannot be guaranteed that the dislocation has not been dissolved and corrupted, and thus it would not receive treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if an ulcer forms from the cautery, you should then apply what is described above in our narrative, in another place for treatment and embrocation, until it is removed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter XXXIV
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the treatment of dislocation of the said hips.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	It is necessary that he who has been dislocated be wrapped with little extension without moving him; and it is not difficult, carefully doing so.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in some knots of the two thighs, you should then have the patient place his sick leg over something on the ground or on a table, and let him be thus as if he were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand on the leg, and place your foot over what you have indicated of the joints, and then press that with your foot with strength until it returns, and make sure that it is wrapped and does not appear again in its prominence.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then place the leg of that side on a table that takes all the leg, which should have two heads, and then stretch it with proper and firm bandages for three days; and then untie it and let him rest from walking for more days until he is strengthened and recovery is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	"Types of dislocation caused by plague or fracture or any injury."
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	"When such causes occur, if you attempt the cure and restoration of it, often death succeeds."
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	"And therefore one should not presume about the cure of it unless he is knowledgeable in this art, experienced, merciful and compassionate, cautious, not reckless or presumptuous; and that from the beginning [he uses] medicines that only cauterize wounds, leaving the patient to divine judgment and hoping for salvation from destruction, with alleviation of the illness, where there appears some hope."
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	"And then strive quickly to reduce it at the beginning of the cause before an ulcerous wound forms."
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	"And then if the limb returns as desired, immediately administer treatment that will prevent ulceration and heal the inflammation with whatever is suitable for it from drying ointments."
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	"And if dislocation with fracture occurs and the ends of the bone are separated, then you should perform their reduction and do in this what we have said previously about simple dislocations as described above."
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	"And guard and avoid, according to your ability, that which is within the paths of fear as much as you are able; for this is better for you to owe to your Creator, and more lasting to your glory, and more helpful to your true body in your time."
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	"So ends the words of Al-Bukhastis perfectly, may God bless them."
Amen.	"Amen."
